loans.name: Norma

texts.en:
Norma is 60 years old and lives with her family in the town of Banga in South Cotabato. She is a farmer and has been planting and harvesting rice crops for the past 12 years. Using her income from the farm, she opened a sari-sari store and also started growing pigs. Norma hopes for success in the fields she ventured into.

Norma joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Norma has successfully repaid a previous loan  from CEVI. She is requesting a new loan of 10000 PHP, which will be used to buy fertilizers, piglets and additional merchandise to sell. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers, piglets, and merchandise to sell

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria B. is from the village of Magsaysay Baliangao Misamis Occidental. She is 50 years old. Maria is married and has 2 adult children. To make a living, Maria owns and operates a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling native wine products in the local community. Maria has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 2000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2009, Maria joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Maria has successfully repaid a previous loan of 6000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase additional inventory and  to fund working capital. 

Maria is requesting a new loan of 7000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the fifth loan taken out by Maria from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family's income. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase products to sell

loans.name: Hor

texts.en:
Hor C. was born in 1971. She currently lives in Kompong Thom Province. Hor C. earns a living by raising pigs in a pigpen behind her house. She raises them both for their offspring and for slaughter. She has a life partner in her husband who earns a daily income by running a motor taxi in and around his community. They have three children, all of whom are single, and they also work with their mother in pig rising. 

Their existing motorbike which her husband uses to run his taxi service has recently broken down very often in the course of his motor taxi work. In order to support her husband’s business, Hor C. will use her loan funds to buy a used motorcycle to replace the broken one. This loan will help her family achieve stability with their financial resource.

loans.use: To buy a used motorcycle to replace their broken one

loans.name: Jennifer

texts.en:
We do not need to make a lot of mistakes before learning.  At the age of 39, Jennifer learns the ways of both business and life to get ahead.  She is a high school graduate and is happily married to Joseph P., a tricycle driver.  They lived in Habitat, Baseco, Manila.

Jennifer has been managing the operation of their tricycle business for the past two years. She rents out one unit to another driver and earns at least Php200 a day.  Joseph drives their other unit.  Aside from driving, he also repairs motorcycles and bicycles in the community.  From this work, Jennifer and Joseph earn an estimated minimum of Php700 per day.

To help her grow her business, Jennifer would like to request for a Php9,000 loan. She will use this money to buy spare parts (such as tires) to maintain their tricycle units.  She will also use part of this loan to purchase other materials needed for their cycle repair business.

Jennifer does not emphasize any challenges encountered in her life but rather focuses on solutions and acts on them.  Living a simple and practical life, she wants a strong family foundation and an active spiritual life.  She prays that in God's time, they will be blessed with their own baby.  

As CCT community partner, she faithfully attends their weekly fellowship* meeting, where she can also gain strength and inspiration from the Word of God she received.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: spare parts for the maintenance of their two tricycle units

loans.name: Elvira

texts.en:
Elvira C. is from the village of Mialen Clarin in Misamis Occidental. She is 39 years old. Elvira is married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Elvira owns and operates a motor transport service. Elvira has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 10000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2004, Elvira joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Elvira has successfully repaid a previous loan  from GDMPC. She is requesting a new loan of 20000 PHP, which will be used to repair a vehicle for better service. This loan will be the third loan taken out by Elvira from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's general living condidtions.  

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to repair existing vehicle for better service

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en:
Lucy W. is a married lady with two children, whom she hopes to educate to the university level. Her business is located at Changamwe estate in Mombasa, Kenya. Mombasa is the coastal region of Kenya and is well known for its many tourist attraction sites and the white beaches of the Indian ocean. 

Lucy sells charcoal to the local people, a business she has been engaged in for the last two years. She also sells shawls to augment the income she gets from the charcoal business. She says that this business is profitable and the major challenge she has is financial constraints. However, she works very hard from early morning to late evening to keep her business doing well. 

Lucy is using her loan of Kes 20,000 to buy charcoal to expand her business. She hopes to be a wholesaler in the future. She describes herself as an ambitious lady.

loans.use: To buy charcoal to resell

loans.name: Jean Bosco

texts.fr: Jean Bosco N. est conducteur de taxi-voiture, et client d’ACB depuis 2010.  Il est marié, et il a une éducation d’école secondaire.  Il a 4 enfants entre 5 ans et 12 ans, et tous vont à l’école.  Il va utiliser son prêt pour l’achat de la peinture pour la voiture, assurance, et autorisation de transport et contrôle de sa taxi-voiture.  Sa stratégie pour la croissance de l’affaire est de développer son business en achetant beaucoup ou une autre taxi-voiture.  Il voudrait accroitre son affaire et devenir un taximan de haut niveau.  Il voudrait assurer le bien-être de sa famille, et payer les frais d’études pour ses enfants.  Pour gagner plus de revenu, Jean Bosco et aussi élévateur des vaches.
texts.en: Jean Bosco N. is a taxi driver and a client of ACB since 2010. He is married. He has completed secondary education. He has four children between 5 and 12 years of age, all of whom are in school. He is going to use his loan in order to purchase car paint, insurance, permit and registration for his taxi. His strategy is to grow his business by purchasing in bulk or by getting a second taxi cab. He would like to expand his business and to become a high-class  taxi driver. He would like to provide for the well-being of his family and to pay for the schooling of his children. In order to increase his income, Jean Bosco also raises cattle.

loans.use: Purchasing car paint, insurance, permit and registration for his taxi cab

loans.name: Thelma

texts.en:
Thelma C. is from the town of Banga in South Cotabato. She is 52 years old. Thelma is married and has 9 children. Three of her children still go to school. 

To make a living, Thelma runs a business raising livestock for fattening and sale. She also owns and manages a sari-sari store, and spends time at the farm with her husband to keeping an eye on their rice crops.

Thelma joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Thelma has successfully repaid a previous loan  from CEVI. Thelma is requesting a new loan of 10000 PHP, which will be used to purchase fertilizers, piglets and additional merchandise to sell. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers, piglets and merchandise to sell

loans.name: Alla

texts.en:
Alla is a farmer from Gladkovka. She is married with a young son  – Konstantin. Alla grows early spring radish, tomatoes and cucumbers in greenhouses for sale in the markets of Kherson and the neighboring regions. She has been in this business for 7 years and has already invested about 100,000 Grivnyas in it. Her net profit amounts to 3,000 Grivnyas a month. 

Alla is seeking a loan of 10,000 Grivnyas to purchase seeds, wood, plastic film and fertilizers for her greenhouses. She is planning to protect her plants with a new layer of polyethylene film, stabilize the temperatures inside the greenhouses with more wood for the heating units, and use good quality fertilizers to ensure timely and ripe harvests.  These investments will bring Alla a stable income.

loans.use: To purchase seeds, plastic film, wood and fertilizers for greenhouses

loans.name: Rudilina

texts.en:
Rudilina M. is from the village of Poblacion 2 Clarin in Misamis Occidental. She is 46 years old. Rudilina is married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Rudilina owns and operates a business providing  motor transport service. Rudilina has been engaged in her business for over 1 year and earns approximately 15000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2011, Rudilina joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Rudilina is requesting a new loan of 30000 PHP, which will be used to repair her vehicle to provide better service. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Rudilina from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's general living conditions. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To repair vehicle

loans.name: Ruth

texts.fr: Ruth U.  est commerçante, et client d’ACB depuis 2010.  Elle est mariée, née a Rwanda, et elle a fini 6 sans d’école secondaire.  Elle a 3 enfants entre 7 ans et 11 ans, et tous vont à l’école.  Elle va utiliser son prêt pour acheter 12 basins moins chère, 5 draps, 1 couvre-lit, 7 pantalons de fille, 10 pantalons d’hommes et transport.  Sa stratégie pour la croissance de l’affaire est l’augmentation de quantités vendues, et recherche d’autres marchés.  Elle voudrait devenir grossiste, et s’autofinancer.  Elle voudrait aussi payer les frais d’études pour ses enfants, et assurer le bien-être de sa famille.
texts.en: Ruth U. is a trader and has been a customer of ACB since 2010. She is married, born in Rwanda, and she completed six years of secondary school. She has three children between the ages of seven and eleven, and they are all at school. She is going to use her loan to buy twelve pieces of cheaper damask fabric, five sheets, one bed cover, seven pairs of girls' trousers, ten pairs of mens' trousers and transport. Her strategy for expanding her business is to increase the quantities of goods she sells and to look for other good deals. She would like to become a wholesaler and be able to finance herslef. She would also like to pay her children's studying costs and provide for her family's well-being.

loans.use: Purchase of twelve pieces of cheaper damask fabric, five sheets, one bed cover, seven pairs of girls' trousers, ten pairs of mens' trousers and transport

loans.name: Gemma

texts.en:
Gemma C., 44, is an entrepreneur with a knack for multitasking. She is a therapist/masseuse and a retailer of various products, and found success in both fields. Gemma raised her 2 kids alone.  She works hard to meet their family needs.  They presently live in Habitat, Baseco Port Area, Manila.

Being in the business of selling food to supplement her income, Gemma has developed the skills to choose quality products and deal with people in the neighborhood to turn them into regular customers. She also sells these items to her massage customers.   Her regular customers are her neighbors, the community, and other business connections. Monthly, she earns an average net income of Php11,800.  

Gemma wants to maximize her potential as a multitasking entrepreneur. To help her do that and grow her businesses, she is requesting a loan of Php10,000. She plans to use this fund to increase the number of products she sells in order to better meet the specific needs of her regular customers. 

Sure enough, Gemma has her share of customers who do not pay on time. Nevertheless, she still prays for the ability to collect their payments. All this multitasking is a means of preparing for the multi-faceted future which she wants her two children to have.

As CCT community partner, she faithfully attends to their weekly fellowship* meeting where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she received.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To buy herbal medicines and food supplements to sell

loans.name: Emma

texts.en:
Emma J. is from the village of Poblacion,  Sapang Dalaga, Misamis Occidental. She is 47 years old. Emma is married and has 1 school-aged child. To make a living, Emma owns & operates a business making & selling food. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from making and selling breads, candies and cookies to the local community. Emma has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 8000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2010, Emma joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Emma has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase additional inventory & to fund working capital. 

Emma is requesting a new loan of 9000 PHP, which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. This loan will be the third loan taken out by Emma from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family's income. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase raw ingredients to make food for sale

loans.name: Samila

texts.fr: Samila M. est commerçante, et client d’ACB depuis 2010.  Elle est mariée, née a Rwanda, et son niveau d’éducation est A2.  Elle a 4 enfants entre 4 et 13 ans, et 3 de ses enfants vont à l’école.  Elle va utiliser son prêt pour acheter 15 basins, 20 pantalons et 2 couvre-lits.  Sa stratégie pour la croissance de l’affaire est d’accroitre son capital a fin d’avoir plus de rentabilité.  Elle voudrait être grossiste, éduquer ses enfants et avoir le bien-être de sa famille.
texts.en:
Samila M. is a merchant and has been a client of ACB since 2010. She is married, was born in Rwanda, and has an A2 level of education.  She has four children, ages 4 to 13, and three of them go to school.  

Samila is going to use her loan to buy 15 basins, 20 pairs of pants, and 2 bed covers.  Her strategy for growing her business is to increase her capital in order to be more profitable.  She would like to be a wholesale merchant, to educate her children, and to have a happy and healthy family.

loans.use: Buying clothing, basins, pants, and bed covers

loans.name: Sos

texts.en:
Sos S., 39 years old, is a humble villager living in the capital, Phnom Penh, in the middle of Cambodia. Sos S. is a housewife who stays at home in order to do her daily duties such as cooking a nice meal, cleaning house, washing clothes, and so on around her house. She is married and blessed with five children, while her husband is a fisherman as well as a recycled goods seller. 

Her husband always picks up the products to sell by using his motorbike. Unfortunately, his existing motorbike has often broken down during use. Because of that, Sos S. has decided to seek a loan of $500 from Kiva, which she will use to exchange the broken motorcycle for her husband.

loans.use: To exchange the broken motorcycle necessary for her husband's recycled goods business

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia L. is from the town of Banga. She is 45 years old. To make a living, Virginia raises crops,  planting and harvesting rice for sale. 

Virginia joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Virginia has successfully repaid a previous loan  from CEVI.  She is requesting a new loan of 8000 PHP, which will be used to purchase seeds and fertilizers.

This loan will be the second loan taken out by Virginia from CEVI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her business.

loans.use: To purchase seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Shakira

texts.fr: Shakira U. est commerçante, et client d’ACB depuis 2010.  Elle est mariée, et elle a fini 3 ans d’école secondaire.  Elle a 3 enfants entre 5 et 11 ans, et tous vont à l’école.  Elle va utiliser son prêt pour acheter 7 bains moins-riches, 10 basins non-moins riches, 10 chemises, 1 douzaine ensembles de femmes, 10 paires de chaussures d’hommes, et transport.  Sa stratégie pour la croissance de l’affaire est l’augmentation du capital, vendre les biens désirés par les individus, par commande, augmentation de crédits demandés.  Elle voudrait devenir une grande commerçante dans le district de Rubavu, et développer sa famille dans tous les secteurs.
texts.en: Shakira U. is a merchant and has been a client of ACB since 2010. She is married and has completed three years of secondary schooling. Her three children are 5 to 11 years old, and all of them attend school. Shakira is going use her loan to buy 7 lengths of moins-riches damask cloth, 10 lengths of non-moins riches damask cloth, 10 shirts, a dozen outfits for women, and 10 pairs of men's shoes and to pay for transport. Her strategy for growing her business is to increase her capital, to sell the goods that people want, by special order, and to increase credit in demand. She would like to become a major merchant in the Rubavu district and to improve her family in all aspects.

loans.use: Buying damask cloth, shirts, shoes, women's clothing, and men's shoes to sell; and paying for transport.

loans.name: Twige Group

texts.fr:
Salima N. est une commerçante âgée de 22 ans qui habite la  commune de Rugombo de la Province de Cibitoke à l’Ouest du Burundi. Elle tient un restaurant dans sa propre maison à Rugombo depuis 4ans alors qu’elle était cultivatrice avant de commencer ce metier. Elle a fait ses études jusqu’au niveau de l’école primaire en 6e année. Elle est mère de 1 enfant d’une annee. Elle  arrive au 6e cycle dans le crédit Communautaire avec Turame. 

Elle demande le crédit Kiva pour  accroitre son capital  pour l’expansion de son restaurant en achetant de grandes quantités d’articles de consommation à revendre à ses clients et ainsi pouvoir accroitre ses économies. Elle espère qu’avec les économies réalisées avec ce credit, elle  sera à mesure de subvenir aux besoins familiaux et pouvoir acheter une deuxième maison

Elle est membre  du groupe  Communautaire« Twige».
texts.en:
Salima N. is a 22-year-old merchant who lives in the commune of Rugombo, Province of Cibitoke, in West Burundi. She has had a restaurant in her own home in Rugombo for four years, whereas she was a farmer before beginning in this trade. She attended school and reached the 6th grade.  She is a mother with one child, who is a year old.  

Salima is on her sixth community loan cycle with Turame. She is asking for a Kiva loan for increasing her capital in order to expand her restaurant.  She will do so by buying large amounts of provisions and thus increase her saving. Through this loan, with her savings in hand, she hopes to meet the needs of her family over time and to buy a second house.  

She is a member of the community group "Twige".

loans.use: Increasing her capital for expanding her restaurant by buying large amounts of provisions

loans.name: Benkadi  (Entente) Group

texts.fr:
Benkadi est un regroupement de femmes du quartier Hamdallaye de la ville de Koutiala qui vivent ensemble dans le même quartier, dans de grandes familles traditionnelles avec leurs maris, enfants et coépouses. Elles ont en moyenne 36 ans, sont mariées et mères d’au moins 5 enfants. Ce groupe Benkadi fait l’achat et la vente, d’habillements, de condiments, de fruits et légumes et du sucre.
Pour augmenter la taille de leurs activités, les membres du groupe ont décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso il y a deux ans. Elles ont leur troisième prêt de groupe et les précédents ont été bien remboursés.
Djeneba T. qui est un des membres du groupe Benkadi fait l’achat et la vente des condiments de toutes sortes (huile, oignon, Sounbala, tomates, cubes magies, ail, épices etc.) Elle est très sollicitée car elle occupe une bonne place au marché de Hamdallaye.
Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter, une importante quantité de condiments. Elle se procure de ces marchandises au  grand marché de Koutiala en gros pour les  revendre en détail et au comptant à une clientèle essentiellement féminine.
Tandis que les autres membres du groupe Benkadi comptent réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 105 000FCFA chacune au cours de ce cycle, Djeneba T. elle, compte réaliser 120 000 FCFA.  
En plus du remboursement des prêts, elles envisagent utiliser une partie du revenu  pour faire face aux dépenses courantes de la famille.
texts.en: Benkadi is a group of women from the Hamdallaye district of Koutiala City who live together in that district in large traditional families with their husbands, children, and co-wives. The group members average 36 years of age and are married mothers of at least five children. The group buys and sells clothing, condiments, fruit and vegetables, and sugar. To expand their businesses, the group members decided two years ago to joint the loan program of the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso. They are now on their third group loan. And the previous ones have been repaid properly. Djeneba T., who is a member of the group Benkadi, buys and sells condiments of all kinds, such as oil, onions, sounbala (pounded and fermented seeds or beans), tomatoes, Maggie bouillon cubes, garlic, spices, etc. She is in high demand because she occupies a good spot at the Hamdallaye market. She intends to use her loan to buy a large quantity of condiments. She acquires her merchandise wholesale at the big market of Koutiala and sells retail, accepting cash from a customer base comprised essentially of women. While the other group members plan on making an average profit of 105,000 francs CFA over the course of each cycle, Djeneba T. plans on making 120,000 francs. In addition to making loan payments, the group members envision using a portion of the revenues for coping with common family expenses.

loans.use: Buying condiments

loans.name: Soeung

texts.en:
Mrs. Soeung T., 40, is a local crop farmer who lives in a rural area near Phnom Penh, the capital of Cambodia. Mrs. Soeung T. has no life partner because she divorced her husband a year ago. She has two single kids who are employees at different companies, while another child is now married and lives independently. 

Mrs. Soeung T. will be using a Kiva loan to add to her personal savings to build a new house for her single kids to live in when they marry.

loans.use: To build a new house for her single kids to live in when they marry

loans.name: Leonora

texts.en:
Leonora D., 52, is an entrepreneur with a knack for multitasking. She has been a widow for 18 years, and raised her five children (who are all married now) alone.  As a mother, she always work very hard to provide for the daily needs of her family. At present, Leonora lives in Baseco Port Area, Manila.

Being in the direct-selling business, Leonora has developed the skill to choose quality products and deal with people in the neighborhood to turn them into regular customers. She mainly sells household products like kitchen wares, accessories, cosmetics, and the like.  At this time, Leonora is trying to maintain her good reputation, which gained her the trust of her management.  Monthly,she earns an average net income of Php10,800.  

Leonora wants to maximize her potential as a multi-tasking entrepreneur. To help her do that and grow her businesses, she would like to request a Php24,000 loan. She plans to use this amount into increase the number of products she sells in order to better meet the specific needs of her regular customers. 

Certainly, Leonora has her share of customers who do not pay on time. Nevertheless, she still prays for the ability to collect their payments and prays for God's blessings for those customers.  Being six years in this kind of business, Leonora has received awards and recognition from her company for being a top performer for three consecutive years. Because of this, she is inspired to give this business all her best.

Leonora believes that everything can be possible through hard work and strong faith in God.  As CCT community partner, she faithfully attends to their weekly fellowship* meeting where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she received.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To buy merchandise to sell

loans.name: Consolata

texts.en:
Consolata O. O. is fifty-two years old and married.  Her husband works for National Social Security Fund.  They have six children, aged between twenty-five and sixteen. She owns a second hand clothes business where she also sells curtains and bedsheets. Her business is located at the busy Kibuye market in Kisumu.

Consolata has been in business for seven years. Her business is profitable, but her major challenge is the high cost of operation in terms of money needed to move to and from the market. However, she works very hard to keep her business doing well. 

Consolata plans to use her loan of 80,000 KES to buy more clothes to grow her business and meet the demands of her customers. She sees herself owning a wholesale clothes shop in the future. She describes herself as very resilient and God fearing.

loans.use: To buy clothes to sell

loans.name: Imad

texts.en:
Imad is  a 43-year-old married man, father of two children: Khalil, a 3-year-old boy and Mariam, a 1-year-old baby girl. Imad has been working in construction for 20 years; he's specialized in cement work. Imad is requesting a loan from Al Majmoua for the first time, in order to buy necessary new tools for his business. 

Imad's business is improving, especially since construction is developing well in the region. Imad got support from his family, to work hard and improve his business, that's why he struggles to provide them with the best he can give. Most of his clients are contractors and builders who recommend him from one to another. His love for his family and business made his quality of work different. He hopes he can get this loan in order to continue his good work.

loans.use: To buy new tools for his business

loans.name: Mohamed

texts.en:
This is 45-year-old Mohamed. He is married and has 5 children, ages 7, 15, 17, 20 and 23. In 1986, Mohamed established his provisions business because he wanted to improve his family's quality of life. Working 7 days a week and 15 hours a day, he earns about Le 1,512,080 every month. He would like a loan in the amount of Le 3,000,000 in order to buy additional provisions. He hopes that this loan will enable him to increase his monthly profits by approximately Le 302,416.

In the future, Mohamed plans to promote his business, educate his children, and build a house. He will use his profits from the loan to re-invest in his business. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy provisions to sell

loans.name: Jackson

texts.en:
Jackson is a married man with eleven children, all of whom attend school. He owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. His greatest monthly expense is school fees. 

For over twelve years, he has operated his snake park business.  His potential customers are local and foreign tourists visiting the area.  Jackson faces a major challenge  in the seasonality of demands in his business. During the holiday seasons he gets a lot of customers visiting the park, while during the months of January to May the number of visitors is lower. He hopes to expand his park to accommodate the number of visitors in the park in the future. 

With the loan for Kshs 40,000, he wants to purchase building materials to finish renovating his snake park. He decided to join Yehu because of its efficient of loan process.

loans.use: To renovate snake park

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.fr: Fatuma N. est commerçante, et client d’ACB depuis 2010.  Elle est mariée, née à Rwanda, et elle a fini 6 ans d’école secondaire.  Elle a un enfant qui a 16 ans, et qui va à l’école.  Elle va utiliser son prêt pour acheter 1 douzaine pantalons, 8 paires de basins, 10 draps et transport.  Sa stratégie pour la croissance de l’affaire est d’augmenter le capital, a fin de s’autofinancer.  Elle voudrait devenir grossiste, et éduquer ses enfants.
texts.en: Fatuma Nyiribahire is a merchant. She has been a client of the microfinance institution Amasezerano Community Banking S.A. since 2010. She is married, was born in Rwanda and has completed 6 years of secondary school. She is the mother of a 16-year-old child who attends school. She will use her loan to buy 12 pairs of trousers, 8 pairs of basin cloths and 10 bed sheets, as well as pay for the shipment of the goods. Her strategy for the growth of her business is to provide it with more working capital through self-financing. She would like to become a wholesaler and have her child educated.

loans.use: To buy 12 pairs of trousers, 8 pairs of basin cloths and 10 bed sheets, as well as pay for the shipment of the goods

loans.name: Hawa

texts.en:
This is 31-year-old Hawa. She is married and has four children. In 2003, Hawa established her ice cream business. She began her business because she wanted to support her family. Working 6 days a week and 10 hours a day, she earns about Le 1,500,000 every month.  Hawa employs one sales assistant.

Hawa would like a loan in the amount of Le 4,000,000 in order to expand her business. She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately Le 450,000. In the future, Hawa plans to expand further and hire more employees. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To expand icecream business

loans.name: Hamissah

texts.fr: Hamissah U. est commerçante, et client d’ACB depuis 2010.  Elle est mariée, née a Rwanda, et elle a fini 6 ans d’école secondaire.  Elle a 1 enfant qui a 18 ans, et qui va à l’école.  Elle a aussi une personne en charge.  Elle va utiliser son prêt pour acheter 7 paires de basins moins riches, 10 basins simples, 20 sacs a main, une douzaine paires de pantalons, et transport.  Sa stratégie pour la croissance de l’affaire est d’augmenter le capital tout en augmentant la quantité et qualité de produits à vendre.  Elle voudrait devenir grossiste dans le district de Rubavu, développer le bien-être de sa famille, et payer les frais d’études pour son enfant.
texts.en: Hamissah U. is a shopkeeper and has been a client of ACB since 2010. She is married, was born in Rwanda, and has completed six years of secondary schooling. She has a child who is 18 years old and attending school. She also has another person in her care. Hamissah is going to use her loan to buy 7 lengths of moins riches damask cloth, 10 lengths of plain damask cloth, 20 handbags, and a dozen pairs of pants and to pay for transport. Her strategy for growing her business is to increase her capital while increasing the quantity and quality of the products she sells. She would like to become a wholesale merchant in the Rubavu district, to improve her family's well-being, and to cover the cost of schooling for her child.

loans.use: Buying damask cloth, handbags, and pants; Paying for transport

loans.name: Zainab

texts.en: This is 30-year-old Zainab. She is married and has 4 children. In 2008, Zainab established her used clothing business because she wanted her own source of income. Working six days a week and nine hours a day, she earns about Le 2,909,000 every month from her business. She would like a loan in the amount of Le 3,000,000 in order to buy additional used clothing. In the future, Zainab plans to import clothing from other countries. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To purchase more used clothing

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more drinks and rent a more spacious shop

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary A. O. is 43 years old and married. Her husband works as a telephone operator and they have three children aged between14 and 19 years.

She owns a furniture-making shop in which she makes beds, wall units, sofa sets, stools, coffee tables and other items. Her business is located at the busy Kibuye market in Kisumu. 

Mary has been in business for 10 years now, and has managed to give employment to two people. Her business is profitable, but her major challenge is lack of enough storage space for her end products. However, she works very hard to keep her business doing well. 

She plans to use her loan of 80,000 Kenyan shillings to buy timber to make more items due to the high demand by her customers. She sees herself growing the business and becoming the market leader in the furniture-making business. She describes herself as very honest and God-fearing.

loans.use: Timber

loans.name: Abibatu

texts.en:
This is Abibatu S., a 45-year-old, married woman. She owns a plasticware business. She began her business because she wanted to help her mother, who was finding it very difficult to raise her younger children. She opens her business six days a week and 10 hours a day. 

She would like a loan in the amount of 5,000,000 Sierra Leone leones. She requires a loan in order to have a savings account and to educate her children. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy more goods

loans.name: Charles

texts.fr: Charles S. est agriculteur.  Il a 29 ans, célibataire, et né a Rwanda.  Il va utiliser son prêt pour acheter 600 kgs de pommes de terre, 1 pompe pour l’insecticide, 300 kgs d’engrais, 150 kgs de détanes (type d’insecticide0, et payement de main d’œuvre.  Sa stratégie pour la croissance de l’affaire est l’augmentation de fonds, utilisation de semences sélectionnées, et il cherchera le matériel de transport dans son business.  Il voudrait l’amélioration de la capacité de son activité, et mettre et chercher le comptoir de vente de ses produits dans son district.  Il voudrait aussi assurer le bien-être de sa famille tout en améliorant la politique d’épargne.  Charles et agent d’AGROFA (organisation Rwandais pour les agriculteurs), et aussi élévateur des vaches.
texts.en: Charles S. is a farmer. He is 29 years old, single and was born in Rwanda. He will use his loan to buy 600 kilograms of potatoes, a pump for insecticide, 300 kilograms of fertilizer and 150 kilograms of détane (insecticide), as well as hire workforce. His strategy for the growth of his business consists in increasing his working capital, using first-class seeds and looking for adequate transportation means. He would like to improve his production capacity and select an appropriate sales spot in his district to sell his products. He wants to provide a good living standard to his family and at the same time save more money. Charles is a representative of Agrofa, a farmers' organization in Rwanda. And he rears cattle.

loans.use: To buy 600 kilograms of potatoes, a pump for insecticide, 300 kilograms of fertilizer and 150 kilograms of détane (insecticide), as well as hire workforce

loans.name: Jean Claude

texts.fr: Jean Claude M. est commerçant des accessoires téléphoniques, et technicien des téléphones.  Il a 37 ans, il est marié, et né a Rwanda.  Il a 4 enfants entre 3 ans et 13 ans, et deux de ses enfants vont à l’école.  Il va utiliser son prêt pour acheter 60 housings (cases), 100 chargeurs, 16 fer a soudure, 20 écouteurs, et 20 cartes de téléphone.  Sa stratégie pour la croissance de l’affaire est de développer son business, bâtir son propre maison commerciale, solliciter beaucoup de prêts en vue d’améliorer l’affaire.  Il voudrait devenir un grand technicien dans le district de Rubavu, et s’autofinancer.  Il voudrait assurer le bien être de sa famille et payer les frais d’études pour ses enfants.  Jean Claude avait 2 crédits déjà, qui ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en:
Jean Claude M. is a phone technician and a merchant of phone accessories. Born in Rwanda, he is 37 years old and married. He has four children, who are 3 to 13 years of age.  Two of his children go to school. 

Jean Claude is going to use his loan for buying 60 housings (cases), 100 chargers, 16 soldering irons, 20 earphones, and 20 phone cards. His strategy for business growth is to develop his business, to build his own store, and to request many loans for improving his business.  He would like to become a major technician in the Rubavu district and to finance himself. He would like to ensure his family's well-being and to cover the schooling costs for his children.  

Jean Claude has already had two loans, which have been properly repaid.

loans.use: Buying 60 housings (cases), 100 chargers, 15 soldering irons, 20 earphones, 20 phone cards

loans.name: Jeneba

texts.en:
This is 37-year-old Jeneba. She is married with two children and has three additional dependents who live with her because they lost their parents. In 1997, Jeneba established her food-market business because she wanted a way to help her husband support their family. She operates her business six days a week and 10 hours a day. 

She would like a loan in the amount of 3,000,000 Sierra Leone leones in order to purchase more food items. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy more food items

loans.name: Haytham

texts.en: Haytham is a 49-year-old married man living in Tripoli with his wife and four kids. Haytham works in car services. He has been changing car oil and filters for 26 years. Haytham is requesting a loan from Al Majmoua to buy necessary oils and filters for his business in addition to helping his daughter with her wedding preparations. Haytham is well known in the region. He is recommended by most of his clients who can be friends, neighbors, relatives and passers-by. Haytham works hard for his living and seeks his clients' satisfaction. He had financial difficulties at the beginning of his business, which started to improve over the years. Haytham hopes to expand his business in the future to keep a good heritage for his family.

loans.use: To buy necessary products and help his daughter with the wedding preparations

loans.name: Abibatu

texts.en:
Abibatu K. is 36 years old and is married with three children. She has three additional dependents who live with her because they lost their parents. 

In 2000, Abibatu established her food business. Formerly, Abibatu was working on a farm. She began her business because she realized she would be able to earn more money by selling farm products in town. She operates her business six days a week and 11 hours a day. 

She would like a loan in the amount of 4,000,000 Sierra Leone leones (Le) in order to purchase additional food stock. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy more bags of rice

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary L. is a married lady with seven children aged between 16 and 28 years. Her business is located in the town of Kakamega, which is in the region in Kenya known as the sugarbelt region for the production of sugarcane. 

Mary sells groceries to the local residents. She has been in this business for 18 years now and has employed one person. She says that this business is profitable and the only major challenge she has is that there are very many people in the area with the same kind of business as hers, hence customers are spoiled for choice. However, she works very hard to keep her business doing well. 

She is using her loan of 20,000 Kenyan shillings to buy tomatoes and onions to grow her business and meet the demands of her customers. In the future, she hopes to grow her business into a wholesale one. She describes herself as humble, intelligent and polite.

loans.use: Tomatoes and onions

loans.name: Bonface

texts.en:
Bonface is a married man with two children, one of whom attends school. He lives in a rental house that has neither electricity nor piped water. His greatest monthly expense is school fees.

He has operated a clothing selling business for the past six months, selling from home to his neighbours and passersby. Bonface faces a major challenge of seasonality in his business. He hopes to establish a shop to sell his clothes in the future.

With the Kshs 20,000, he wants to purchase bales of clothes for resale. He decided to join Yehu because of the efficiency of the loans they provide.

loans.use: To purchase bales of clothes for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more plastic items.

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en: Ahmad is a 36-year-old married man living in Tripoli with his wife and two kids. Ahmad works as a hairdresser. He owns a beauty salon where most of the ladies visit. Ahmad has an accepted quality of work and this is what helps him keep his clients and progress. Most of his clients are faithful and he knows how to please them. He's requesting a loan from Al Majmoua for the second time in order to buy new tools in addition to furniture for his house. His previous loan helped improve his social situation as he stated. Ahmad hopes to expand his business by adding new beauty services.

loans.use: To buy new tools and to buy furniture for his house

loans.name: Dunstan

texts.en:
Dunstan is an unmarried man who lives in a rental house that has electricity but not piped water. His greatest monthly expense is rent bills.

He operates a vegetable stall business, selling from home to his neighbours and passersby. Dunstan faces a major challenge of seasonality in his business. During the rainy season the availability of vegetables in the market is lower than demand. He hopes to expand his business in the future.

With the loan of Kshs 20,000 he wants to purchase sacks of vegetables for sale. He decided to join Kiva partner Yehu because of the efficiency of loans.

loans.use: To purchase sacks of vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Mbalu

texts.en: This is 42 year-old Mbalu. She is married and has three children aged 18, 15 and 4. She has one additional dependent who lives with her because she assists with her schooling. In 1998, Mbalu established her baby clothing business. She began her business because she wanted to be self reliant. Working seven days a week and ten hours a day, she earns about Le 2,028,000 every month. She would like a loan in the amount of Le 4,000,000 in order to buy additional baby items. She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately Le 405,600. In the future, Mbalu plans to educate her children and to have a house of her own. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: The loan is used to buy additional baby items

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy cereals.

loans.name: Ziganya Group

texts.fr:
Sarah U. est une commerçante âgée de 41 ans qui habite la  commune de Rugombo de la Province de Cibitoke a l’Ouest du Burundi. Elle fait le commerce des oignons qu’elle achète au Marche de Rugombo pour ensuite les fournir aux clients du Marche Central de la Ville de Bujumbura. Elle a fait ses études jusqu’au niveau de l’école primaire en 4e année. Elle est mère de 6 enfants qui étudient tous. Elle  arrive au 6e cycle dans le crédit Communautaire avec Turame. 

Elle demande le crédit Kiva pour  accroitre son capital  en achetant de grandes quantités des oignons à revendre à ses clients et ainsi pouvoir accroitre ses économies. Elle espère qu’avec les économies réalisées avec ce credit, elle  sera à mesure de subvenir aux besoins familiaux et acheter une parcelle pour construire sa maison.

Elle est membre  du groupe  Communautaire« Ziganya».
texts.en:
Sarah U. is a 41-year old trader, who lives in the municipality of Rugombo, which lies in the province of Cibitoke in the west of Burundi. She trades in onions which she buys at the market in Rugombo and then provides to her customers at the central market in the town of Bujumbura. She attended primary school up until 4th grade. She is mother to six children who are all studying. She is on her sixth community loan with Turame.

She is requesting the Kiva loan in order to increase her capital, by buying large quantities of onions to resell to her customers and thereby increase her savings. She hopes that the savings she makes from this loan will enable her to provide for her family's needs and buy a piece of land to build a house on.

She is a member of the "Ziganya" community group.

loans.use: To increase her capital by buying large quantities of onions to sell to her customers

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
Juana forma parte del banco comunal “Cuentas Claras”, perteneciente a la ciudad de Rancagua. Ella tiene una amasandería hace 3 años en un local cercano a su casa, sin embargo hace 30 años que trabaja en este rubro. Además vende colaciones para obreros de la construcción. Su hija mayor trabaja con ella en este negocio. 
Gracias a los préstamos de Fondo Esperanza ha ido adquiriendo diferentes máquinas como una congeladora, cortadora de cecinas y una máquina conservadora de alimentos, ya que su sueño es incorporar más productos a su negocio. Ahora que cuenta con las máquinas necesarias, con este préstamo comprará mercadería como por ejemplo: lácteos, pollos congelados y cecinas.
Su sueño es tener un mini restaurante para atender mejor a sus clientes de las colaciones.
Juana es maestra de cocina, le gusta mucho su trabajo y está muy agradecida del apoyo de Fondo Esperanza, ya que con los préstamos que ha recibido ha logrado ir creciendo en su negocio.
Rancagua pertenece a la región del Libertador Bernardo O´Higgins. Es una moderna ciudad que regula el principal proceso productivo y exportador agrofrutícola y vitivinícola de Chile. Es también una ciudad minera, debido a que en su cordillera se encuentra la mina subterránea más grande del mundo “El Teniente”, con 4.500 km. de túneles.
texts.en:
Juana is a member of the communal bank "Cuentas Claras" and lives in the city of Rancagua.  She has owned a bakery near her house for 3 years now, however, she has 30 years of experience in this profession.  She also sells snacks or light meals to construction workers.  Her oldest daughter works with her in the business.  Thanks to the loans from Fondo Esperanza she has been able to purchase various appliances such as a freezer, a meat slicer and a cooler.  Her dream is to incorporate more products into her business.  Now that she has the necessary appliances, with this loan she will buy  merchandise such as dairy products, frozen chicken and dried meat.  Her dream is to have a small restaurant so that she can better serve her customers that buy snacks from her.  Juana is a master in the kitchen and she really likes her work.  She is very grateful for the support from Fondo Esperanza since because of the loans that she has received, her business has grown.  

Rancagua is in the Libertador Bernardo O'Higgins region.  It is a modern city that regulates the main fruit-growing and wine production and exportation in Chile.  It is also a mining city because, located its mountain range, is the largest underground mine in the world, "El Teniente", with its 4,500 km of tunnels.

loans.use: Dairy products. frozen chicken and dried meat

loans.name: Beth Nyambuara

texts.en:
Beth has practiced farming in Naivasha town for the last four years.  She is 41 years old. She is married to Paul M. and they have three children.

She was introduced to KADET by her friend and this will be her third loan. She paid for all her previous loans well and in good time. She plans to use the loan amount to buy potato seedlings and prepare her farm for planting.

In the future, Beth hopes to practice large-scale farming.

loans.use: To buy potato seedlings and prepare her farm for planting.

loans.name: Hellen

texts.en:
Hellen is a married woman with one child, who is still too young for school. She owns a house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

She has operated a vegetable stall business for the past one year, selling to her neighbours and passersby. Hellen faces a major challenge of the high cost of transportation for her business. She hopes to expand her business in the future.

With the Kshs 35,000 she wants to purchase sacks of charcoal, vegetables and coconuts for sale. She decided to join  Kiva partner Yehu because of the efficiency of the loans.

loans.use: To purchase sacks of charcoal, vegetables and coconuts to sell.

loans.name: Dickson Paletuan

texts.en:
Dickson has practiced farming in Naivasha town for the last four years.  He is 30 years old, married to Jackline K., and they have three children.

He was introduced to KADET by his friend and this will be his second loan.  He repaid his previous loan of Kshs 50,000 well and in good time.  He plans to use this loan amount to buy wheat seedlings and fertilizer for planting.

In future, Dickson hopes to practice mixed farming, that is, start rearing cows for both meat and milk.

loans.use: To buy wheat seedlings and fertilizer

loans.name: Jean Marie Vianney

texts.fr: Jean Marie Vianney est commerçant des habits, et client d’ACB depuis 2008.  Il a 43 ans, il est marié, et né a Kigali, Rwanda.  Il a 3 enfants entre 8 ans a 11 ans, et une personne en charge.  Jean Marie a une éducation d’école secondaire, et il va utiliser son prêt pour payer les minervaux pour ses enfants, et payer aussi pour le matériel scolaire.  Sa stratégie pour la croissance de l’affaire est de vendre les habits de qualité, et épargner une partie du profit pour préparer le bon futur de la famille.  Il voudrait finir la construction de sa maison d’habitation, pour donner la famille une habitation convenable et bien fini.  Il voudrait aussi épargner pour les études de ses enfants.  Jean Marie Vianney est aussi conducteur d’une taxi-voiture.
texts.en: Jean-Marie Vianney trades in clothes and has been a customer of ACB since 2008. He is 43 years old, married, and was born in Kigali in Rwanda. He has three children between the ages of eight and eleven years old, and he also has another person in his care. Jean-Marie has a secondary school education and he is going to use his loan to pay his children's school fees as well as to pay for school materials. His strategy for expanding his business is to sell quality clothing and save part of the profit to provide for his family's future. He would like to finish building his house, in order to give his family a decent and finished home. He would also like to save up for his children's studies. Jean-Marie Vianney is also a taxi driver.

loans.use: Payment of his children's school fees and school materials

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase rolls of cloth materials for tailoring and wheat flour for her doughnut business

loans.name: Dickson Saoli

texts.en:
Dickson has practiced farming in Naivasha town for the last four years.  He is 45 years old, married to Lucy Saoli, and they have three children.

He was introduced to KADET LTD by his friend and this will be his third loan. He repaid both his previous loans well and in good time.  He plans to use the loan amount to buy fertilizer and prepare his farm for planting wheat.

In future, Dickson hopes to buy more land and establish himself as a leading farmer in Naivasha town.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and prepare his farm for planting wheat

loans.name: Wilfredo Dante

texts.es:
El señor Wilfredo Dante N. A. tiene 39 años de edad y vive en una casa de propiedad de sus suegros, vivienda que esta ubicada en el barrio la florida de esta ciudad de Tarija. Wilfredo es padre de 4 hijos, a quienes cuida y apoya en sus estudios junto con su esposa. Ahora Wilfredo tiene que trabajar duro para poder sacar adelante a su familia. Wilfredo se dedica desde hace mas de 6 años como metalurgico haciendo portones, puertas, ventanas, y cualquier producto metálico que sus clientes le soliciten. Realizando estos trabajos mediante pedidos que sus clientes le solicitan, teniendo muy buena clientela que prefieren comprar sus productos por ser de muy buena calidad. Wilfredo quiere tener mejores ingresos para sacar adelante a su esposa e hijos, pero el nos cuenta que quiere comprar material de trabajo puesto que tiene varias solicitudes de trabajo, porque el trabajo aumenta. Es por eso que el crédito será destinado para la compra del material necesario para realizar su actividad para de ese modo poder incrementar sus ingresos.                                                                                                                                                                                                        
Wilfredo nos cuenta que quiere mejorar las condiciones de vida que tiene el y su familia, por eso nos dice que el próximo crédito que solicite será para mejorar las condiciones de la casa donde vive.
texts.en:
Wilfredo Dante N. A. is 39 years old and lives in a house that belongs to his in-laws. The home is located in the neighborhood of La Florida in the city of Tarija. Wilfredo is the father of 4 children, whom he cares for and supports in their studies together with his wife. At present, Wilfredo has to work hard so that he can help his family get ahead. For more than 6 years, Wilfredo has worked as a blacksmith, making gates, doors, windows and any other metal product that his customers request. He carries out this work in response to orders from his customers, and he has a good group of steady customers who prefer to buy his products since they are of excellent quality. Wilfredo wants to increase his income so that he can help his wife and his children get ahead. He reports that he wants to buy material for his work, since he has several orders and his workload is increasing. For this reason, the loan will be used to buy materials that are necessary for his work, so that he can increase his income. 
                                                        
Wilfredo reports that he would like to improve his own and his family's living conditions, and thus he says that the next loan he requests will be for improving the house where he lives.

loans.use: Increasing operating capital for his business

loans.name: Hannah Wanjiru

texts.en:
Hannah has practised farming in Naivasha town for the last four years.  She is 43 years old, married to John Thuita, and they have four children.

She was introduced to KADET LTD by her friend and this will be her third loan. She repaid both her previous loans well and in good time.  She plans to use this loan amount to buy potato seedlings and fertiliser.

In future, Hannah hopes to buy her own farming tools instead of always having to hire.

loans.use: To buy potato seedlings and fertiliser

loans.name: Jacinta

texts.en:
Jacinta has practised farming in Naivasha town for the last six years. She is 25 years old, married to Robinson, and they have two children.

She was introduced to KADET LTD by her friend and she has a very good credit history with KADET; this will be her third loan.  She repaid her previous loans well and in good time.  She plans to use the loan amount to buy wheat seedlings and fertilizer for planting.

In future, Jacinta hopes to own farming equipment and save on having to hire every time.

loans.use: To buy wheat seedlings and fertilizer for planting

loans.name: Victor

texts.en:
Victor O. O. is a 32-year-old married man. His wife is a student at a local college and they do not have any children yet. Victor sells mangoes, oranges and other fruits. His business is located at Kakamega, a region in Kenya commonly referred to as the sugarbelt and known for the production of sugarcane.

He has been in this business for the last two years. This business is profitable for him but his major challenge is the fact that fruits are seasonal and thus, there are some seasons within the year when there is not much business due to unavailability of fruits. However, he works very hard from early to late evening to keep his business doing well.

He is requesting a loan of 40,000 Kenyan shillings to buy mangoes to grow his business and meet customer demand. He hopes to grow his business and stock vegetables, which he will be selling wholesale. He also hopes to purchase a plot of land and put up rental houses. 

Victor describes himself as hardworking.

loans.use: Mangoes

loans.name: Naitai Lemomo

texts.en:
Naitai has practiced farming in Naivasha town for the last four years.  She is 32 years old, married to Raphael Nkurruna, and they have two children.  

She was introduced to KADET LTD by her friend and this will be her second loan.  She repaid her previous loan of Kshs 10,000 well and in good time.  She plans to use the loan amount to buy fertilizer and wheat seedlings for planting.

In future, Naitai hopes to buy more land and practice large-scale farming.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and wheat seedlings for planting

loans.name: Tufa

texts.en:
Tufa is a married woman with one child who attends school. She lives in a rental house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees. 

Tufa has been selling natural juices for the past three months. She sells from her home to her neighbours. Tufa faces a major challenge with the seasonality of her business. She hopes to expand her business in the future.

With her loan of 10,000 Kenyan shillings, she wants to purchase flavours, bags for storage and pay electricity bills. She decided to join Yehu because of the efficiency of their loans.

loans.use: To purchase flavours, bags for storage and pay electricity bills

loans.name: Henry

texts.en:
Henry O. is a 27-year-old married man. His wife is a business lady and they have three children, ages 8 to 2 years old. Henry sells mangoes, oranges and other fruits. His business is located in Kakamega – a region in Kenya known for the production of sugarcane and commonly referred to as the sugar belt region. He has been in his business for the last three years. This business is profitable for him but his major challenge is the fact that fruits are seasonal. There are some seasons during the year when there is not much business due to unavailability of fruits. He also does not have a fridge, so some fruits rot leaving him with a loss. Nevertheless, he works very hard from early in the day to late evening to keep his business doing well. 

Henry is requesting a loan of 40,000 Kenyan shillings to buy mangoes to expand his business and meet customer demand. He hopes to grow his business and stock vegetables, which he will be selling wholesale. He also hopes to purchase a plot of land and put up rental houses. Henry describes himself as hardworking.

loans.use: To buy mangoes

loans.name: Gilberto

texts.es:
El señor Gilberto T. tiene 21 años de edad, vive en el trópico de Cochabamba, en la localidad de Entre Rios, trabaja en una  carpintería. Ya que su padre ya no le podía mantener, ha tenido trabajar e  independizarse.
Gilberto vino del municipio de Arque de Cochabamba, hace 8 años en busca de mayores oportunidades de vida, junto a su familia,  en su  pueblo ya no había oportunidades de prosperar, los terrenos se agotaron, el rendimiento de producción bajo. Posteriormente decidieron migrar al trópico de Cochabamba, cuando llego, trabajo como ayudante en  una carpintería, posteriormente poco a poco fue aprendiendo, hoy en día es maestro carpintero, su sueño es  tener su propia carpintería.

El solicita el crédito, para mejorar las condiciones de vida de su casa, refaccionar y construir su casa propia, y aunque lo que solicita no es suficiente pero empezara poco a poco, posteriormente, en un futuro el cliente quiere tener su propia carpintería,  de esa manera prosperar en esta vida, ya que  cada día es más difícil la situación.
texts.en:
Gilberto T. is 21 years old. He lives in the town of Entre Rios near Cochabamba and works as a carpenter. He had to to start working because his father could no longer support him financially. Gilberto came to Entre Rios from Arque de Cochabamba with his family 8 years ago seeking better prospects, since there were no opportunities to prosper in their village. The lands were worn out and crop production was low. They decided to move to Cochabamba, and when he arrived he started working as a carpenter's assistant. Little by little he learned the craft, and today is a master carpenter. His dream is to have his own carpentry business.
He is requesting this loan to improve the living conditions in his house, to refurbish it and build his own house. Although the amount he's requesting isn't enough to do it all, he's starting a little at a time. At some point in the future he would like to have his own carpentry business and be successful in life, since every day his situation gets a little more difficult.

loans.use: Construction y remodeling of his home

loans.name: Nancy Sianoi

texts.en:
Nancy has practiced farming in Naivasha for the last four years.  She is 53 years old, married to Joseph K. and they have two children.

She was introduced to KADET LTD by her friend and this will be her third loan.  She paid for all her previous loans well and in good time.  She plans to use the loan amount to prepare the land and buy seed and fertilizer in readiness for planting.

In the future, she plans to buy her own farming equipment and save on having to rent.

loans.use: To prepare land and buy seed and fertilizer in readiness for planting.

loans.name: Susana Tananko

texts.en:
Susana has been selling clothes in Naivasha town for the last year.  She is 33 years old, married to Tananko Ole M. and they have one child.

She was introduced to KADET by her friend and this will be her first loan.  She plans to use the loan to buy more clothes to sell. 

In the future, Susana hopes to grow her business and make enough income to send her child through school.

loans.use: To buy more clothes to sell.

loans.name: Felipa

texts.es:
La señora Felipa es casada tiene 30 años D. edad, apenas estudio hasta el nivel D. primario, tiene 3 hijos. Felipa vive con su esposo, tienen su vivienda en la zona D. Itocta al sud oeste  D. la provincia Cercado del departamento D. Cochabamba. 

La señora Felipa y su esposo se dedican a la producción D. leche cruda, toda su producción lechera entrega a un modulo lechero D. la zona, para su posterior recojo por parte D. PIL ANDINA. 

Las condiciones en las que viven son modestas, su vivienda cuenta con los servicios básicos, su ganado lo tiene en una propiedad aledaña a su vivienda. La señora Felipa es una señora muy dedicada a su trabajo, pues ella y su esposo (sus hijos son muy pequeños aun) se levantan muy temprano todos los días para orD.ñar las vacas. Y durante todo el día se dedican al cuidado D. las mimas, actividad en la que participa toda la familia.  
 
La señora Felipa solicita el crédito para la adquisición D. alimento en general para su ganado vacuno, ya que es la oportunidad D. proveerse para la época D. sequia. D. esta manera asegurar el alimento para su ganado lechero y mantener la producción D. leche D. manera que no bajen sus ingresos y estos se mantengan estables. El ideal que tiene la señora Felipa es que sus hijos puedan estudiar teniendo una buena alimentación y una vivienda segura.
texts.en:
Felipa is 30 years old and married.  She just has an elementary school education.  She has three children.  Felipa lives with her husband.  Their home is in the Itocta zone that is in the southwestern part of the Cercado department in Cochabamba.

Felipe and her husband produce raw milk.  They deliver all of their milk production to a cooperative in the area. It is later collected by PIL ANDINA, a dairy factory.

Their living conditions are modest, and they have the basic services.  She keeps her livestock on land bordering her home.  Felipa is a woman who is very dedicated to her work.  She and her husband (their children are still very small) get up very early every day to milk the cows.  They work all day taking care of the cows.  The whole family participates in this activity.

Felipa is requesting the loan to get feed for her cattle.  It is their opportunity to get provisions for the dry season.  This is the way to be sure that they have feed for their dairy cows.  Also, they can maintain their milk production in such a way that their income continues to be stable and does not decrease.

Felipa’s dream is for her children to be able to go to school, have good nourishment, and have a safe house.

loans.use: To buy feed and supplies for her cattle

loans.name: Seneto Ene

texts.en:
Seneto has been selling traditional medicine and doing livestock farming in Naivasha town for the last three years.  She is 42 years old and married to Ntalal Ole Risa. They have two children.  

She was introduced to KADET LTD by her friend and this will be her first loan. She never borrowed from any other MFI. She plans to use the loan to buy goats and sheep, which she will raise and sell later at a profit.

In the future, Seneto hopes to practice livestock farming on a large scale.

loans.use: To buy goats and sheep to raise and sell later at a profit.

loans.name: Tipina Ene

texts.en:
Tipina has been selling clothes in Naivasha town for the last year.  She is 42 years old and married to Jeremiah T.. They have three children.

She was introduced to KADET LTD by her friend and this will be her first loan.  She plans to use the loan to buy more clothes to sell.

In the future, Tipina hopes to grow her business and be able to send all her children through school.

loans.use: To buy more clothes to sell.

loans.name: Kioora Ole

texts.en:
Kioora has been selling clothes in Naivasha town for the last two years.  He is 34 years old, married to Kironua Ene Kioora and they have two children.  

He was introduced to KADET LTD by his friend and this will be his first loan.  He plans to use the loan to buy more clothes to sell.

In the future, Kioora hopes to start supplying clothes at wholesale to different clothes retailers in town.

loans.use: To buy more clothes to sell.

loans.name: Providence

texts.fr: Providence N. est née a Rwanda, et elle a 2 enfants entre 2 ans et 6 ans.  Elle a fini 6 ans d’école post-primaire, et 1 de ses enfants va a l’école.  Elle va utiliser son prêt pour l’achat de 4 sacs de ciments, un camion de pierre, 2 portes, un tuyau pour l’installation de l’électricité, et main d’œuvre pour renouveler sa maison, qu’elle va louer.  Sa stratégie pour la croissance de l’affaire est de renouveler sa maison pour obtenir un revenu de la location de sa maison qui est plus élevé.  Elle voudrait changer son métier pour travailler pour elle seule, scolariser ses enfants, et assurer le bien être de sa famille.
texts.en:
Providence N. was born in Rwanda. She has two children aged 2 and 6. She completed six years of secondary studies, and one of her children attends school. 

She will use her loan to buy four sacks of cement, a truck load of rocks, two doors, a pipe to hook up the electricity, and the labor needed to renovate her house, which she plans to rent out. Her business growth strategy is to renovate her house to increase her rental income. 

She wants to change her occupation to become self-employed, provide her children with an education, and ensure her family’s well-being.

loans.use: To buy four sacks of cement, a truck load of rocks, two doors, a pipe for the electricity hook-up, labor

loans.name: Mumina

texts.en:
Mumina has been selling clothes in Naivasha town for the last three years.  She is 23 years old and a single mother of two children.

She was introduced to KADET LTD by her friend and this will be her third loan. She paid for all her previous loans well and in good time.  She is planning to buy more clothes to sell with the loan.

In the future, Mumina hopes to grow her clothes shop into a big boutique stocking different kinds of clothes.

loans.use: To buy more clothes to sell.

loans.name: Jean Claude

texts.fr: Jean Claude H. a 42 ans, il est marié, et il est né a Rwanda.  Il a 6 enfants entre 5 et 12 ans, 4 de qui vont à l’école, et il a fini 3 ans d’école post-primaire.  Il va utiliser son prêt pour renouveler sa maison ; l’achat des tôles, planches, et cloues.  Sa stratégie pour la croissance de l’affaire est de construire des annexes dans son parcelle pour avoir une autre ressource de revenue, et agrandir sa maison.  Il voudrait avoir des maisonnettes dans son parcelle à louer, renouveler sa maison, et chercher un meilleur endroit pout l’élevage des animaux.  Pour sa famille, il voudrait assurer le bien être de ses enfants, scolariser ses enfants, et élever le niveau de vie de son famille.
texts.en:
Born in Rwanda, Jean Claude H. is a 42-year-old married man. He has six children from 5 to 12 years of age who attend school. He has completed three years of primary school. Jean Claude is going to use his loan for renovating his house and for buying corrugated metal sheets, wooden boards, and some nails. His strategy for business growth is to build additions on his parcel of land in order to have another source of revenues and to expand his house. He would like to have a small house there to rent out.  

Jean Claude would also like to find a better place for raising animals. For his family, he would like to ensure the well-being of his children and their education, as well as to raise the family’s living standard.

loans.use: Renovating the house; buying metal sheets, wooden boards, and nails

loans.name: Rose

texts.fr: Rose K. a 37 ans, elle est mariée, et elle a 6 enfants entre 3 ans et 16 ans.  Elle a fini 1 année d’école post-primaire, et 4 de ses enfants  vont a l’école.  Elle va utiliser son prêt pour l’achat de triplex pour le plafond, ciment, sable, portes, fenêtres, et main d’œuvre pour la construction d’une maison a louer.  Sa stratégie pour la croissance de l’affaire est de renouveler tous ses maisons pour demeurer dans un lieu propre et idéal.  Rose voudrait améliorer son habitation, et aussi améliorer le bien être de sa famille.
texts.en:
Rose K. is 37 years old. She is married and has 6 children between 3 and 16 years old. She completed one year of secondary school and 4 of her children go to school. 
She will use her loan to purchase plyboard for the ceiling, cement, sand, doors and windows and to pay for labor costs for the construction of a house to rent. Her strategy to grow her business is to renovate all her houses in order to live in a clean and ideal place. 
Rose wishes to improve her housing as well as her family's well-being.

loans.use: To purchase plyboard for the ceiling, cement, sand, doors, windows and pay for labor costs

loans.name: Beatha

texts.fr: Beatha M. est commerçante.  Elle a 30 ans, elle est mariée, et elle a un enfant qui a 2 ans.  Elle a aussi une personne en charge, et elle a fini un A1 en gestion.  Elle va utiliser son prêt pour renforcer son stock des vêtements pour accroitre son business.  Sa stratégie pour la croissance de l’affaire est d’élever le stock car le marché est vaste.  Elle voudrait continuer son activité actuelle jusqu'à avoir un magasin de vetements.  Elle voudrait aussi améliorer la maison de sa famille, et scolariser ses enfants.  Beatha est aussi étudiante, choriste, a membre de la comite exécutive du secteur du Kigali.
texts.en: Beatha M. is a storekeeper. She is 30 years old, married; she has a child who is 2 years old, and she also takes care of someone. She earned a postsecondary technical degree in management. She will use her loan to increase her stock of clothing in order to increase her business. Her strategy for the growth of her business is to get a bigger stock because the market is vast. She would like to keep her current activity until she can open a clothing store. She would also like to improve the family house and send her children to school. Beatha is also a student, a chorister, and a member of the executive committee of the Kigali area.

loans.use: Increasing her stock of clothing in order to increase her business

loans.name: Julia

texts.es: Julia, de 24 años, vive en casa de su madre en compañía de ella y de su pequeña hija;  juntas se esfuerzan cada día por salir adelante. Esta emprendedora dama se dedica a la venta de peluches y productos de belleza durante sus ratos libres; pues paralelamente se desempeña como obrera en una fabrica. Le gustan mucho sus labores pues le proporcionan el dinero suficiente para brindarle a su familia una buena calidad de vida. Lo que no le gusta es que debe pasar mucho tiempo fuera de su vivienda, y debe dejar a su pequeña al cuidado de su madre, pero sabe que ella la cuida con mucha dedicación. Como es una joven empeñosa tiene planeado instalar una tienda en su casa para que su madre la atienda, de esta manera espera mejorar sus ganancias. Es el primer crédito que tiene con MFP y promete pagar sus cuotas puntualmente, pues no quiere quedar mal con las personas que hicieron posible este aporte que le permitirá continuar trabajando para cumplir con sus metas. Julia tiene planeado invertir el crédito solicitado en la compra de materiales de construcción que necesita para terminar de construir su casa, pues quiere empezar a concretar el anhelo de la tienda.
texts.en:
Julia, age 24, lives in her mother’s house with her mother and her young daughter.  Together they put forth great effort every day to get ahead.  This enterprising woman sells stuffed animals and beauty products in her free time.  She also works in a factory.  She likes these jobs a lot because they provide her with enough money to give her family a good quality of life.

What she does not like is that she has to spend a lot of time away from home.  She needs to leave her little one in her mother’s care.  However, she knows that her mother takes care of her daughter with much devotion.

As she is a hard-working woman, she plans to set up a store in her house that her mother will take care of.  This way she hopes to improve their income.

This is her first loan with MFP, and she pledges to make her payments on time.  She does not want to disappoint the people who made this loan possible.  The loan will allow her to continue working to meet her goals.  Julia plans to use the requested loan to buy the construction materials that she needs to finish building her house.  She wants to start fulfilling her wish of establishing the store.

loans.use: To finish building her house and to set up a space for her store

loans.name: Khaled

texts.en:
Khaled is a married woman with one child who attends school. She lives in a rental house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are rent bills and school fees.

Khaled has been selling clothes and shoes from home to her neighbours for the past two years. In addition, she sells soft drinks which provides another source of income. Khaled faces a major challenge due to seasonal variability and the high cost of transportation in her business. She hopes to start another business and increase her income. With this loan of 15,000 Kenyan shillings, she wants to start a fish selling business and purchase a bundle of fish to sell. She decided to join Yehu because of the efficiency of the service.
