loans.use: To start a fish selling business and purchase a bundle of fish for resale

loans.name: Rosalio

texts.es:
Rosalio, tiene 43 años y tiene dos hijos, él vive junto con su pareja y sus hijos en la ciudad del Cusco, Perú. El socio Rosalio y su esposa tiene un pequeño negocio de venta de granos secos, él también se dedica a brindar servicios de taxi en toda la ciudad del Cusco, el socio Rosalio cobra el servicio de taxi dependiendo de la distancia que recorre el taxi pues la carrera más corta esta S/2.50 nuevos soles. Rosalio requiere el préstamo para comprar más granos como por ejemplo cebada, trigo, maíz, etc.

Rosalio pertenece al banco comunal “Caminemos Juntas” de la UMF Asociación Arariwa de la ciudad del Cusco, Perú. El banco comunal está conformado por personas emprendedoras y trabajadoras que buscan a cada momento las oportunidades para sacar adelante a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Rosalio, 43 years old, has 2 children and lives together with his partner and their children in the city of Cusco, Peru.  Rosalio and his wife have a small business selling dried grains.  He also drives a taxi in Cusco.  Rosalio charges based on the distance that the taxi travels, from 2.50 nuevo soles and up.  Rosalio wants a loan to buy more grains such as barley, wheat, corn, etc.

Rosalio belongs to the village bank "Caminemos Juntas" in the UMF Arariwa Association in the city of Cusco, Peru.  The village bank is made up of hardworking and innovative people that look for opportunities at every moment to give their children a better life.

loans.use: To buy more grains

loans.name: Nelly

texts.es: Nelly de 40 años, vive en su casa propia al lado de su esposo Manuel de 40 años y sus 3 jóvenes hijos; juntos buscan salir adelante es por esta razón que se esfuerzan a diario. Esta emprendedora mujer se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza de una reconocida marca, y esta muy contenta con su labor pues le permite entretenerse mientras le ofrece a sus amigos y conocidos, además por su capacidad de persuasión logra vender seguido. Paralelamente a esta actividad, comercializa ropa de dormir, por pedido, es decir cuando le encargan trae de los mayoristas de la ciudad  diversidad de colchas y sábanas, este negocio le genera buenas ganancias, pues los ofrece a crédito pero a mayor precio del real. Como si fuera poco durante los fines de semana se debe despertar temprano para empezar con la venta de  tamales en la puerta de una panadería, y en la labor le ayudan sus hijos, además tiene muchos planes para el futuro como el de instalar un bazar en su vivienda, pues por su zona no tiene competencia. Es el séptimo crédito que tiene con MFP y promete pagar puntualmente sus cuotas, pues no quiere quedar mal con las personas que hicieron posible el dinero que le permitirá continuar trabajando en busca del progreso. Nelly tiene planeado invertir el crédito solicitado en la compra de sabanas y cosméticos para tener en stock, pues tiene varios pedidos pendientes que quiere concretar para mejorar sus ganancias.
texts.en:
Nelly, age 40, lives in her own house with her 40 year old husband, Manuel, and their three young children.  Together they look to get ahead.  That is why they work hard every day.  This enterprising woman sells a very well-known brand of beauty products.  She is very happy with this work.  It allows her to enjoy herself while she sells to her friends and acquaintances.  With her power of persuasion, she manages to make frequent sales.  She also sells sleepwear by order.  This means that when she has orders, she gets a diversity of comforters and sheets from the wholesalers in the city.  This business generates good income.  She offers credit, but it is more expensive than paying in cash.

As if this weren’t enough, on the week-ends she needs to get up early to start selling tamales at the doorway of a bakery.  With her work she helps her children.  Also, she has many plans for the future like setting up a store in her house.  There is no competition in her area.

This is her seventh loan with MFP, and she pledges to make her payments on time.  She does not want to disappoint the people who made the loan possible.  The loan will allow her to keep working as she looks to make progress.  Nelly plans to use the requested loan to buy sheets and cosmetics in order to have stock.  She has various pending orders that she wants to fill to improve her income.

loans.use: To buy sheets and cosmetics to fill her customers' orders

loans.name: Gina

texts.en: Gina is a married woman who lives in Narra, Palawan. She earns her living by buying and selling dry goods. Her husband, Basmala, who is 42 years old, works as a driver to earn his living and also helps in his wife's business activities. They have 10 children who are from 2 to 22 years old. Gina joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2004 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past 21 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Gina has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of 29,500 Philippines pesos (PHP) helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 20,000, thus uplifting the family's standard of living. This time, for her 23rd loan, she is borrowing PHP 29,500, which she intends to use to buy more stock of dry goods to sell at the market so that she can continue to save up for the future education of her children. Gina is a Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means honorable) woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams. About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon. Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by visiting the NWTF lending team on Kiva to join our team.

loans.use: Purchase more stock of dry goods to sell

loans.name: Maria

texts.es: María, de 37 años, vive en su casa que es propia al lado de su pareja y sus dos hijos pequeños, juntos se esfuerzan a diario para salir adelante. Esta emprendedora mujer se dedica desde hace 2 años a la venta de productos naturales de una reconocida marca en el mercado. Ella ofrece a sus amigos y conocidos, quienes le pagan a crédito a un poco mas del precio real de la mercadería natural. Esta muy satisfecha pues tiene regulares ganancias de las ventas y así puede ayudar a su pareja en los constantes gastos del hogar, de a pocos salen adelante con constante trabajo. Le gusta mucho su labor pues le permite criar a sus hijos sin problemas y no descuida las labores del hogar. Ya tiene muchos planes para el futuro como el de instalar una tienda de venta de productos naturales, para esto quiere habilitar una pieza de su casa y así piensa seguir adelante. Es el séptimo crédito que tiene con MFP y promete pagar puntualmente sus cuotas, pues no quiere quedar mal con las personas que hicieron posible este aporte que le permitirá continuar trabajando en su negocio. María tiene planeado invertir el crédito solicitado en la compra de varios productos naturales, pues tiene pedidos y le falta capital, de esta manera espera aumentar sus ganancias.
texts.en:
María, 37, lives in her own house, together with her husband and their two small children. Together they work daily to get ahead. This enterprising woman has been working for two years in sales of a well-known brand of natural products. She offers the products to friends and acquaintances, who can buy them on credit for slightly more than the market price. 

María is very satisfied with her business, as she has regular income and can help her husband with the household expenses. They are gradually getting ahead with constant work. She also likes that her business allows her to raise her children without problems, and to attend to the household chores.

María already has many plans for the future, such as building a natural products store in her home. This will require remodeling part of the house.

This is María’s seventh loan with MFP and she promises to be punctual with her payments, as she does not want to let down the people who have provided the support for her business. The loan will be used to purchase various natural products. She has outstanding orders, but lacks the capital to fill them. In this way, she hopes to increase her earnings.

loans.use: Purchase natural products for sale

loans.name: Norma

texts.es:
Norma, tiene 27 años de edad y tiene su pareja, ella vive junto con su pareja en la ciudad del Cusco, Perú. La socia Norma y su pareja tiene un pequeño negocio de venta de granos secos, ella tiene un puesto de venta en el mercado de “El Molino” de la ciudad del Cusco. Norma requiere el préstamo para comprar más granos como por ejemplo cebada, trigo, maíz, etc.

Norma pertenece al banco comunal “Caminemos Juntas” de la UMF Asociación Arariwa de la ciudad del Cusco, Perú. El banco comunal está conformado por personas emprendedoras y trabajadoras que buscan a cada momento las oportunidades para sacar adelante a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Norma is 27 years old and has a partner. She lives with her partner in the city of Cusco, Perú. Norma and her partner have a small business selling basic grains. She has a stall in the “El Molino” market in Cusco. Norma needs the loan to buy more grains, such as barley, wheat, corn, etc. 

Norma belongs to the “Juntas Caminemos” communal bank of the UMF Asociación Arariwa in Cusco, Perú. The communal bank is made up of hardworking people who are looking for every opportunity to help their children get ahead.

loans.use: To buy more grains

loans.name: Uma

texts.en: This is 40-year-old Uma P.. She is married and has three children, aged 20, 17 and 14. In 2006, she established her tea shop business. Working seven days a week and nine hours a day, she supports her family. She has already received and successfully repaid one loan from Patan BPW and used her most recent to buy food materials for her business. In the future, Uma plans to uplift the economic condition of her family. She thanks you for your support. Whether on the streets of Kathmandu or in the villages outside of the capital, tea shops are places of business and meeting in Nepal. Called a chiya pasal, these tea shops make a sweet, milky tea that can be purchased for a few cents a cup. With a Kiva loan, BPW's borrowers are able to keep their store shelves stocked while increasing their profit margins by buying in greater volume. This loan was administered by Kiva's local partner MFI (microfinance institution), Patan Business and Professional Women. Patan BPW became Kiva's first field partner in Nepal in 2007. Patan BPW operates throughout the Kathmandu Valley, offering microcredit and business-training programs to low-income women. In addition to providing economic opportunity to their clients, Patan BPW seeks to empower Nepali women within the home and community. For more information about Patan BPW, visit our partner page and keep an eye out for new loans and borrower updates. Join our lending team.

loans.use: To buy food materials for her business

loans.name: Grace

texts.en: Grace M. is a married woman who lives in Brgy. Liloan, Santander, Cebu. She earns her living by operating three business ventures: a general store, videoke rental and fish vending. Her husband, Antonio M., Jr., is 51 years old and works as a pumpboat captain to earn his living. He also helps with his wife's business activities. They have five children who are from 14 to 24 years old; two of her children have their own families and one is currently going to school. Grace joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2004 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past 11 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Grace has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of 25,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 12,000, thus uplifting the family's standard of living. This time, for her 12th loan, she is borrowing PHP 29,500, which she intends to use to buy stock for the store and as a down payment for a new motorcycle. She hopes to continue to save for the future and for her children's education. Grace M. is a Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means honorable) woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams. About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon. Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by visiting the NWTF lending team on Kiva to join our team.

loans.use: Purchase more stock for the general store

loans.name: Myrene

texts.en: Myrene is a married woman who lives in Medellin, Cebu. She earns her living by fishing. Her husband, Mario L. Jr., is 27 years old and works as a fisherman to earn his living and also helps in his wife's business activities. They have two children who are 1 and 5 years old. Myrene joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2007 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past five loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Myrene has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of 11,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 11,000, thus uplifting the family's standard of living. This time, for her sixth loan, she is borrowing PHP 12,000, which she intends to use to buy fishing gear and equipment so that she can continue to save up for the future expansion of her business. Myrene is a Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means honorable) woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams. About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon. Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by visiting the NWTF lending team on Kiva to join our team.

loans.use: Purchase fishing gear and equipment

loans.name: Nuevo Amanecer (Sancris) Group

texts.es: Doña Rosario M. A., tiene 46 años D. edad, es casada, cursos el sexto año D. primaria en la escuela, tiene 5 hijos, 3 D. los cuales estudian, se dedica a una tienda D. artículos D. consumo diario, igualmente el esposo D. ella se dedica al comercio, doña Rosario tiene seis años D. experiencia con este tipo D. negocio, inicio su negocio con mil quetzales, y quiere incrementar su capital para mejorar sus ingresos y ganancias. Por lo que reunio a 9 compañeras para solocitar un préstamo que a cada una les servirá D. capital en la actividad que realizan, ya que cada uno D. ellas tambien se dedican a actividades productivas como: Venta D. artículos D. consumo diario, Venta D. Refacciones, Crianza D. animales, Confección D. playeras, y Tejido D. sabanas.
texts.en:
Mrs. Rosario M. A. is 46 years old, and has completed six years of school. She has five children, three of whom are still in school. Her business is a general store. Her husband is also a businessman. 

Rosario has six years of experience in this type of business. She began with a capital investment of 1000 quetzals [about $125 US] and now wants to increase her investment in order to improve her income. For this reaS., she got together with her nine communal bank associates to solicit this loan. 

The loan will be used by each member for her own business. Some of the businesses are: basic goods sales, snack sales, animal raising, t-shirt making, and sewing of bedsheets.

loans.use: Working capital for general store

loans.name: Bonifacio

texts.en: Bonifacio is a 33-year-old single man who supports his family by operating two business ventures: seaweed culturing and fishing. He lives in Bantayan, Cebu. Bonifacio joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2005 because he aspired for something better for his family. With the help of his past nine loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Bonifacio has been incrementally lifting his family out of poverty by the sweat of his brow. His previous loan of 11,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) helped him earn a monthly profit of PHP 20,000, thus uplifting the family's standard of living. This time, for his 10th loan, he is borrowing PHP 11,000, which he intends to use to buy fishing gear and equipment so that he can continue to save up for the future expansion of his business. Bonifacio is a Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means honorable) man who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of his dreams. About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon. Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by visiting the NWTF lending team on Kiva to join our team.

loans.use: Purchase fishing gear and equipment

loans.name: Regina

texts.en:
This is 34-year-old Regina. She is married and has two children, ages 7 and 5. In 2006, Regina established her clothing-material business. She began her business because she wanted to be self-reliant. Working six days a week and 12 hours a day, she earns about 2,792,400 Sierra Leone leones (Le) every month from this business. 

She would like a loan in the amount of Le 4,000,000 in order to buy additional lace and cotton. She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately Le 418,860. In the future, Regina plans to help educate her children, expand her shop, and, if possible, build a house for her family. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy additional clothing materials

loans.name: Nuevo Amanecer La Rinconada Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “NUEVO AMANECER LA RINCONADA”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Andahuaylillas, perteneciente a la provincia de Quispicanchis y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Luz Ericka; ella tiene 25 años de edad y es conviviente y tiene 1 Hijo; La socia  tiene un negocio de venta de animales, ella vende pollos y patos y también trabaja en un comedor para niños como cocinera, la socia el negocio de venta de animales lo vende en forma ambulatoria, ya que tiene una pequeña granja en su casa, la socia quiere ampliar y mejorar el negocio de venta de animales.  La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar animales como pollos y patos.

Los otros socios  se dedican la agricultura, tienda de abarrotes, ganadería, crianza de animales y restaurant.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
These are members of the communal bank known as “Nuevo Amanecer la Rinconada.”  This bank is located in the Andahuaylillas district, province of Quispicanchis, department of Cuzco.

This member is Mrs. Luz Ericka.  She is 25 years old, lives with a partner, and has a child.  Her business is selling animals; she sells chickens and ducks.  She also works as a cook in a dining hall for children.  She sells her animals by traveling around, for she has a small farm at her home.  She wishes to expand and improve her animal-sales business, and requests a loan to buy animals such as chickens and ducks.

The other members work in farming, a general store, livestock, animal husbandry, and a restaurant.  

This member is happy to have a loan, and commits to make payments as required.

loans.use: This members requests a loan to buy animals, such as chickens and ducks.

loans.name: Francess Lucia

texts.en:
This is 37-year-old Francess. She is married and has three children, ages 13, 12 and 9. She has two additional dependents who live with her because they assist with her family. 

In 2010, Francess established her cosmetics business because she wanted to be self-reliant. Working six days a week and 13 hours a day, she earns about 1,450,000 Sierra Leone leones (Le) every month. 

She would like a loan in the amount of Le 3,000,000 in order to buy additional cosmetics. She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately Le 290,000. 

In the future, Francess plans to expand her business by adding another shop and would like to educate her children. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy additional cosmetics

loans.name: Jose Armando

texts.es: El señor José Armando García labora para MATECSA como mecánico automotriz tiene 6 años de laborar es casado tiene cuatro personas a su cargo, en edad escolar este es el cuarto crédito trabajado con CEPRODEL los cuales han sido para mejorar su vivienda y dar mejor comodidad a sus hijos. Este último es para compra de bloque, cemento, hierro para realizar una obra incompleta en su vivienda.
texts.en: Señor José Armando García has been working for Matecsa as an automotive mechanic for 6 years.  He is married and supports four people.  His children are school-aged.  This is his fourth loan with CEPRODEL.  His previous loans have been for housing improvements to give his children a more comfortable place to live.  This most recent loan is for the purchase of blocks, cement, and iron to finish an incomplete project on his home.

loans.use: Housing improvements

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Saraswati

texts.en: This is 50-year-old Saraswati T.. She is married and has two children, aged 30 and 26. In 2007, she established her cow-raising business. Working seven days a week and three hours a day, she supports her family. She has already received and successfully repaid one loan from Patan BPW and used her most recent to buy a young, milk-giving cow. In the future, Saraswati plans to uplift the economic condition of her family. She thanks you for your support. Dairy cows are an important source of nutrition and income in Nepal. Cows are never raised for beef, but for their milk from which curd (duy) and fresh cheese (paneer) are made. Jersey cows are the preferred breed for milking. On average, a dairy cow in Nepal will produce about 10 liters of milk each day. In the local market, a liter of milk sells for about $0.50. In addition to producing milk, cows provide dung that is used in home construction, as fuel for fires, and can be captured in methane storage tanks. The purchase of a dairy cow, made possible through a Kiva loan, is an investment that will repay itself many times over. This loan was administered by Kiva's local partner MFI (microfinance institution), Patan Business and Professional Women. Patan BPW became Kiva's first field partner in Nepal in 2007. Patan BPW operates throughout the Kathmandu Valley, offering microcredit and business-training programs to low-income women. In addition to providing economic opportunity to their clients, Patan BPW seeks to empower Nepali women within the home and community. For more information about Patan BPW, visit our partner page and keep an eye out for new loans and borrower updates. Join our lending team.

loans.use: To buy a young, milk-giving cow

loans.name: Esther

texts.es: Esther, es una mujer amable de 35 años, que junto a su esposo Nildo, cuidan de sus 2 hijas: Mayli y Gabriela. En armonía familiar ellos viven en su casa propia, ubicada en el caserío de Patay. Su rostro alegre y encantador es sinónimo de su éxito, ya que estar feliz y sentirse tranquila es lo más preciado que tiene. La agricultura es su principal actividad económica, ya tiene 8 años dedicándose a la siembra de flor de gladiolo, arveja, papa y zanahoria. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es poder comercializar lo que cosecha, de esa manera tiene la recompensa de tanto esfuerzo. Una vez al mes viaja a la capital del país a comercializar la flor de gladiolo que siembra. Para el futuro está trabajadora mujer desea seguir sembrando en mayores cantidades, por ello ahora comenzará a sembrar papa de la variedad “munición”. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “Picaflores de Patay”, y este es el cuarto crédito que tiene con MFP, donde es una socia responsable, sincera y sobre todo solidaria. Esther muy pronto cosechará flor de gladiolo a puertas de las próximas festividades del país; por ello con el crédito solicitado, comprará varios sacos de abono orgánico, para esparcirlos entre sus sembríos y obtener una buena cosecha.
texts.en: Esther is a friendly 35 year-old woman.  Together with her husband, Nildo, she takes care of their 2 daughters, Mayli and Gabriela.  Their family lives together harmoniously in their own home in the small village of Patay. Her happy and delightful face is synonymous with her success.  For her, being happy and feeling at peace are the most valuable.  Agriculture is her main business.  For 8 years she has made her living growing gladiolus flowers, peas, potatoes and carrots.  What she likes best about her work his being able to sell what she harvests; it helps her to feel rewarded for her efforts.  Once a month she travels to the capital of the country to sell her gladiolus flowers.  Because this hard-working woman hopes to continue planting in greater quantities in the future, she is planning to plant a potato variety called “munición”. Esther belongs to the communal bank “Picaflores de Patay” (Hummingbirds of Patay).  This is her fourth loan with MFP, where she is a responsible, sincere and above all else, supportive member.  Very soon Esther will harvest her gladiolus flowers for the approaching national holiday.  With the loan she has requested, she will purchase a number of sacks of organic fertilizer to spread out in her fields to help her obtain a good harvest.

loans.use: To purchase a number of sacks of organic fertilizer.

loans.name: Yeabu

texts.en:
This is 56 year-old Yeabu. She is married and has three children. She has three additional dependents who live with her because they help with her family. In 1990, Yeabu established her home appliances business. She began her business because she wanted to be self-reliant. Working seven days a week and eight hours a day, she earns about Le 2,610,000 every month from this business.

 She would like a loan in the amount of Le 3,000,000 in order to buy additional rubber bowls. She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately Le 432,200. 

In the future, Yeabu plans to buy a concrete shop with steel doors. Yeabu would also like to increase her stock and renovate her home. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: The loan is used to buy additional home appliances

loans.name: Devaki

texts.en:
This is 38 year-old Devaki K..  She is married and has 2 children aged 16 and 14.  In 2005, she established  her grocery store business.  Working 7 days a week and 8 hours a day, she supoorts her family.  She has already received and successfully repaid 3 loans from Patan BPW and used her most recent to buys grocery goods for her shop.  

In the future, Devaki plans to uplift the economic condition of her family.  She thanks you for your support.  

In the Kathmandu Valley, the small grocery stores, called a pasal, is an important part of the local economy.  Fresh produce, milk, and staples such as rice, lentils, and flour are purchased daily for cooking in the home.  Owners of small grocery stores use Kiva loans to increase their purchasing power and profit margains.  By keeping inventory strong and purchasing in larger amounts, owners of these small stores are able to increase profitability.  While a typical pasal might be no more than 100 sq. feet, they are always full of bargaining customers, incoming produce, and shrewd businesswomen. This loan was administered by Kiva's local partner MFI, Patan Business and Professional Women. Patan BPW became Kiva's first field partner in Nepal in 2007.  Patan BPW operates throughout the Kathmandu Valley, offering microcredit and business training programs to low-income women.  In addition to providing economic opportunity to their clients, Patan BPW seeks to empower Nepali women within the home and community.  For more information about Patan BPW, visit our partner page and keep an eye out for new loans and borrower updates:
 BPW Partner Page     Join our lending team: BPW Lending Team"

loans.use: to buys grocery goods for her shop

loans.name: Albertina

texts.es:
Albertina, tiene 46 años de edad y es casada, ella vive junto con su esposo y sus dos hijos en la ciudad del Cusco, Perú. La socia Albertina y su pareja tiene un taxi que les sirve para brindar servicio de transporte urbano, ella también se dedica a la confección de artesanía de tipo bisutería y trabaja de forma independiente. Albertina requiere el préstamo para hacer mantenimiento de su taxi. 

Albertina pertenece al banco comunal “Caminemos Juntas” de la UMF Asociación Arariwa de la ciudad del Cusco, Perú. El banco comunal está conformado por personas emprendedoras y trabajadoras que buscan a cada momento las oportunidades para sacar adelante a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Albertina is 46 years old and she is married. She lives with her husband and her two children in the city of Cusco, Perú. Albertina and her husband have a taxi that they use to provide urban transport. She also makes costume jewelry, working independently. Albertina needs the loan to do maintenance work on her taxi. 

Albertina belongs to the “Caminemos Juntas” communal bank of the UMF Asociación Arariwa in Cusco, Perú. The communal bank is made up of hardworking people who are looking for every opportunity to help their children get ahead.

loans.use: To have maintenance work done on her taxi

loans.name: Abu Bakarr

texts.en:
This is 30 year-old Abu Bakarr. He is married and has one two year-old child. He has one additional dependent who lives with him who is a relative of his wife. In 2008, Abu established his electrical appliances business because he wanted to be self-dependent. Working 6 days a week and 11 hours a day, he earns about Le 1,950,000 every month from this business. 

He would like a loan in the amount of Le 4,000,000 in order to buy additional electrical appliances. He hopes that this loan will enable him to increase his monthly profits by approximately Le 390,000. 

In the future, Abu plans to increase his business. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: The loan is used to buy additional electrical appliances

loans.name: Angelica

texts.es: Angélica, tiene 36 años, vive junto a su esposo Luis y sus 3 hijos a los que quiere mucho. En armonía familiar ellos viven en su casa propia, ubicada en el caserío de Patay. Ella es muy feliz, todas las mañanas desde las primeras horas de la mañana junto a su esposo Luis, se dirige a sus sembríos de papa, olluco, arvejas y habas, los cuales siembra en sus propios terrenos agrícolas. Su principal ayuda es su esposo, que es su socio también en este trabajo. Tienen 10 años dedicándose a la agricultura y lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es poder pasar la mayor parte de su tiempo en compañía de su familia. Por el desarrollo y éxito de su negocio, desea en adelante ahorrar el crédito suficiente para poder adquirir un camión y de esa manera minimizar los gastos de trasporte que realizan de la ciudad al mercado mayorista de la ciudad, donde lleva a comercializar su cosecha. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “Picaflores de Patay”, y este es el cuarto crédito que tiene con MFP, donde es una socia trabajadora y muy puntual en sus cuotas. Angélica se está preparando para la campaña agrícola, por ello con el crédito comprará semillas de arvejas, asimismo varios sacos de abono orgánico para comenzar sus sembríos de papa y arveja.
texts.en: Angelica, 36, lives with her husband Luis and their 3 children, whom she loves very much.  The family lives together peacefully in their own home, located in the rural Patay settlement.  She is a cheerful person who works from the earliest hours of the morning with her husband Luis, managing their cultivations of potatoes, olluco (an Andean tuber), peas and beans, which they cultivate on their own lands.  She is helped out mainly by her husband, who is also her partner in this work.  They have been farmers for 10 years, and what they like most about their work is being able to spend most of their time in the company of their family.  For the development and success of their business, they want to save enough so that in the future they will have enough money to buy a truck.  In this way they could minimize the transportation costs associated with taking their harvests to the wholesale market in the city where they go to sell their crops.  She belongs to the communal bank "Picaflores de Patay," and this is the 4th loan that she has taken with MFP, where she is a hardworking member who is very punctual with her payments.  Angelica is getting ready for the next planting season, and so she will use this loan to buy pea seeds, and also a number of sacks of organic fertilizer so that she can begin planting her potato and pea crops.

loans.use: to buy pea seeds and sacks of organic fertilizer

loans.name: Leonard

texts.en:
This is 33 year-old Leonard. He is married and has no children. Leonard established his pharmaceutical drugs business because he wants to become a pharmacist. Leonard operates his business 6 days a week and 10 hours a day. 

He would like a loan in the amount of Le 3,000.000 in order to buy more medicine. In the future, Leonard plans to grow his business. He would also like to tell others about how the loan has helped him. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy more drugs to sell

loans.name: Ishori

texts.en:
This is 51 year-old Ishori Khatri.  She is married and has 2 children aged 35 and 30.  In 1995, she established  her vegetable farming business.  Working 7 days a week and 5 hours a day, she suports her family.  She has already received and successfully repaid 4 loans from Patan BPW and used her most recent to buy seeds and fertilizer for farming.  

In the future, Ishori plans to uplift the economic condition of her family.  She thanks you for your support.   

Over 70% of Nepal's economy is agricultural.  Typically, Nepali households grow crops on small plots of terraced land.  Rice (bhat), lentils (daal), and vegetables (thakari) are the staples of the Nepali diet.  With a Kiva loan, BPW's borrowers are able to purchase greater amounts of seed and fertilizer.  With more seeds and fertilizer, a borrower is able to grow cash crops to be sold in the local market.  Such crops allow households to move beyond subsistence and provide much-needed cash income throughout the year. 

 Rice (bhat), lentils (daal), and vegetables (thakari) are the staples of the Nepali diet.  With a Kiva loan, BPW's borrowers are able to purchase greater amounts of seed and fertilizer.  With more seeds and fertilizer, a borrower is able to grow cash crops to be sold in the local market.  Such crops allow households to move beyond subsistence and provide much-needed cash income throughout the year.

This loan was administered by Kiva's local partner MFI, Patan Business and Professional Women. Patan BPW became Kiva's first field partner in Nepal in 2007.  Patan BPW operates throughout the Kathmandu Valley, offering microcredit and business training programs to low-income women.  In addition to providing economic opportunity to their clients, Patan BPW seeks to empower Nepali women within the home and community.  For more information about Patan BPW, visit our partner page and keep an eye out for new loans and borrower updates:
 BPW Partner Page     Join our lending team: BPW Lending Team"

loans.use: to buys seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Nora

texts.es: Nora, es una mujer única siempre fuerte e imponente, ella tiene 43 años, y en compañía de su esposo Percy, salen adelante en su casa propia ubicada en el caserío de Patay. A pesar de que su esposo trabaja en otra ciudad y no tiene mayores necesidades, está trabajadora mujer le gusta ser independiente y luchadora. Hace 20 años que se dedica a la agricultura, donde comenzó junto a su esposo a sembrar productos oriundos de la zona como: flor de gladiolo, habas, arvejas y papa; pero hace algunos años Percy, se fue a trabajar fuera de la ciudad, dejando en manos de Nora el cuidado de sus terrenos agrícolas, los que gracias a su buen juicio logró sacar adelante. Una vez al mes viaja a la capital a vender lo que ha cosechado. Por toda la capacidad que está demostrando desea en adelante mejorar sus sembríos y así poder generar mejores ganancias. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “Picaflores de Patay”, y este es el cuarto préstamo que tienen con MFP, donde asume la secretaría de su asociación, siendo una integrante responsable y muy comprometida. Nora muy pronto cosechará habas y papa. Todo el capital que tiene lo invertirá en la fertilización de sus plantaciones para que le den un buen fruto; por ello con el crédito solicitado, comprará una bolsa de semilla de arveja, que esparcirá entre sus sembríos después de la cosecha.
texts.en: Nora,is a unique, always strong and imposing woman.  She is 43 years old, and, along with her husband Percy, they do well in their own house located in the settlement of Patay.  In spite of the fact that her husband works in another city and she does not have basic necessities, this hard-working woman likes to be independent and a fighter.  For twenty years she has been dedicated to agriculture, which she began along with her husband sowing native products of the zone such as: gladiolus flowers, beans, peas and potatoes.   But some years ago Percy went to work away from the city, leaving the care of their agricultural lands in the hands of Nora. Thanks to her good judgment she managed to move ahead.  Once a month she travels to the capital to sell what she has harvested.  For all the capacity that she is showing she desires to improve her sown fields and thus to be able to generate better profits.  She belongs to the communal bank "Hummingbirds of Patay", and this is the fourth loan that she has had with MFP, where she assumes the office of the secretary of her association, being a responsible member and very agreeable.  Nora very soon will harvest beans and potatoes.  All the capital that she has will be invested it in the fertilization of her crops so that they give her a good yield.  Because of this she requests a loan to buy a sack of seed for peas which she will spread in her fields after the crop is harvested.

loans.use: To buy seeds for peas.

loans.name: Juana Bautista

texts.es:
Juana Bautista vive en el barrio carrizal de Barranquilla, en una casa familiar en compañía de su hija que comparte con sus sobrinos. A Juana la separación de su esposo  y su inmenso deseo de salir adelante con su joven hija de 16 años, le impulsaron su espíritu emprendedor con el que ha logrado negocios, que la sostienen y que muy seguramente  le darán  la opción de alcanzar el sueño de convertir a su hija una profesional exitosa. Ellas en la actualidad comparten un casa familiar con sus sobrinos  en un pequeño espacio de la vivienda, donde desde hace ya diez años se dedica a la fabricación de escobas, traperos, cepillos, experiencia aprendida de una amiga al verla en dificultades para conseguir ingresos y ella fue adicionalmente capacitándose y aprendiendo tanto en lo productivo como en lo administrativo, generando sus propias oportunidades y  logrando con sus ahorros, comprar todas las herramientas y equipos para su desempeño. Progresivamente  Juana fue adicionando  otra actividad  que es la venta de refrescos y bebidas, dulces y variedades en general, ahora cuenta  con su maquinaria básica, equipos, enfriador y estanterías, para realizar sus actividades generadoras de ingresos, con la que ha apoyado a su familia, un hermano y un sobrino que  la ayudan en la fabricación de estos productos y también ha generado 10 empleos en las personas de la comunidad,  con  quienes cuenta para el impulso de su venta en  el municipio de Barranquilla  y en general en poblaciones del departamento del Atlántico y de  Bolívar. Juana cuenta que recientemente se han incrementado los pedidos de los vendedores y también para diciembre, su otro negocio de refrescos y variedades tuvo un repunte en las ventas. Este es su prime crédito con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con este credikiva comprará materiales para la elaboración de sus productos como paja, algodón,  listones de madera y cepillos de lavar; Su promedio de ventas mensuales es de $1.500.000 COP, su margen de utilidad es del 50%, su autonomía es del 98.9%,  su liquidez de 5-1 sus ventas las realiza  de contado. 
Juana es una mujer feliz de tener este negocio porque le encanta atender a su clientela y siente su actividad productiva muy agradable por eso  disfruta de ella y se mantiene sonriente.
texts.en:
Juana Bautista lives in Carrizal neighborhood, in Barranquilla.  Juana and her daughter live in a family member's home that they share with her nieces and nephews.  Juana's separation from her husband and her immense desire to get herself and her 16 year-old daughter ahead in life, drove her entrepreneurial spirit, with which she has succeeded in setting up businesses that support herself and which will almost certainly allow her to reach her dream of turning her daughter into a successful professional.

Juana and her daughter currently share a family member's house with her nieces and nephews.  They live in a small part of the house where, for ten years now, Juana has worked making brooms, floor cloths and brushes.  She learned this trade from a friend who saw that she was having difficulties in making income.  Juana trained and learned how to make her products and also how to run her business and make her own opportunities.  With some savings she had, she was able to buy all the tools and supplies that she needed to carry out her business.

Juana also started out in another business activity, selling soft drinks, sweet treats and other general snacks.  She now has the basic machinery, tools, chiller cabinet and shelving that she needs to carry out her income-generating business activities.  Through her businesses, she has managed to support her family.  A brother and a nephew help her to make her products and she has also created 10 jobs for other people in her community on whom she relies for her sales in the town of Barranquilla and in the towns of Atlántico and Bolívar departments.

Juana tells us that her sellers' orders have increased recently and also, during the month of December, her other business selling drinks and snacks saw an upturn in sales.

This is Juana's first loan from Fundación Mario Santo Domingo.  She will use this Kiva loan to buy materials for making her products: straw, cotton, wooden bars and cleaning brushes.  Juana's average monthly sales amount to $1,500,000 Colombian pesos, her profit margin is 50%, her autonomy is 98.9%, her liquidity is 5-1 and her sales are made in cash.  Juana is happy to have her business because she loves serving her customers and she enjoys her productive activity.  She enjoys her work and it keeps her smiling.

loans.use: To buy materials for making her products: straw, cotton, wooden bars, cleaning brushes

loans.name: Guillermo

texts.es:
Guillermo, tiene 45 años de edad y es casado, él vive junto con su esposa y sus tres hijos en la ciudad del Cusco, Perú. El socio Guillermo y su pareja tienen una pequeña librería donde vende cuadernos, papeles y muchas cosas más,   el socio requiere el préstamo para comprar mercadería como por ejemplo cuadernos, lapiceros, instrumentos de ingeniería.

Guillermo pertenece al banco comunal “Caminemos Juntas” de la UMF Asociación Arariwa de la ciudad del Cusco, Perú. El banco comunal está conformado por personas emprendedoras y trabajadoras que buscan a cada momento las oportunidades para sacar adelante a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Guillermo is 45 years old, married, and lives with his wife and three children in Cuzco, Peru.  Guillermo and his wife have a small stationery store, where they sell notebooks, papers, and many other items.  He needs a loan to buy merchandise such as notebooks, pencil holders, and drafting instruments.

Guillermo belongs to the “Caminemos Juntas” communal bank (“let’s walk together”), part of the UMF Arariwa Association in Cuzco, Peru.  The communal bank is made up of hard-working, enterprising people who are always looking for opportunities to improve the lives of their children.

loans.use: To buy merchandise such as notebooks, pencil holders, drafting instruments.

loans.name: Soledad

texts.es:
Soledad, tiene 19 años de edad, es soltera y vive en la ciudad del Cusco, Perú. Su actividad económica principal es compra y venta de fruta, ella viaja a la ciudad de Yanatile en donde compra frutas y después vende sus productos en la ciudades del Cusco y Calca. Soledad es una joven trabajadora y emprendedora y actualmente está estudiando la carrera profesional de contabilidad. Soledad requiere el préstamo para comprar más frutas.

Soledad pertenece al banco comunal “Caminemos Juntas” de la UMF Asociación Arariwa de la ciudad del Cusco, Perú. El banco comunal está conformado por personas emprendedoras y trabajadoras que buscan a cada momento las oportunidades para sacar adelante a sus hijos.
texts.en: Soledad, age 19, is single and lives en the city of Cusco, Peru.  Her main work is buying and selling fruit.  She travels to the city of Yanatile where she buys fruit and later sells her products in the cities of Cusco and Calca.  Soledad is young, hard-working, and enterprising. She currently is studying to become an accountant.  Soledad requires a loan to buy more fruits.  Soledad belongs to the community bank "Caminemos Juntas (We walk together)" of the UMF association Arariwa in the city of Cusco, Peru.  The community bank is made up of enterprising, hard-working people that search every moment for opportunities to uplift and help their children.

loans.use: To buy more fruits.

loans.name: Reyes Carvajal Group

texts.es: El Banco D. Emprendimiento Reyes Carvajal es un banco que se fundo en la zona que tiene el mismo nombre al sur D. la ciudad D. la paz, es una zona que esta situada sobre un pequeño cerro, al cual solamente ingresa una línea D. minibuses. El banco D. emprendimiento esta compuesto por 8 socias las cuales se dedican a diversos trabajos para poder sobresalir adelante, tal es el caso D. la presidenta, la Sra. Daría quien se dedica a la venta D. comida en la parada D. minibuses D. su misma zona, ella vive con el esposo ya que sus hijos son mayores D. edad y ya tienen  sus propias familias. La Sra. invertirá el préstamo para el aumento D. mercadería en su kiosco comprar abarrotes como arroz, aceite, papa, etc.  Y así poder generar mayores ingresos para su familia, es un apersona muy trabajadora y esta agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en: The "Emprendimiento Reyes Carvajal" bank is a bank that was founded in the zone that has the same name in the south of the city of La Paz. It is a zone that is located on a small hill, which is only accessible by a line of small buses. The enterprising bank is maD. up of eight members which do various jobs to get ahead in society. This is also the situation of the president, Mrs. Daría, who sells food at the bus stop in her own area. She lives with her husband. Her children are older and already have their own families. She will invest the loan by purchasing merchandise for her kiosk such as rice, oil, potatoes, etc. In this way, she will be able to generate a greater income for her family. She is a very hard-working person and is thankful to the institution for the support it offers.

loans.use: Purchase groceries

loans.name: Celia

texts.es:
Celia, tiene 38 años de edad y vive en la ciudad del Cusco, ella es madre y padre para su hijo. Celia es una mujer emprendedora y trabajadora que se dedica a la venta de pasamanería y también se dedica a la confección de artesanía de tipo bisutería, ella requiere el préstamo para comprar más mercadería como por ejemplo betunes, cepillos, botones, pasadores y muchas cosas más. 

Celia pertenece al banco comunal “Caminemos Juntas” de la UMF Asociación Arariwa de la ciudad del Cusco, Perú. El banco comunal está conformado por personas emprendedoras y trabajadoras que buscan a cada momento las oportunidades para sacar adelante a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Ceila is 38 years old and she lives in the city of Cusco. She is a single mother with one son. Celia is a hardworking woman who sells decorative fringe and lace and also makes costume jewelry. she needs a loan to buy more merchandise, such as shoe polishes, brushes, buttons, shoelaces, and many other things. 

Celia belongs to the “Caminemos Juntas” communal bank of the UMF Asociación Arariwa in Cusco, Perú. The communal bank is made up of enterprising and hardworking people who are looking for every opportunity to help their children get ahead.

loans.use: To buy more merchandise, such as shoe polishes, brushes, buttons, shoelaces, and many other things

loans.name: Lidia

texts.es: Lidia, es una mujer fuerte. Ella tiene 48 años, enviudó hace tan solo 4 meses, y para no sentirse triste y sola, trabaja arduamente para sacar adelante a sus 2 hijos, quienes son el motor de su vida. Los cuida y protege en su casa propia ubicada en el caserío de Patay. Los días son aún difíciles pero a pesar de ello, sigue trabajando como hace 20 años; pero ahora sola sigue luchando para mantener sus cultivos de la mejor manera. Sus principales sembríos constan de papa, arveja, maíz y habas. Lo que más le gusta a Lidia, es la tranquilidad del campo, por ello sigue trabajando arduamente, ya que sabe que es el único aliado que tiene en estos momentos difíciles. Ahora tiene sembrado papa, los cuales están creciendo satisfactoriamente, y cuenta que ya están floreando, por ello dentro de 3 meses cosechará y venderá en el mercado mayorista de la ciudad de Tarma. Sus planes futuros es mejorar sus sembríos y darle una estabilidad económica a su familia. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “Los picaflores de Patay”, y este es el cuarto crédito que tiene con MFP, donde es una socia responsable y trabajadora. Lidia, dentro de muy poco cosechará arvejas, por ello con el crédito que solicita, comprará varias bolsas de abono orgánico, para poder obtener buenos resultados en está cosecha.
texts.en: Lidia is a strong woman. She is 48 years old and became a widow four months ago. In order to not feel sad and alone, she works hard to help her two children who are the driving force in her life. She takes care of them and protects them in her own house located in the village of Patay. The days are still difficult but she still continues to work like she has for 20 years. Now she works only to maintain her crops in the best way. Her main fields hold potatoes, peas, corn and beans. What Lidia likes most is the tranquility of the countryside. For this reason, she continues working hard, since this this is the only ally she has in these hard times. Now she has sown the potatoes which are growing adequately. She says they are now starting to bloom. In three months, she will harvest them and sell them in the city of Tarma’s wholesale market. Her future plans are to improve her crops and give her family economic stability. She belongs to the “Los picaflores de Patay” communal bank and this is the fourth credit with MFP. She is a responsible and hard-working member. Soon, Lidia will plant peas. For this reason, she is requesting a loan. She will buy bags of organic fertilizer in order to have good results with the harvest.

loans.use: to buy bags of organic fertilizer

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To expand  her business

loans.name: Zenon

texts.es:
Zenon, tiene 43 años de edad, tiene tres hijos y vive en la ciudad del Cusco, Perú. Zenon es un hombre emprendedor y trabajador que se dedica a la venta de artesanía, él tiene un pequeño puesto de venta en el centro artesanal de la ciudad del Cusco. Zenon requiere el préstamo para comprar más artesanía como por ejemplo cuadros dibujados con la ciudadela de Machupicchu y de otros centros arqueológicos. 

Zenon pertenece al banco comunal “Caminemos Juntas” de la UMF Asociación Arariwa de la ciudad del Cusco, Perú. El banco comunal está conformado por personas emprendedoras y trabajadoras que buscan a cada momento las oportunidades para sacar adelante a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Zenon is 43 years old. He has three children and he lives in the city of Cusco, Perú. Zenon is an enterprising and hardworking man who sells crafts. He has a small store in the craft center of the city of Cusco. Zenon needs the loan to buy more crafts, such as framed drawings of Machupicchu and other archeological sites. 

Zenon belongs to the “Caminemos Juntas” communal bank of the UMF Asociación Arariwa in Cusco, Perú. The communal bank is made up of enterprising and hardworking people who are looking for every opportunity to help their children get ahead.

loans.use: To buy more crafts

loans.name: Roberto

texts.es:
Roberto, tiene 75 años de edad y tiene 8 hijos, el socio vive en la ciudad del Cusco, Perú. Roberto es un hombre emprendedor y trabajador que se dedica a la venta de artesanía, el tiene un puesto de venta en el centro artesanal de la ciudad de Corao. Corao se encuentra ubicado a 30 minutos de la ciudad del Cusco. 
Roberto requiere el préstamo para comprar más mercadería como por ejemplo chompas de lana de alpaca, cerámica, etc. 

Roberto pertenece al banco comunal “Caminemos Juntas” de la UMF Asociación Arariwa de la ciudad del Cusco, Perú. El banco comunal está conformado por personas emprendedoras y trabajadoras que buscan a cada momento las oportunidades para sacar adelante a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Roberto is 75 years old and has 8 children.  He lives in the city of Cusco, Peru.  Roberto is an entrepreneur and worker that sells crafts.  He has a stall in the crafts center in the city of Corao.  Corao is located 30 minutes from Cusco.

Roberto needs a loan to purchase more merchandise, such as alpaca wool sweaters, pottery, etc.

Roberto belongs to the communal bank "Caminemos Juntas" in the UMF Arariwa Association in Cusco, Peru.  The communal bank is composed of entrepreneurs and workers who seek at every opportunity to raise their children well.

loans.use: To buy more merchandise.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: The loan is used to buy additional clothes

loans.name: Veronica

texts.es:
Verónica, tiene 29 años de edad, tiene un hijo y vive en la ciudad del Cusco, Perú. Verónica es una mujer emprendedora y trabajadora que se dedica a la venta de productos naturales de la marca de Herbalife, ella tiene un cartera de clientes que consumen los productos y le piden a crédito.  Verónica requiere el préstamo para comprar más productos. 

Verónica pertenece al banco comunal “Caminemos Juntas” de la UMF Asociación Arariwa de la ciudad del Cusco, Perú. El banco comunal está conformado por personas emprendedoras y trabajadoras que buscan a cada momento las oportunidades para sacar adelante a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Verónica is 29 years old. She has one son and lives in the city of Cusco, Perú. Verónica is an enterprising and hardworking woman who sells Herbalife brand natural products. She has a group of clients who buy the products on credit. Verónica needs the loan to buy more products. 

Verónica belongs to the “Caminemos Juntas” communal bank of the UMF Asociación Arariwa in Cusco, Perú. The communal bank is made up of enterprising and hardworking people who are looking for every opportunity to help their children get ahead.

loans.use: Verónica needs the loan to buy more products

loans.name: Tamuyusu Group

texts.en:
In the photo are members of the “Tamuyusu” group. They are small scale businesswomen based in Magburaka, a town in northern Sierra Leone. They are seeking for a loan of SLL 800,000.00 for each in the group. With the help of this loan, they will be able to expand their businesses, make more profit and consequently improve on their standard of living. 

The leader of this group is Fatmata B..  Fatmata is age forty-five. She was born in  Magburaka town where she is currently residing together with her husband and six children, three of whom are in primary and secondary schools. Fatmata sells rice, pepper, groundnuts, palm-oil, etc. With her share of this loan, she will buy the above mention items at wholesale to improve her business.

loans.use: Buys rice, pepper, groundnuts, palm-oil, etc. at wholesale to improve her business

loans.name: Elena

texts.es: Elena tiene 31 años, vive con su esposo y sus 2 hijos en su casa propia. Desde hace 11 años se dedica a la fabricación de ladrillos, en un inicio trabajaba de manera dependiente en una fábrica de ladrillos, con el tiempo se percato que es más conveniente comprar ladrillos directamente de fabrica y convertirse en distribuidor de este material en la zona donde vive. Aprovechando además que su esposo sabe del negocio por que también trabaja en este rubro y tiene muchos contactos para poder ofrecer el producto; de esta manera ambos distribuyen su tiempo, solo que ella se dedica medio día en este trabajo para tener tiempo y dedicarle a sus hijos. Asimismo afirma que esta actividad ha hecho que toda su familia trabaje en equipo y por ello se siente satisfecha. Por ahora su mayor meta es tener su propio terreno para instalar su propia fábrica y producir ladrillos en mayores cantidades. Es su décimo crédito con MFP, esta muy contenta de  saber que tiene un apoyo financiero ya que siempre ha demostrado  ser responsable en sus pagos, además  le agrada ser parte de su banco comunal porque  todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias, agradece  a aquellas personas que serán gestoras del préstamo que solicita y le será  muy útil en el progreso de su negocio. Con el crédito que solicita, lo invertirá para comprar varios metros de plástico que le servirán para tapar los ladrillos en tiempos de lluvia, así mismo comprará insumos para empezar con la fabricación de este material.
texts.en: Elena is 31 years old. She lives with her husband and two children in their own house. For 11 years, she has worked in brick making.  At first, she was working in a brick factory. After some time, she noticed that it was more convenient to buy brick directly and she became a distributor of the material in the area where she lives. She takes advantage of the fact that her husband also works in this field of business and has many contacts. With his resources, they are able to distribute their time. Elena only works half the day in order to have time to spend with her children. This way, her family works as a team and for this reason she feels satisfied. For now, her main goal is to have her own plot of land to put her own factory and to produce bricks in larger quantities. This is her tenth loan with MFP. She is very pleased to know she has financial support since she has always been responsible with her payments. In addition, she likes being a part of her communal bank because all of the members are responsible and supportive of each other. She is grateful for the people who will fund this loan which will be very helpful for her business’ progress.  With this loan, she will invest it in meters of plastic that will cover the bricks during periods of rain. She will also purchase consumables in order to start producing the bricks.

loans.use: to buy materials for the production of bricks and meters of plastic

loans.name: Carolina Enriqueta

texts.es:
Carolina, tiene 26 años de edad y vive en la ciudad del Cusco, Perú. Carolina es una joven emprendedora y trabajadora que se dedica a la confección de manualidades y vende sus productos a dueños de tiendas, librerías y colegios. Ella también es profesora en un centro educativo inicial, ella con su bondad y su amabilidad enseña a niños de 3 a 5 años de edad. Carolina requiere el préstamo para comprar más materiales a para confeccionar sus productos como por ejemplo papel, colores, tela, lana y muchas cosas más. 

Carolina pertenece al banco comunal “Caminemos Juntas” de la UMF Asociación Arariwa de la ciudad del Cusco, Perú. El banco comunal está conformado por personas emprendedoras y trabajadoras que buscan a cada momento las oportunidades para sacar adelante a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Carolina is 26 years old and lives in the city of Cusco, Perú. Carolina is a young, enterprising, and hardworking woman who makes handicrafts and sells her products to the owners of stores, bookstores, and schools. She is also a teacher at a kindergarten. She teaches children who are 3 to 5 years old. Carolina needs the loan to buy more materials for making her crafts, like, for example paper, colors, fabric, wool, and many other things. 

Carolina belongs to the “Caminemos Juntas” communal bank of the UMF Asociación Arariwa in Cusco, Perú. The communal bank is made up of enterprising and hardworking people who are looking for every opportunity to help their children get ahead.

loans.use: To buy materials for making crafts

loans.name: Francisca

texts.es:
Francisca, tiene 42 años de edad, tiene dos hijos y vive en la ciudad del Cusco, Perú. Francisca es una mujer emprendedora y trabajadora que se dedica a la venta de comestibles, ella tiene una pequeña tienda de abarrotes en su domicilio. Francisca también vende cigarrillos y envía a la ciudad de Andahuaylas y Ayacucho. Francisca requiere el préstamo para comprar más mercadería para la tienda de abarrotes como por ejemplo arroz, fideos, azúcar, etc. 

Francisca pertenece al banco comunal “Caminemos Juntas” de la UMF Asociación Arariwa de la ciudad del Cusco, Perú. El banco comunal está conformado por personas emprendedoras y trabajadoras que buscan a cada momento las oportunidades para sacar adelante a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Francisca is 42 years old.  She has two children and lives in Cuzco, Peru.  She is a hardworking and entrepreneurial woman who sells groceries out of a small shop in her home.  Francisca also sells cigarettes and sends them to the cities of Andahuaylas and Ayacucho.  She needs a loan in order to purchase more merchandise for her grocery store such as rice, fideo noodles, sugar, etc.

Francisca belongs to the communal bank "Caminemos Juntas" of the UMF Asociación Arariwa in Cuzco, Peru. The communal bank is made up of hardworking and entrepreneurial people who are always looking for opportunities to help their children get ahead.

loans.use: To purchase more merchandise

loans.name: Yhasmany

texts.es:
Yhasmany, tiene 24 años de edad, tiene un hijo y vive en la ciudad del Cusco, Perú. Yhasmany trabaja en una empresa que ofrece servicios de vigilancia, él socio y su mama Francisca se dedican a la venta de cigarrillos, ellos envían sus productos a las ciudad de Ayacucho y Andahuaylas. Yhasmany requiere el préstamo para comprar más mercadería como cigarrillos.   

 Yhasmany pertenece al banco comunal “Caminemos Juntas” de la UMF Asociación Arariwa de la ciudad del Cusco, Perú. El banco comunal está conformado por personas emprendedoras y trabajadoras que buscan a cada momento las oportunidades para sacar adelante a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Yhasmany is 24 years old, has a son, and lives in the city of Cusco, Peru.  Yhasmany works for a company that provides security services.  He and his mother Francisca sell cigarettes.  They send their products to the cities of Ayacucho and Andahuaylas.  Yhasmany requests a loan to buy more merchandise such as cigarettes.

Yhasmany belongs to the communal bank "Caminemos Juntas" of the UMF Asociación Arariwa in Cusco, Peru.  The communal bank is composed of entrepreneurs and workers that seek at every opportunity to help their children get ahead.

loans.use: To buy more merchandise, such as cigarettes.

loans.name: Luis Enrique

texts.es:
El Senor Luis Enrique G., habita en la ciudad de Esteli, tiene 41 anos de edad, casado, y solamente tiene un hijo. Con mucho sacrificio se intereso en estudiar un poco mas y logro llegar hasta II ano de Secundaria; 
Desde hace unos 15 anos, a traves del INATEC, estudio un curso de Fontaneria; luego consigui un trabajo en ENACAL (Empresa Nacional de Acueductos y Alcantarillados), y trabajo por 10 anos; poco a poco fue recogiendo un poco de dinero y logro independizarse.
Actualmente trabaja como su propio jefe, independiente y cuenta con una gran clientela, quienes muchos lo conocen desde que el trabajaba en ENACAL.
Solicito este credito, para Capital de trabajo, pues necesita comprar algunas herramientas que le facilitaran su trabajo y mejorara la calidad de el mismo.
Su meta es lograr tener mas personal que trabaje con el y poder tener todas las herramientas necesarias.
texts.en:
Luis Enrique G. lives in the city of Esteli. He is 41 years old and married. He only has one son. With lots of sacrifice, he is interested in studying a little bit more to be able to reach the second year of secondary school.
15 years ago, through INATEC, Luis took a course in plumbing. Later, he was able to get a job at ENACAL (Empresa Nacional de Acueductos y Alcantarillados) (National Company of Aqueducts and Sewers). He worked there for ten years. Little by little, he was able to save money and achieve personal independence.
Now he works as his own boss, independently, and he has a large client base. Many of the clients were met while he worked for ENACAL.
He is requesting this loan for working capital. He needs to buy some tools to help him with his work and improve the quality of his work. 
His goal is to have more people to work with him and to have all the necessary tools for his job.

loans.use: tools for plumbing

loans.name: Dalmecia

texts.es:
Dalmecia, tiene 37 años de edad, tiene dos hijos y vive en la ciudad del Cusco, Perú. Dalmecia es una mujer emprendedora y trabajadora que se dedica a la confección y venta de collares, elaboradas con semillas naturales pero tiene que estar secas, ella reparte sus productos a diferentes tiendas y centros artesanales de la ciudad del Cusco. Dalmecia requiere el préstamo para comprar más materiales como semillas y otras cosas más. 

 Dalmecia pertenece al banco comunal “Caminemos Juntas” de la UMF Asociación Arariwa de la ciudad del Cusco, Perú. El banco comunal está conformado por personas emprendedoras y trabajadoras que buscan a cada momento las oportunidades para sacar adelante a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Dalmecia is 37 years old with two children.  She lives in Cusco, Peru.  Dalmecia is an entrepenuerial and hard-working woman who makes and sells necklaces made from dried seeds. She sells her jewelry in different stores and artisanal centers around Cusco.  Dalmecia needs a loan to buy more materials for her jewelry like seeds.

Dalmecia belongs to the community bank "We Walk Together" of the UMF Arariwa Association in Cusco.  This community bank is made up of entrepreunerial and hard-working people who are always looking for opportunities to support their children.

loans.use: Buying materials for jewelry-making

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
Juana, tiene 49 años de edad, tiene tres hijos y vive en la ciudad del Cusco, Perú. Juana es una madre emprendedora y trabajadora y se dedica a la venta de peluches con la forma de animales oriundo de la región de la sierra, ella reparte y vende sus productos a personas que se dedican a la venta de artesanía. Juana requiere el préstamo para comprar más materiales como por ejemplo cuero, lana y muchas cosas más. 

Juana pertenece al banco comunal “Caminemos Juntas” de la UMF Asociación Arariwa de la ciudad del Cusco, Perú.
texts.en:
Juana is 49 years old.  She has three children and lives in the city of Cuzco, Peru.  She is a hardworking mother and entrepreneur who sells stuffed animals in the form of animals native to the mountain region. She distributes and sells her productions to people who sell handicrafts.  She needs this loan to purchase materials such as leather, wool, and many other things.

Juana belongs to the communal bank "Caminemos Juntas"of the UMF Associación Arariwa in the city of Cuzco, Peru.
 

.

loans.use: To purchase additional materials such as leather, wool, and many other things.

loans.name: Nieves

texts.es:
Nieves, tiene 35 años de edad, tiene tres hijos y vive en la ciudad del Cusco, Perú. Nieves trabaja en la municipalidad del San Jerónimo en la área de seguridad ciudadana, ella patrulla a pie las calles, barrios y plazas del distrito de San Jerónimo de la ciudad del Cusco. Nieves requiere el préstamo para uso personal pues el dinero lo utilizara para hacer mantenimiento de su casa. 

Nieves pertenece al banco comunal “Caminemos Juntas” de la UMF Asociación Arariwa de la ciudad del Cusco, Perú.
texts.en: Nieves is 35 years old, has three children and lives in the city of Cusco, Peru.  Nieves works in the municipality of San Jeronimo in the area of public safety.  She patrols the streets, neighborhoods and plazas (squares) on foot in the district of San Jeronimo, in the city of Cusco.  Nieves requires the loan for her own personal use, she will use the money to do maintenance on her home.  Nieves belongs to the communal bank "Caminemos Juntas" ("We Walk Together") of the UMF Arariwa Association, in the city of Cusco, Peru.

loans.use: To do maintenance on her home.

loans.name: Jorge Alberto

texts.es:
Jorge, tiene 24 años de edad y vive en la ciudad del Cusco, Perú. Jorge se dedica a brindar servicio de transporte urbano en la ciudad del Cusco, el tiene un carro que le sirve como taxi, el cobra el servicio de taxi a partir de S/. 2.50 nuevos soles dependiendo la distancia que se traslado al pasajero. Jorge requiere el préstamo para uso personal pues el dinero lo utilizara para hacer mantenimiento de su carro. 

Jorge pertenece al banco comunal “Caminemos Juntas” de la UMF Asociación Arariwa de la ciudad del Cusco, Perú.
texts.en: Jorge is 24 years old and lives in the city of Cusco, Peru.  Jorge offers urban transport service in the city of Cusco.  He has a car that serves as a taxi.  His taxi service costs anywhere from 2.50 new soles, depending on the distance he transports his passengers.  Jorge requires the loan for personal use, and he will use the money to do maintenance on his car.  Jorge belongs to the community bank "Caminemos Junta" (We Walk Together), of the UMF Arariwa Association, in the city of Cusco, Peru.

loans.use: To do maintenance on his car

loans.name: Alberto

texts.es:
Alberto, tiene 28 años de edad y vive en la ciudad del Cusco, Perú. Alberto se dedica a confección de artesanía, él tiene un pequeño taller en su domicilio y reparte su productos a los centro comerciales, tiendas y a personas que se dedica a la venta de artesanía. Alberto requiere el préstamo para comprar más materiales como lana, pieles, arcillas, plata y muchas cosas más. 

 Alberto pertenece al banco comunal “Caminemos Juntas” de la UMF Asociación Arariwa de la ciudad del Cusco, Perú.
texts.en: Alberto is 28 years old and lives in the city of Cusco, Peru.  He makes handicrafts.  He has a small workshop in his home, and distributes his products in shopping malls, shops, and to people who sell handicrafts.  Alberto requires the loan to buy more materials, such as wool, leather, clay, silver and many other things.  Alberto belongs to the communal bank "Caminemos Juntas" (We Will Together) of the UMF Arariwa Association, in the city of Cusco, Peru.

loans.use: To buy materials such as wool, leather, clay, silver and many more things

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria D. sells maize and gari at Breman near Elmina. Victoria has received a senior high level of education. She is married and has 6 children. Her husband is a Bursar at a school. Victoria has been selling maize and gari for 15 years now. She assists in paying the school fees and other expenses for the children since her husband's income is too small to take care of all the expenses of the home. 

Her loan will be used to buy more sacks of maize and gari to sell. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to reinvest back into the food selling business.

loans.use: Her loan will be used to buy more sacks of maize and gari to sell.

loans.name: Zenaida

texts.es:
Zenaida, tiene 34 años de edad, tiene dos hijos  y vive en la ciudad del Cusco, Perú. Zenaida es una madre trabajadora y emprendedora que se dedica a la venta de artesanía y ella tiene un pequeño puesto de venta en el centro artesanal del Cusco. Zenaida requiere el préstamo para comprar más mercadería. 

Zenaida pertenece al banco comunal “Caminemos Juntas” de la UMF Asociación Arariwa de la ciudad del Cusco, Perú.
texts.en: Zenaida is 34 years old, has two children, and lives in the city of Cusco, Peru.  Zenaida is a hard-working mother and entrepreneurial woman, who sells handicrafts.  She has a small market stall in the handicraft center of Cusco.  Zenaida requires the loan to buy more merchandise.  Zenaida belongs to the communal bank "Caminemos Juntas" (We Walk Together) on the UMF Arariwa Association in the city of Cusco, Peru.

loans.use: To buy more merchandise

loans.name: Victoria

texts.es:
Victoria tiene 42 años, vive con su esposo y sus hijos en casa de unos parientes. Realiza bellos bordados desde hace 2 años, se inicio por invitación de una de sus amigas que le enseñó todo sobre este arte. Ahora trabaja de manera independiente y desde la comodidad de su casa, así no descuida su hogar ni sus hijos. Por otro lado cultiva alfalfa para poder venderla al por mayor. Es por ello que no tiene un horario fijo de trabajo pero es muy constante en la realización de sus bordados  ya que por la complejidad del trabajo y el grosor del bordado en la tela este trabajo dura hasta un mes de realizado, como resultado se da una bella prenda  típica  que causa admiración en sus clientes y finalmente son los que compran al contado. La época más rentable  en su negocio es cuando  están en plena época de festividades típicas llamada, fiesta de Santiago, que se celebra mucho por su zona. Desea crecer en su producción de faldas bordadas y contratar a personas apara ayudarla en esta elaboración. Es su cuarto crédito con MFP, esta muy contenta de  saber que tiene un apoyo financiero ya que siempre ha demostrado  ser responsable en sus pagos, además  le agrada ser parte de su banco comunal porque  todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias, agradece  a aquellas personas que serán gestoras del préstamo que solicita y le será  muy útil en el progreso de su negocio.
Con el crédito que solicita, comprará hilos y telas al por mayor y también  en la compra de sacos de abono para sembrar mas alfalfa.
texts.en:
Victoria is 42 years old and she lives with her husband and children in a house belonging to a family members. She has been crafting beautiful embroidery for the past 2 years. She started out when a friend taught her everything there is to know about this art form. Today she works independently and from the comfort of her home. She can take care of the chores and look after her kids. In addition to this she also cultivates alfalfa to later sell in wholesale. She doesn't have a fixed work scheduler but she is very dedicated to her embroidery. With the detail of the work involved and the richness of the embroidery takes up to a month to complete one piece. But the final product is a beautiful traditional piece of clothing that is the subject of admiration from her clients who ultimately decide to make the buy, in cash. The most profit is earned during the traditional season of festivities, named the Feast of Santiago. It is a time for celebration in her region. She wants to increase the embroidered skirts and to hire help to assist her in production. It is her fourth loan through MFP (Kiva Field Partner) and she is very happy to know she has this source of financial support. She has always demonstrated to be responsible with her payments and she is very glad to be a member of her community bank. All of the other members of the communal bank are responsible and make a very strong group. She is thankful to those individuals who are contributors to the loan she requests. It will be very helpful in the development of her business. 

With the loan requested she will purchase threads and fabrics in wholesale and she will also purchase fertilizer to cultivate more alfalfa.

loans.use: To purchase threads and fabrics for embroidery, and to purchase fertilizers to cultivate alfalfa.

loans.name: Estrella De Luz Group

texts.es:
El grupo Estrella de Luz lo conforman tres mujeres trabajadoras una de ellas es la señora Yessenia Aurora T. T. quien vede ropa, cosméticos y chiverías desde hace 10 años. Ella inicio con poca mercadería y con el tiempo su ardua labor y los prestamos su negocio ha ido creciendo.  
Las otras integrantes del grupo son Marlene M. Moreno propietaria de una venta y Zeneyda Margarita Velásquez propietaria de una mini pulpería.
texts.en:
The group Estrella de Luz [Starlight] is made up three hardworking women.  One of these women is Yessenia Aurora T. T., who has sold clothing, cosmetics, and dairy products for 10 years.  She started without much merchandise, but with time, hard work, and loans, she has grown her business.  

The other members of the group are Marlene M. Moreno who owns an inn and Zeneyda Margarita Velásquez who owns a small convenience store.

loans.use: Purchase clothing and cosmetics

loans.name: Serwaa

texts.en:
Serwaa A. prepares a local corn made food called banku at Breman, near Elmina. Serwaa has attained a junior high level of education. She is divorced and has 5 children. She is responsible for school fees and other expenses for the children.

Her loan will be used to buy more maize to prepare more banku for sale. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to reinvest back into the food selling business.

loans.use: Her loan will be used to buy more maize to prepare more banku to sell.

loans.name: Las Caminantes Group

texts.es:
El grupo las caminantes lo conforman tres mujeres trabajadoras, esforzadas y emprendedoras provenientes de Managua; una de ellas es Nohemí Gutiérrez López. Esta señora de 49 años tiene una pulpería la cual hace un año volvió a reabrirla con la ayuda de su hija.
