Ella invertirá el crédito en granos básicos, chiverías, gaseosas etc. y algún día desea tener una miscelánea.
Las otras integrantes del grupo son Xiomara Martínez  comerciante de artículos escolares como cuadernos, papeles, lápices…etc. y Jennifer O. desde hace cuatro años tiene una tortillería.
texts.en:
Las Caminantes Group ("the women who get things moving") is made up of three hard-working and enterprising women from Managua.

One of them is Nohemí Gutiérrez López, aged 49, who had a local store which she reopened last year with the help of her daughter.  She will invest her loan in staple food, yogurt, soda, etc. She wants to own a general store someday.

The other group members are Xiomara Martínez, selling school supplies such as notebooks, paper, pencils, etc., and Jennifer Ordóñez, who has sold tortillas for four years.

loans.use: To buy staple food

loans.name: Ekua

texts.en: Ekua G. is divorced and has 3 children. She has no formal education. Ekua sels soft drinks at Elmina. She as well sells tubers of yam, which she has been doing for 2 years now. Ekua uses her income to pay school fees, utility bills and other expenses of her children. Ekua will use the loan to purchase more tubers of yam for sale. With the new profits from her expanded business, Ekua plans to re-invest back into the soft drinks business.

loans.use: Ekua will use the loan to purchase more tubers of yam to resell.

loans.name: Huamuchapa Group

texts.es:
Este grupo se llama huamuchapa, esta ubicado en el municipio D. tecoanapa guerrero, decidieron ponerle este nombre porque así se llama el lugar donD. y ya que todos los integrantes pertenecen a L. misma, L. historia es acerca D. L. señora Silvia C. V., ya que es L. presidenta del grupo elL. tiene 37 años, esta casada, tiene 4 hijos, Arturo, areli, KarL. y Alejandro, y los cuatro estudian, dos D. ellos están en quinto y sexto año D. primaria, otro está en tercer año D. preescolar y el más pequeño apenas tiene un año D. edad, elL. tiene una frutería.

Silvia decidió iniciar con este negocio, por que un familiar le comento que era una muy buena fuente D. ingresos, también por que esto le ayudaría para apoyar a su esposo con los gastos D. L. casa y L. educación D. sus hijos, al igual que para  mejorar L. calidad D. vida D. su familia, elL. invirtió su préstamo en L. compra D. mas mercancía como son: manzanas, plátanos, naranjas, jitomates, chiles, cebollas, papas, zanahoria, pepinos, lechuga y demás frutas y verduras.

ElL. esta muy contenta por que dice que le esta yendo muy bien con su negocio, ya que sus ventas han incrementado bastante al igual que sus clientes, y por lo mismo sus ingresos también han aumentado satisfactoriamente, tanto que hasta se compro una plancha.

L. meta que tiene doña Silvia es L. D. continuar apoyando a sus hijos con sus estudios para que puedan terminar una carrera profesional y así tengan un mejor futuro, también quiere hacer crecer mas su pequeño negocio, ya que quiere ampliar un poco mas el lugar en donD. tiene su frutería, para tener más surtida su tienda y así tener mas variedad D. productos, y mejorar e incrementar sus ganancias.

Nos comenta que en su grupo se trabaja muy bien, puesto que todos los integrantes se conocen D. hace algún tiempo y son muy responsables con sus pagos, ya que no quieren defraudar L. confianza y apoyo que le están brindando.

Esta muy agradecida con fundación realidad y los prestatatarios D. kiva por el apoyo incondicional que le están brindando, ya que gracias a eso ha mejorado su calidad D. vida y L. D. su familia al igual que continuar invirtiendo en su negocio.
Y estos son los nombres y las actividades que realizan cada uno D. los integrantes del grupo huamuchapa.
Celia C. L.-venta d maíz
Aurelia teresa C.-venta D. maíz
Llanet Flórez C.-tienda D. abarrotes
Martimiana C. caciana-venta D. carne
Bulmara R. Ramírez-tienda D. abarrotes
MariceL. A. R.-venta D. pescados
Florencia C. R.-venta D. pollos
Anabel L. C.-vente D. pollos
Silvia C. V.-frutería
María S. G.-frutería
Esperanza D. L. P. L.-tienda D. abarrotes
texts.en:
This group, called Huamuchapa, is located in the town of Tecoanapa, Guerrero.  The members decided to give the group this name because it is the name of the neighborhood where they all live. 

This story is about Silvia C. V. since she is the group's president.  Silvia is 37 years old, married, and has four children: Arturo, Areli, KarL. and Alejandro.  All four are in school.  The first two are in the sixth and fifth year of elementary school, the third is in the third year of pre-school and the youngest is barely a year old.  Silvia owns a fruit store.

Silvia decided to start out in this business because a family member told her that it was a very good source of income.  She also knew that it would help her to support her husband with their household expenses and their children's education expenses and would improve their family's quality of life.  Silvia invested her loan in buying merchandise such as: apples, bananas, oranges, tomatoes, chili peppers, onions, potatoes, carrots, cucumbers, lettuce and other fruit and veg.

Silvia is very happy because she says that her business is doing very well.  Both her sales and her number of customers have increased quite a bit.  This means that her profits have also risen satisfactorily, so much so, in fact, that she has even been able to buy an iron.

Silvia's goal is to continue supporting her children in their studies so that they can finish complete their higher education and have a better future.  She would also like to grow her small business some more since she would like to expand the premises where she has her fruit store a little.  This will mean that she can better stock her store and thereby sell a wider range of produce and improve her profits.

Silvia tells us that her group works very well since all the members have known each other for some time and they are very responsible in making their repayments since they don't want to let people down after they have placed their trust in them and supported them.

Silvia is very grateful to Fundación Realidad and Kiva lenders for the unconditional support that they are providing since it has meant that her quality of life and that of her family has improved and she has been able to continue investing in her business.

The names and business activities of the rest of the Huamuchapa group members follow below:

Celia C. L. - Corn sales
Aurelia Teresa C. - Corn sales
Llanet Flórez C. - Grocery store
Martimiana C. Caciana - Meat sales
Bulmara R. Ramírez - Grocery store
MariceL. A. R. - Fish sales
Florencia C. R. - Chicken sales
Anabel L. C. - Chicken sales
Silvia C. V. - Fruit store
María S. G. - Fruit store
Esperanza D. L. P. L. - Grocery store

loans.use: Silvia invested her loan in buying more merchandise such as: apples, bananas, oranges, tomatoes, chili peppers, onions, potatoes, carrots, cucumbers, lettuce

loans.name: Karla

texts.es:
La señora Karla G. es una señora de 36 años honrada responsable y emprendedora, acompañada del padre de sus 3 hijos, ella posee un negocio propio donde vende frijoles, leche, fresquitos y gaseosas. Este negocio lo ha mantenido desde hace 2 años y dos hijas la apoyan en el.
Su sueño es obtener un crédito que le permita incrementar el tamaño de su negocio invirtiendo en productos varios y así crear una pulpería.
texts.en: Señora Karla G., aged 36, is an honest, responsible and enterprising woman. Together with the father of her three children she owns a business and sells beans, milk and soda. She has had this store for two years and two daughters lend her a helping hand. Her dream is to be granted a loan which will enable her to expand her business by investing in various products and transform it into a full-sized store.

loans.use: To buy products for her store

loans.name: Esi

texts.en:
Esi M. sells sacks of maize and gari at Breman near Elmina. Esi has been through senior high school. She is married and has 2 children. Her husband is a farmer. Esi has been in this trade for 10 years now. She assists her husband in payment of the family's bills. 

Her loan will be used to buy more sacks of maize and gari to sell. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to reinvest back into her business.

In this pricture Esi, is showing some of the gari she sells.

loans.use: Her loan will be used to buy more sacks of maize and gari to sell.

loans.name: Nana

texts.en:
Nana A. is married and has 8 dependants. She has not received any form of education. Nana sells food items such as maize and gari at Elmina. She has been selling gari and maize for 4 years now. Her husband is a farmer. Nana uses her income to pay part of the utilities and maintanance of the house. 

Nana will use the loan to purchase more food supplies to sell. With the new profits from her expanded business, Nana plans to add the sale of food items to her business. The picture shows Nana scooping out some amount of gari.

loans.use: Nana will use the loan to purchase more food supplies to sell.

loans.name: Adjoa

texts.en:
Adjoa A. is married and has 3 children. Her husband is a farmer. Adjoa sells smoked fish and other food items at Breman near Elmina. Her husband is a farmer. Adjoa uses her income to assist her husband in the payment of school fees and utility bills. 

Adjoa will use the loan to purchase more food items and fresh fish to smoke for resale. With the new profits from her expanded business, Adjoa plans to re-invest back into the food selling business.  She has displayed on her lap some of the smoked fish.

loans.use: Adjoa will use the loan to purchase more food items and fresh fish to smoke for resale.

loans.name: Leon De Judas Group

texts.es:
El grupo León de Judas está conformado por tres personas trabajadoras, esforzadas y emprendedoras una de ellas es la señora Mariana P. Espinoza de 47 años quien vende ropa y productos Avon desde hace 7 años. Ella inicio con la venta de cosméticos y poco a poco invirtió en otros productos.
P. tiene nueve hijos mayores de edad de los cuales uno de ellos le ayuda en el negocio.
Las integrantes de grupo son Cristhian María R. de 26 años se dedica al comercio de ropa hace un año y Rosa Argentina T. Hernández de 28 años vende calzado y ropa.
texts.en: The León de Judas Group is comprised of three hardworking and enterprising people who put a lot of effort into what they do.  One of them is Mariana P. Espinoza who is 47 years old and has sold clothing and Avon products for the past seven years.  She began with selling cosmetics and little by little, she invested in other products.  Ms. P. has nine children who are adults, and one of them helps her with the business.  The other group members are Cristhian María R., who is 26 and has worked selling clothing for a year, and Rosa Argentina T. Hernández, who is 28 years old and sells shoes and clothing.

loans.use: Clothing

loans.name: Alfredo

texts.es:
Alfredo es transportista publico, tiene  un taxi con el que trabaja. Tiene dos hijos de 10 y 6 años de edad.
Vive en la zona de Pasankeri de la ciudad de La Paz en su casa propia.
El crédito lo utilizará para pagar el costo de mantenimiento de su vehiculo y la compra de un motor para su taxi.
 Es el primer crédito con IMPRO y el primer via Kiva. El análisis socio-económico lo califica como sujeto de crédito.
texts.en:
Alfredo works in public transportation and has a taxi with which he works. He has two children who are 10 and 6 years old. He lives in the Pasankeri area of the city of La Paz in a house that he owns.

The loan will be used to pay the cost of maintenance for his vehicle and for the purchase of a motor for his taxi.

This is his first loan with IMPRO and through Kiva. The socio-economic evaluation completed qualifies him as a loan recipient.

loans.use: To purchase a motor and for maintenance for his taxi

loans.name: Abenawa

texts.en:
Abenawa D. is married and has 4 children. Abenawa sells smoked fish and other food items at Elmina, which she has been doing for 20 years now. Her husband is a carpenter. Abenawa uses her income to assist her husband in payment of the family's bills. 

She will use the loan to purchase more fresh fish to process for sale. With the new profits from her expanded business, Abenawa plans to educate her children.

loans.use: She will use the loan to purchase more fresh fish to process for sale.

loans.name: Leo I Group

texts.es: Este grupo se llama LEO, está ubicado en el Estado D. PuebL. en México. El grupo está conformado por 10 integrantes. Florentina L. tiene 50 años, estudió L. primaria, es artesana y tiene en total 2 hijos: 1 mujer y 1 varón.  ElL. se dedica a L. artesanía en figuras D. yeso que inició hace 10 años,solicita el préstamo para comprar piedra ya que es en L. forma como llega el yeso, D. modo que elL. lo tiene que picar, para después molerlo. Quiere satisfacer los pedidos D. sus clientes, algunos vecinos y clientes D. elL. comentan que hace figuras muy bonitas, tanto D. temporada, como al gusto D. sus clientes hace figuras desD. 10 cm y hasta D. 3 metros D. altura, lo que más venD. son ángeles. Florentina venD. en L. comunidad, en las comunidades aledañas así también como en tianguis mercados y ferias. Al momento D. solicitar este préstamo está feliz.  Quiere este crédito para comprar lo necesario en pinturas, barnices, endurecedores y piedra para cumplir con los pedidos.  También espera con sus ganancia poder comprar una pulidora para ahorrar tiempo y sacar pronto sus pedidos ya que hasta hoy lo hace a mano. ElL. anheL. darles una vida y educación digna a sus hijos y seguir siendo el mejor ejemplo D. lucha para salir a delante.
texts.en:
This group is called LEO, and they are located in the state of PuebL. in Mexico. The group is maD. up of 10 members. Florentina L. is 50 years old, and studied in primary school. She is a craftswoman, and has two children: a daughter and a son. Her business is handicrafts, in plaster figurines, which she started 10 years ago.

She is requesting the loan in order to buy stones, since that is how the plaster comes, in a form in which she has to chip away first, and then grind. She wants to fulfill her customers requests. Some neighbors and customers of hers comment that she makes very beautiful figurines, both seasonal figurines as well as figurines that her customers request. She makes figurines from 10 cm to 3 meters tall, and what she sells most are angels.

Florentina sells her figurines in the community, and in neighboring communities, as well as in street markets and fairs. At the time of requesting the loan, she is very happy. She wants this loan in order to buy the necessary supplies such as paints, varnishes, hardeners and stones in order to fulfill her orders. Also, she hopes with her earnings to be able to buy a polisher in order to save time and get out her orders quickly since up until now, she has been doing it by hand. Her greatest wish is to give her children a dignified life and education, and to continue being a better example of the fight to get ahead.

loans.use: paints, varnishes, hardeners and stones

loans.name: Pancasan Group

texts.es:
El grupo Pancasan está conformado por cuatro mujeres esforzadas. La coordinadora del grupo es la señora Blanca Nieve S. de 49 años desde hace 10 años tiene su pequeña venta de granos básico y tortillería. Ella desde muy joven trabajo arduo para proporcionarle a sus seis hijos estudio, comida y ropa de estos solo tiene con ella a su hija menor de 18 años quien le ayuda en el negocio.

Las otras integrantes del grupo son Juana María García de 42 años quien vende ropa y zetagas, Brenda Patricia Argeñal Vega tiene una pulpería desde hace 11 años y Bertha del Socorro E. desde hace 20 años tiene una fritanga.
texts.en:
Pancasan Group is made up of four hard-working women.

The group coordinator is Señora Blanca Nieve S., aged 49, who has been selling staple food and tortillas for 10 years. She has been working ever since she was young to provide her six children with education, food and clothing. Only her youngest daughter, aged 18, lives with her and helps her in her business.

The other group members are Juana María García, aged 42, who sells clothes, Brenda Patricia Argeñal Vega who has run a general store for 11 years, and Bertha del Socorro E. who has sold fried snacks for 20 years.

loans.use: To buy staple food

loans.name: Herrita

texts.en:
Herrita D. is married and has 4 children. She has received a junior high education. Herrita sells food items and also sells electrical accessories at Breman, near Elmina. Her husband is into electronics. Herrita assists her husband in payment of the family's bills. Herrita will use the loan to purchase other types of electrical gadgets requested by her customers. 

With the new profits from her expanded business, Herrita plans to re-invest back into the electrical accessories selling business.

loans.use: Herrita will use the loan to purchase other types of electrical gadgets requested by her customers for sale.

loans.name: Efua

texts.en:
Efua D. cooks food for sale. She also sells food items like cassava at Elmina. Efua has received no formal education. She is married and has 3 children. Her husband is a farmer. She has been in this business for 10 years. She assists her husband in the payment of the family's bills. 

Her loan will be used to buy more food supplies for sale. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to re-invest back into the food business.

loans.use: Her loan will be used to buy more food supplies for sale.

loans.name: Rosario De La Cruz

texts.es:
La señora Rosario de la Cruz O. de 65 años vende ropa, zapatos y cosméticos  desde hace 14 años el cual inicio con poca mercadería y gracias a los prestamos fue creciendo su negocio ya que esto le permitió comprar mayor cantidad y variedad de productos. 

Ella trabaja con sus hermanas y amigas de confianzas quienes le ayudan a regar sus productos.
texts.en:
Rosario de la Cruz O. is 65 years old and has sold clothing, shoes, and cosmetics for the past 14 years. She began with little merchandise and her business grew thanks to the loans, as they allowed her to buy a larger amount and variety of products.

She works with her sisters and trustworthy friends who help her deliver her products.

loans.use: Merchandise (clothing, shoes, and cosmetics)

loans.name: Rebeca

texts.es: Rebeca tiene 38 años, vive con su esposo y sus hijos en casa de sus suegros. Ella se considera una mujer muy trabajadora y multifacética, ya que desde hace 4 años se dedica al negocio de toda índole y de acuerdo a la temporada. Ahora se dedica  vender gelatina de manera ambulante, mientras que su esposo posee un negocio de distribución de papas peladas y picadas a los restaurantes. Sin embargo desde tener más ingresos, es así que hace 6 meses ha instalado una granja de cuyes, en donde los cría y vende cuando logran tener el peso exacto. Los comerciantes de carne de su localidad son sus principales compradores. Considera que este negocio es muy rentable, y gracias a ello esta obteniendo la estabilidad económica que su familia necesita, además que le permite disponer de su propio tiempo. Por tal razón desea seguir trabajando con ese mismo empeño para  crecer económicamente. Es su cuarto crédito con MFP, esta muy contenta de  saber que tiene un apoyo financiero ya que siempre ha demostrado  ser responsable en sus pagos, además  le agrada ser parte de su banco comunal porque  todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias, agradece  a aquellas personas que serán gestoras del préstamo que solicita y le será  muy útil en el progreso de su negocio. Con el crédito que solicita, lo invertirá para comprar materiales de construcción para mejorar la infraestructura de su granja.
texts.en: Rebeca is 38 years old and lives with her husband and children in her in-laws’ house.  She considers herself to be a very hardworking and multifaceted person, as she has been working in all types of businesses for the past four years depending on the season.  She now works selling gelatin by foot, while her husband has a business distributing peeled and diced potatoes to restaurants.  However, in order to have more income, she set up a guinea pig farm six months ago, where she raises them and sells them when they reach the right weight.  The meat merchants in the area are her main buyers.  She considers this business to be very profitable and thanks to it, she is getting the financial stability that her family needs.  In addition, it allows her to set her own hours.  This is why she wants to continue working with this business to grow financially.  This is her fourth loan with MFP and she is very happy to know that she has financial support, as she has always proven to be responsible with her payments.  She is also pleased to be part of the communal bank because all of the members are responsible and supportive people.  She is grateful for all those who will fund the loan she is requesting because it will be very useful for her business’ progress.  With the loan requested, she will invest in the purchase of construction materials to improve the infrastructure of her farm.

loans.use: To purchase construction materials to improve the infrastructure of her farm.

loans.name: Mari

texts.fr: Madame Mari V. habite dans la localité de Camberene. Elle est âgée   de 35 ans. Elle s’active depuis plus de 5 ans dans la vente de fruits de mer au marché de Camberene. Elle est sociétaire au guichet de Camberene  depuis des années. Elle sollicite un prêt de 100 000 frs pour renforcer son fond de roulement afin de relancer son activité. Ce financement lui permettra d’augmenter ses bénéfices et de mieux subvenir a ses besoins sociaux.
texts.en:
Mrs. Mari V. lives in the locality of Camberene. She is 35 years old. She has been selling seafood at the Camberene market for over five years. 

She has been a member of the Camberene branch for several years. She is seeking a loan of 100,000F to strengthen her working capital and bolster her business. This loan will allow her to increase her profits and better support herself.

loans.use: To strengthen her working capital

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Meat, chicken, and basic grains

loans.name: Efua

texts.en:
Efua A. is married and has 7 dependants. Efua sells provisions and stationery on a table at Breman near Elmina. She has been in this trade for 10 years. Her husband is a farmer. Efua uses her income to assist her husband in the payment of the family's bills. 

Efua will use the loan to purchase more provisions and stationery for sale. With the new profits from her expanded business, Efua plans to re-invest back into the provisions and stationery business.

loans.use: Efua will use the loan to purchase more provisions and stationery for sale.

loans.name: Ama

texts.en:
Ama M. is divorced and has 4 children. She has no formal education. Ama sells maize and also makes palm kennel oil for sale at Breman, near Elmina. Ama uses her income to pay school fees and other expenses for the children. 

Ama will use the loan to purchase more maize and palm kennel nut for the production of the palm kennel oil. With the new profits from her expanded business, Ama plans to re-invest back into the palm kennel production business.

loans.use: Ama will use the loan to purchase more maize and palm kennel nut for the production of the palm kennel oil.

loans.name: La Lucha Sigue Group

texts.es:
El grupo La Lucha Sigue consigna que siempre han tenido presente estas tres féminas ejemplares. La coordinadora del grupo es la señora Fátima Venega se dedica al comercio de productos Avon marca reconocida por sus ventas vía catálogo. Ella con el crédito comprara perfumes, cosméticos y tratamientos que han encargado.

Las otras integrantes del grupo son Angela S. quien vende pollo y queso y Rosalba L. quien vende tortillas.
texts.en:
The La Lucha Sigue [The Struggle Continues] group states that it has always had these three exemplary women. The group coordinator is Mrs.  Fátima Venega. She sells Avon products, a brand known for catalogue sales. With the loan, she will buy perfumes, cosmetics and treatments that have been ordered from her.  

The other members of the group are Angela S., who sells chicken and cheese, and Rosalba L., who sells tortillas.

loans.use: Avon products

loans.name: Ama

texts.en:
Ama K. sells smoked fish at Breman near Elmina. Ama has not received any form of education. She is a widow, taking care of 4 children. Ama has been selling fish for 30 years. She is responsible for paying school fees and other expenses of the children. 

Her loan will be used to buy more fresh fish from the shore and then process for sale. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to provide a meaningful education for her children.

loans.use: Her loan will be used to buy more fresh fish from the shore and then process for sale.

loans.name: Nana

texts.en: Nana B. sells maize, and also fried yams and sweet potatoes, at Breman near Elmina.  She is divorced and has 5 dependents. She has been in this trade for 10 years now. She is responsible for taking care of the family's daily expenses. Her loan will be used to buy more bags of maize, and also to buy more yams and sweet potatoes for sale. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to re-invest in the food-selling business.

loans.use: Her loan will be used to buy more bags of maize, and also more yams and sweet potatoes for sale.

loans.name: Efua

texts.en: Efua O. is married and has 7 dependants. She has no formal education. Efua sells food items like gari.  She also sells secondhand clothing at Elmina, which she has done for 30 years. Her husband is a farmer. Efua uses her income to assist her husband with the financial responsibility of the home. Efua will use the loan to purchase more food supplies for sale. With the new profits from her expanded business, Efua plans to buy land.

loans.use: Efua will use the loan to purchase more food supplies for sale.

loans.name: Parcifal

texts.es: Parcifal tiene 23 años, el vive con sus padres en su casa propia. Hace más de 2 años que se dedica al reciclaje, recolectando objetos en desuso y luego son vendidos por kilo a una empresa grande de reciclado. Es así que trabaja  todos los días a partir del medio día, recorriendo las calles aledañas de su zona. Para  él es muy rentable esta actividad ya que  aumenta su precio por el kilo, recibiendo buenas rentas y eso le motiva a seguir trabajando en este rubro, además con el dinero obtenido lo invierte en sus estudios universitarios. El desea adquirir un terreno propio para poder tener un gran almacén y vender a mayores cantidades, asimismo dedicarse a la agricultura utilizando los desechos orgánicos  tratados como un abono saludable. Es su cuarto crédito con MFP, se siente muy contento de  saber que tiene un apoyo financiero ya que siempre ha demostrado  ser responsable en sus pagos, además  le agrada ser parte de su banco comunal porque  todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias, agradece  a aquellas personas que serán gestoras del préstamo que solicita y le será  muy útil en el progreso de su negocio. Con el crédito que solicita, lo invertirá en la adquisición de más objetos en desuso al por mayor.
texts.en:
Parcifal is 23 years old and lives with his parents in their house.  For more than two years, he has worked in recycling.  He collects used items and sells them by the kilo to a large recycling company.  He canvasses the streets in his neighborhood every day starting at noon.  For him, this work is very profitable.  Since he raised his price per kilo, he has earned a good income, which motivates him to continue working in this area.  He invests the money he earns in his university studies.  He would like to buy his own land to have a large store and sell in larger quantities.  He also works in agriculture and uses organic waste as a fertilizer.

This is his fourth loan with MFP and he feels very happy to know that he has financial support, since he has always demonstrated his responsibility with his payments.  He is also happy to be a part of his community bank because all of the members are responsible and supportive.  He thanks everyone who will make this loan possible.  It will be very helpful to the progress of his business.  

With the loan he is requesting, he will acquire more used items in bulk.

loans.use: Purchase used items

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en: Rebecca B. is married and has 5 dependents.  Rebecca cooks varieties of food, including Jolof rice, for sale at Elmina. Her husband is a carpenter. Rebecca uses her income to assist her husband in payment of the family's bills. She will use the loan to purchase more food supplies and ingredients to enable her to increase her food production and sale. With the new profits from her expanded business, Rebecca plans to build a cafeteria.

loans.use: To purchase more food supplies to increase production and sales.

loans.name: Abdoulaye

texts.fr: Monsieur Abdoulaye N. est un agent commercial de profession dans une société de la place. Il habite dans la localité de Camberene. Il est âgé de 32 ans. En même temps monsieur N. pratique la vente de cartes  de crédit. Il a une expérience d’environ 3 ans dans ce domaine. Il est membre du guichet de Camberene  depuis avril 2009. Il sollicite un crédit  de 500 000 frs. L’objet de son emprunt est d’investir dans son activité en renforçant  son stock. Ce financement lui permettra d’augmenter ses gains et de mieux gérer ses besoins sociaux.
texts.en:
Mr. Abdoulaye N. is a sales person by profession in a local company. He lives in the town of Camberene and is 32 years old. He also sells prepaid cards. He has about three years of experience in this domain.  

Abdoulaye has been a member of the Camberene branch office since April 2009. He is requesting a loan of 500,000 francs. The goal of his loan is to invest in his business by bolstering his stock of goods. This financing will enable him to increase his profits and to meet the demands of society better.

loans.use: Increasing his working capital

loans.name: Grace Acquah

texts.en: Grace Acquah W. is married and has 2 children. She has received a junior-high education. Grace cooks local food (banku and Kenkey) for sale at Breman, near Elmina. Her husband is a farmer. She uses her income for the upkeep of the home. Grace will use the loan to purchase more sacks of maize and other ingredients, which she will store and use in bits so that the constant increase in prices for goods won't affect her so much. With the new profits from her expanded business, Grace plans to re-invest back into the food preparation business.

loans.use: To purchase more sacks of maize and other ingredients, which she will store and use in bits so that the constant increase in prices for goods won't affect her so much.

loans.name: Aba

texts.en:
Aba A.  is married and has five dependents. Her husband is a taylor. 

Aba sells food supplies like maize and gari (cassava flour). She also sells cosmetics at Breman near Elmina. She has been in this business for five years. She assists her husband in paying school fees and other expenses of the home. 

Her loan will be used to buy more food supplies for sale. She hopes to use the new profits from the loan to re-invest back into her business.

loans.use: To buy more food supplies for sale

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence A. has no formal education. She is married and has two children. Her husband is a trader. She helps her husband to provide the general needs of the family.

Florence homecooks food for sale. She makes doughnuts and other items at Breman near Elmina.
 
Her loan will be used to buy more food supplies and ingredients to enable her to increase her food production and sales. She hopes to use the additional income as a result of the loan to educate her children. She is holding in her hand a sample of the fried doughnut.

loans.use: To buy more ingredients to increase sales

loans.name: Thelma

texts.es:
La señora Thelma del Socorro C. Blanco,  fémina trabajadora, esforzada y emprendedora quien desde que enviudo hace 15 años se dedicó al comercio de productos Avon y Zermat negocio que le ayudo a superar ese momento triste y sacar adelante a sus dos hijos quienes en ese entonces tenían 6 y 4 años.

Ella con el crédito comprara unos encargos que tiene de cosméticos, cremas, tratamientos etc.
texts.en:
Thelma del Socorro C. Blanco is a hardworking, courageous, and enterprising woman.  After she was widowed 15 years ago, she began a business selling Avon and Zermat cosmetics.  Her business helped her through that sad time and allowed her to support her two children, who were 4 and 6 years old at the time.

With this loan, she will purchase cosmetics, creams, and beauty treatments.

loans.use: Purchase cosmetics, creams, and beauty treatments

loans.name: Marisa

texts.es: Doña Marisa tiene 62 años, vive con su esposo y sus 2 hijos en su casa propia. Hace más de15 años se dedica a la venta D. comida en un puesto D. ventas D. un mercado local D. su barrio, veD. todos los días menos los fines D. semana. Ella sola realiza este trabajo que muchas veces requiere D. mucho esfuerzo físico que sin embargo disfruta día a día  porque le agrada cocinar además D. que tiene una buena sazón  por lo que ha logrado  tener clientela fija. Se siente muy satisfecha con el trabajo que realiza, por ello desea seguir continuando con esta actividad. Es su tercer crédito con MFP, esta muy contenta D.  saber que tiene un apoyo financiero ya que siempre ha demostrado  ser responsable en sus pagos, además  le agrada ser parte D. su banco comunal porque  todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias, agradece  a aquellas personas que serán gestoras del préstamo que solicita y le será  muy útil en el progreso D. su negocio. Con el crédito que solicita, lo invertirá en la compra D. los ingredientes no perecibles al por mayor y así tener mayor abastecimiento en la preparación D. sus comidas.
texts.en:
Marisa is 62 years old, and lives with her husband and two children in their own home.  For more than 15 years, she has sold food at a food stall in her local market.  She sells every day except the weekends.  She only does this work, which many times requires a lot of physical effort, because she likes to cook things with good flavor and because she has many loyal customers.  She feels very satisfied with the work she does, so she wants to continue working.  

This is her third loan with MFP, and she is very happy to know that she has financial support since she has shown she is responsible with her payments.  She is also happy to be a part of her community bank because all of the members are responsible and supportive people.  She is thankful to everyone who will make this loan possible since it will be very useful in the development of her business.  

With the loan she is requesting, she will purchase non-perishable ingredients in bulk in order to have a greater supply for the preparation of her food.

loans.use: Purchase non-perishable products in bulk

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To repair a fence around her house

loans.name: Gotitas De Amor Group

texts.es: La Alcancía Comunal “gotitas D. Amor” esta conformado por 8 integrantes, es una D. las más antiguas D. nuestra Agencia. Los integrantes D. dicha alcancía son personas muy responsables,  ellas se dedican a distintas actividades, tal  es el caso D. Olga quien es secretaria D. este grupo. Ella tiene una pequeña bodega en su casa, en el cual venD.: verduras, frutas, abarrotes, pollo, gaseosas y cervezas, se dedica a este negocio hace más D. trece años, inició esta actividad con la idea D. ayudar a su esposo D. comprarse un carro. Actualmente lograron este objetivo, pero Olga desea comprarse un carro más y  poner una línea D. transporte público en Chosica. Ella solicitó el préstamo a EDAPROSPO para comprar envases D. cerveza ya que estos le hacen falta para  comprar más cervezas y lo que le queD. lo invertirá para mejorar el ambiente D. su negocio (pintura).En la fotografía podemos apreciar solo a las siete integrantes ya que Maria Isabel Sirlupo León no pudo asistir por motivos D. trabajo.
texts.en:
The “Gotitas D. Amor” (Little Drops of Love) communal bank has 8 members.  It is one of the oldest in our Agency.  The members of this bank are very responsible people.  They are engaged in a variety of activities.  Such is Olga’s case; she is the group Secretary.

She has a small grocery store in her house where she sells vegetables, fruit, groceries, chicken, soft drinks and beer.  She’s been in this business for over 13 years.  She started it with the idea of helping her husband buy a car.  They met this goal but now Olga wants to buy another car and set up a public transportation service line in Chosica.

She asked EDAPROSPO for a loan to buy containers for beer she needs in order to buy more beer and whatever is left over she’ll use to improve her business’ appearance (paint).

In the photo we only see seven members because María Isabel Sirlupo León was unable to attend due to work.

loans.use: To buy containers for beer and to buy paint.

loans.name: Hernan Roberto

texts.es:
Hernán hombre trabajador, casado, trabajo para una empresa privada desde hace tiempo, también recibe remesa familiares para ayudarse con los gasto. Tiene como proyecto mejorar la infraestructura de su vivienda pero se le ha presentado las dificultades de financiamiento. 
El préstamo que solicitas es para la compra de materiales de construcción como: cemento, láminas de zinc, hierro, arena, tabla, reglas de madera, alambre, para la construcción de su muro. Obteniendo seguridad, protección y comodidad.
texts.en:
Hernán is a hard-working married man who has been employed by a private company many years.  He also receives help from family to cover his expenses.  He has a project to improve his home's infrastructure but has run into some financial difficulties.

He plans to use the loan to buy construction materials such as cement, zinc sheet, iron, sand, wood conglomerate, wood strips, and wire to build a wall.  His aim is to obtain safety, protection and comfort.

loans.use: To buy construction materials

loans.name: Firmes Y Bendecidos 1, 2 & 3 Group

texts.en:
Lolita is the coordinator of her group, Firmes y Bendecidos 1, 2 & 3 (strong and blessed). The 15 members are all Haitian citizens or descendants from Haitians who emigrated from Haiti. Her story is representative of both her group and Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican clients in general. Her group is located in the rural area of El Seybo, surrounded by sugar cane fields, where running water (none of which is potable) and electricity are unreliable. She makes her home here in a simple structure with her long-term partner and they have two adult children.

Lolita is excited to be seeking her seventh loan with Esperanza, being part of Esperanza Microfinance program in El Seybo since 2007.  She plans to use this loan to invest in her business. She operates a breakfast sales business from her home. She sells breakfast like bread, cafe, tea, sausages, plantains, etc. She will use the profits to continue improving her business while saving part of it to visit or send to her family in Haiti, when they have any needs. Her most difficult challenge is to come back to Haiti and live a safe and comfortable life. 

The photos were taken separately, one with five members and the other one with ten, just to have more focus on the faces. Lolita thanks all of you for your support.

loans.use: To buy goods for breakfast

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Ibrahima Bao

texts.fr: Monsieur Ibrahima Bao T. habite à Camberene. Il est d’abord électricien. Ensuite il évolue dans le secteur de l’élevage. Il capitalise une expérience  de 5 ans dans ses  activités. Il est membre du guichet de Camberene depuis aout 2009. Il sollicite un crédit de 100 000 frs destiné à l’achat de bétail afin de démarrer une nouvelle campagne. Ce financement lui permettra d’accroitre ses revenus et de mieux gérer ses  besoins personnels.
texts.en: Mr. Ibrahima Bao T. lives in Camberene. First, he is an electrician. In addition, he raises livestock. He has five years of experience in his work. He has been a member of the Camberene branch since August 2009. He is seeking a loan of 100,000 of West African Francs in order to purchase livestock and start a new cycle. This loan will allow him to increase his revenues and better provide for his needs.

loans.use: Increasing business capital

loans.name: Ana Julia

texts.es:
Ana casada, su esposo guardia de seguridad, mujer trabajadora ya que tiene su propio negocio su tienda de variedades, en donde vende ropas otras bisuterías. Inicio su negocio al ver que los gastos de la casa eran más que los ingresos adquiridos. Su forma de venta es ambulantemente y por encargos. 
Agradece ala financiera por el apoyo para aumentar sus ingreso mediante este préstamo que será utilizado en la compra de mercadería como. Ropa para dama, caballero, niños. Artículos escolares, entre otros. Así aumentado su inventario ofreciéndole a sus clientes mayores y variedad de producto obtenido como resultando mayores ganancia.
texts.en:
Ana is married and her husband is a security guard.  She is a hard worker and has her own store where she sells clothing and costume jewelry.  She began her business when she noticed that household expenses had surpassed income.  The way she conducts business is by going door-to-door or taking orders.   

She is grateful for the financial support to help increase her earnings and will use the loan to buy merchandise such as women's, men's and children's clothing and school articles, among other items.  In this manner she will be able to offer her best customers more variety which will increase sales and income.

loans.use: To buy clothing for retail sale

loans.name: Déthié

texts.fr: Madame Déthié T. habite  dans l localité de Camberene. Elle s’active dans le commerce  depuis plus de 25 ans. Elle est installée dans le marché depuis 7 ans ou elle  exerce la vente de tissus qui est sa principale activité. Elle est sociétaire au sein du guichet de Camberene  depuis aout 2001. Elle sollicite un crédit de 500 000 frs qui sera destiné à l’achat de tissus ce qui lui donnera l’opportunité d’élargir son activité. Ce financement lui permettra d’accroitre ses revenus et d’améliorer sa situation sociale.
texts.en: Mrs. Déthié T. lives in the village of Camberene. She has been an active trader for more than 25 years. She set herself up in the market seven years ago and her main activity is the sale of  fabrics there. She has been a member of the Camberene branch since August 2001. She is requesting a loan of 500,000 francs which will be used to buy fabric and will give her the opportunity to expand her business. This loan will allow her to increase her income and improve her social situation.

loans.use: Increase of funds

loans.name: Genesis 3 Group

texts.en:
Carmen is the coordinator of her group, Genesis 3, and her story is representative of both her group and Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican clients in general. Her group is located in one of the poorest areas around Santo Domingo city, where running water (none of which is potable) and electricity are unreliable. She makes her home here in a simple structure with her long-term partner and their two children.

Carmen is excited to be seeking her first loan with Esperanza. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business. She operates a 'colmado' (food stall), and she will invest in her business by buying  rice, beans, sugar, vegetables, canned goods, etc.. She will use the profits to re-invest in her business. Her most difficult challenge is managing to have a comfortable life. She thanks all of you for your support.

loans.use: to buy rice, beans, sugar, vegetables, canned products

loans.name: Jorge Armando

texts.es:
Jorge tiene la edad de 30 años, casado, con dos hijos, siendo un padre trabajador para dar la alimentación a sus hijos.
Hoy en día trabaja en una empresa privada en la elaboración de láminas de zinc en donde tiene siete meses. Anteriormente laboraba en el campo cultivando granos básicos.
Como objetivo es la construcción de su casa, en donde la tiene parte construida lo que desea terminar es un cuarto en donde está a mitad, así como poner el techo para estar en mejores condiciones de comodidad. Ya que ahora forman la familia cuatro miembro. Siendo Afodenic una fuente para lograr el la mejora a su vivienda, por medio del financiamiento. 
Comprara materiales de construcción como: láminas de zinc, cuartones,  clavos, para el techo y cerrar.
texts.en:
Jorge is 30 years old, married and has two children.  He works hard to feed his family. He has been employed at a private zinc sheet manufacturing company for seven months.  Before he worked in the fields raising basic grains.
 
His goal is to finish building his house.  Part of it is already built but he wants to finish the rest and put up a roof to improve living conditions.  There are four members in his family.  He is requesting financing through Afodenic for his home improvement project.

He plans to use the loan to buy zinc sheet, lumber and nails to finish off the roof.

loans.use: To buy zinc sheet, lumber, and nails to build a roof and have more space

loans.name: Ana Lucia

texts.es:
Ana es madre de tres hijos, casada, una mujer con su propio negocio, una pulpería con varios años en ventas, iniciando con el apoyo de su mama quien envió remesas desde los Estados Unidos.
Luego atreves de financiamiento con Afodenic, hace crecer sus ventas, aumentado el margen de ganancia, lo que para ella ha sido de mucha satisfacción poder tener su propio negocio. Y poder apoyar a su familia.
Son ocho ciclos lo que ha logrado hacer mejora  a su casa también. Siendo el más viable  por la facilidad de plazos.
 Hoy con este nuevo préstamo invertirá en productos de consumo como: granos básicos, cereales, golosinas, gaseosas. A si como ropa y cosmético logrando más variedad en su negocio.
texts.en:
Ana is married and the mother of three children.  She has had her own grocery store for several years.  She was able to set up her business with the money her mother sent her from the United States.

She has been able to increase her sales and profits through loans she was given by Afodenic.  She is very happy to have her own business and be able to support her family.

Over an eight year period she was able to use the loans, thanks to their good payment terms, to carry out some home improvements.
 
With this new loan she plans to buy products such as basic grains, cereal, sweets and softdrinks.  She also plans to add a line of clothing and cosmetics to offer more variety at her store.

loans.use: To buy basic grains, cereal, sweets, clothing and cosmetics to increase sales

loans.name: Martha Lorena

texts.es:
Martha tiene su propio negocio de venta de ropa, y golosinas, hace buñuelos, arroz de leche, cajeta por las tardes, ya que labora en horarios de la mañana como conserje. Y que por ser su salario bajo, busca las alternativas para solventar sus gastos personales.
Con los préstamos en Afodenic ha logrado equilibrar sus ventas, entre las dificultades que tuvo en el año es que fue operada de un ojo, en donde sus hijas menores la han apoyado haciendo las ventas.
Con este financiamiento invertirá en ropa escolar, ya que la demanda es mucha en estos meses por el comienzo del año escolar. Lo que espera obtener buenas ventas. Para poder pagar sus compromisos, a si como recobrar pronto su salud.
texts.en:
Martha has her own business selling clothing and sweets (she makes doughnut fritters, rice pudding, and fudge).  She works in the morning as a concierge.  Because of her low salary she had to look for alternatives to increase income to cover personal expenses.

With loans received through Afodenic she was able to increase sales despite the difficulties she had the year her eye was operated on.  Her two youngest daughters had to help her run the business.

She plans to use this loan to buy school clothing since the new school year is about to begin and there is great demand.  She hopes to increase sales so she can meet her payment obligations and gain her strength back.

loans.use: To buy school clothing for the new school year

loans.name: Aracely Del Carmen

texts.es:
Aracely es una mujer  con su propio negocio, el cual comenzó hace vaR. años, con el propósito de apoyar a su familia.
Cuenta con una pulpería en donde vende una variedad de productos de consumo, y que ha venido aumentando los niveles de ventas con financiamientos que Afodenic ha otorgado, a si como la mejora de su vivienda.
Hoy con este nuevo préstamo seguirá con la construcción de su muro que ha logrado hacer poco a poco en donde comprara materiales de construcción y seguir la obra. Lo que está contenta por lograr el objetivo de asegurar su propiedad como a su familia.
texts.en:
Aracely owns her own business, one she started several years ago with the goal of supporting her family. 

She has a convenience store and she sells a variety of consumer products. Her sales have been increasing with the loans Afodenic (Kiva Field Partner) has granted her. She has carried out some home improvements. 

With her new loan she will continue with the construction of a wall by purchasing materials and pay for the labor. She is very happy to have reached her objective of securing her property and supporting her family.

loans.use: To purchase construction materials for the home.

loans.name: Silverio

texts.es:
El señor Silverio R. tiene 36 años de edad, tiene 3 hijos que aún están a su cuidado; ellos están estudiando en una escuela de su zona para que puedan tener un mejor futuro. Silverio vive en la zona de la Maica de la ciudad de Cochabamba, él trabaja en una empresa como obrero en el mantenimiento de tuberías, su esposa trabaja cuidando ganado lechero en la casa donde viven. Debido al trabajo que Silverio realiza solo puede estar en su hogar compartiendo con su familia una vez por  mes,  él hace ese sacrificio para que su familia salga adelante.

Silverio es una persona muy trabajadora, gracias a ello logro conseguir un vehículo que quiere  hacerlo trabajar y de esa manera pueda obtener mejores ingresos; él quiere el préstamo para convertir su vehículo a gas natural y así pueda brindar el servicio de transporte. Silverio está muy agradecido con la gente que por medio de Kiva le pudo dar la oportunidad de hacer realidad uno más de sus sueños.

Silverio entre sus planes futuros planea sacar un nuevo préstamo para comprarse un lote de terreno en el cual pueda cultivar productos agrícolas y así se pueda trabajar estando más cerca de su familia.
texts.en:
Silverio R. is 36 years old.  He has three children who are studying in a school back in his home town so they can have a better future.  Silverio lives in the la Macia zone of the city of Cochabamba.  He works for a company maintaining pipes.  His wife takes care of milk cows from their home.  Because of the work he does Silverio can only be at home with his family once a month.  He makes this sacrifice to help his family get ahead.
 
Silverio is a hard worker, and he has managed to acquire a vehicle, which he would like to work on so that he can earn more income.  He is seeking a loan to convert his vehicle to natural gas and then offer a transport service.  Silverio thanks you for giving him the opportunity, through Kiva, to realize one of his dreams.

One of Silverio's plans for the future is to seek a new loan to buy a plot of land to farm, which would allow him to work closer to his family.

loans.use: Capital to convert his vehicle from gas to natural gas

loans.name: Maria Guadalupe

texts.es: Maria Guadalupe se dedica a la venta de mercadería en general. Hace más de 3 años que tiene este negocio. Esta no es la primera vez que solicita créditos pues ha sido una fuente alternativa para salir adelante con su negocio. Inicio este medio de vida por la necesidad de generar ingresos a su familia ya que tiene 2 hijos menores de edad, ella tiene que salir todos los días para ofrecer la variedad de productos a sus clientes. El motivo del financiamiento es para la compra de materia prima como calzado, cosméticos, cremas, tratamientos y ropa en general. Desea mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia y establecer otro medio de vida.
texts.en: Maria Guadalupe works selling general merchandise and has had this business for more than three years.  This is not the first time that she is requesting a loan because it has been an alternative means of getting ahead with her business.  She began this means of living due to the need to generate income for her family, as she has two young children.  She has to go out every day to sell a variety of products to her customers.  The purpose of the loan is for the purchase of raw material such as shoes, cosmetics, creams, treatments and general clothing.  She wants to improve her family’s living conditions and establish another means of living.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Hernan

texts.es:
El señor Hernan V. S. tiene 28 años de edad, tiene 3 hijos pequeños 2 gemelos muy pequeños y una hija que esta estudiando en la escuela de su zona. El señor Hernan y su familia  vive en la zona de la Vilomilla ubicado en la localidad de Sipe-Sipe a 22 km de la ciudad de Cochabamba, zona muy agrícola.
 
El sr. Hernan se dedica a la construcción, de viviendas por la zona, y su esposa se encarga del cuidado del ganado vacuno con el que cuentan, ambas actividades le generan ingresos que les han ayuda a sustentarse hasta el momento. Solo cuentan con 3 cabezas de ganado vacuno de donde apenas producen 15 litros de leche diarios y estos los comercializan en la zona, la esposa de Hernan no puede hacer muchas actividades pues sus bebes gemelos aun tienen un par de meses y no debe dejarlos solos.

El Sr. Hernan tiene mucha demanda de clientes en la construcción y refacción de viviendas, pero no cuenta con todos los equipos para poder realizar un trabajo mas efectivo, el se alquila una maquina mezcladora, y esto le ha generado mucho costo, y no ha podido ahorrar mucho, por este motivo, se visto en la necesidad de solicitar un crédito para poder obtener una maquina mezcladora y con el tiempo  poder ahorrar para gastos familiares.
El sr. Hernan desea dar un futuro mejor a sus hijos y con el tiempo mejorar las condiciones de su vivienda para que su familia.
texts.en:
Mr. Hernan V. S. is 28 years old and has three small children (two very young twins and a daughter who attends the local school). Mr. Hernan and his family live in the Vilomilla zone in the locality of Sipe-Sipe, which is 22 kilometers from the city of Cochabamba. It is a very agricultural area.
 
Mr. Hernan works building houses and his wife is in charge of their dairy cows. Both activities generate income that has helped them to sustain their family up to this point. They only have three dairy cows, which produce 15 liters of milk each day. They sell the milk in their local area. Hernan's wife can't do a lot because their twins are only a couple months old so she shouldn't leave them alone.

Mr. Hernan has a lot of demand from his customers for house construction and renovation, but he does not have all the equipment necessary to work most effectively. He rents a mixing machine, which has been very costly, and therefore he hasn't been able to save much. He realized it is necessary to request a loan so he can obtain his own mixing machine. This way, he will able to be save money for his family over time. Mr. Hernan hopes to offer his children a better future and, with time, to improve his family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy construction equipment (a mixing machine)

loans.name: William

texts.es:
William M. es vecino  de la comunidad llamada trinchera de Pital en Alajuela, conocida internacionalmente por ser  la zona de mayor exportación de piña  en Costa Rica. 
A pesar de que hay grandes Multinacionales exportando la piña costarricense, la producción de piña artesanal también está dando frutos en esta zona.
 Es por eso que William necesita  ¢500 000 (quinientos mil colones) para iniciar su proyecto  de siembra de piña, comprando la pina y los insumos necesarios para tener la mejor cosecha.
El es socio de la Empresa Comunal de Mujeres al Éxito de la Trinchera de Pital, una de las 100 organizaciones socias de EDESA en Costa Rica
texts.en:
William M. is a neighbor of the Trinchera de Pital community en Alajuela.  This is the region known world wide for producing the most pineapple for export in Costa Rica. 
In spite of the big Multinationals exporting Costa Rican pineapple, the production of traditionally-grown pineapple has been successful in this region.  
That is why William is requesting $1025USD (five-hundred thousand colones) to start his pineapple planting project.  He needs to purchase the pineapple and the necessary supplies to ensure the best harvest possible.
William is a member of the "Empresa Comunal de Mujeres al Éxito de la Trinchera de Pital" (Communal Enterprise of the Successful Women of Trinchera de Pital) communal bank, one of the 100 member organizations of EDESA in Costa Rica.

loans.use: To plant pineapples.

loans.name: Elva

texts.es: Elva tiene 19 años, vive con su esposo y su hijo en una casa alquilada. Hace más de 2 años se dedica a la venta de comida rápida como sandwich, salchichas y otros alimentos de consumo rápido. Ella cuenta con un stand móvil, donde se instala en cualquier parte dentro de su zona, para luego preparar estos alimentos pre cocidos listos para ser fritos y servidos. Las ventas que realiza son diarias, descansando solo los domingos, ya que durante la semana su trabajo es muy agotador, pues el servicio que ofrece tiene muy buena acogida. Su mayor anhelo es tener un restaurante con abundante clientela por lo que se esfuerza desde ahora para concretar ese sueño. Es su primer crédito con MFP, esta muy contenta de  saber que tiene un apoyo financiero, además  le agrada ser parte de su banco comunal porque  todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias, agradece  a aquellas personas que serán gestoras del préstamo que solicita ya que le será  muy útil en el progreso de su negocio. Con el crédito que solicita, comprará un balón de gas, así como abastecerse de ingredientes para no tener dificultad de preparar dichos alimentos.
texts.en: Elva is 19 years old and lives with her husband and their child in a rented home.  For more than 2 years, she has been selling fast food such as sandwiches, sausages and other fast food items.  She has a stand that she sets up in different areas in her neighborhood.  She prepares the pre-cooked foods so that they are ready to be fried and served.  She makes sales daily, resting only on Sundays, since during the week her work is very exhausting.  Her business has been very well received by the public.  Her main desire is to have a restaurant with a large clientele, and she is working to realize this dream.  This is her first loan with MFP, and she is very pleased to know that she has financial support.  In addition, she appreciates her communal bank because all of the members are people who are responsible and very cooperative.  She thanks the people who will make this loan that she requests possible, since it will help her to make progress with her business.  With the loan she requests she will buy a tank of gas and will also buy ingredients for her dishes, so that she will not have problems preparing her food.

loans.use: to buy a tank of gas and ingredients for her dishes

loans.name: Luz

texts.es:
Luz R. es una microempresaria  muy conocida en la trinchera de pital de alajuela.
Ella tiene ya un año de tener el negocio,  pero en este momento necesita un préstamo de  ¢500 000 (quinientos mil colones) para la  compra de otra máquina de coser. Con este préstamo espero mejorar la calidad de su servicio. Además esta muy contenta de que su hija  ya esta aprendiendo el negocio de la costura,.
Ella  es socia de la Empresa Comunal de Mujeres al Éxito de la Trinchera de Pital, una de las 100 organizaciones socias de EDESA en Costa Rica
texts.en:
Luz R. is a small businesswoman who is very well known in La Trinchera de Pital, in Alajuela.  She has been in her business for one year and right now she needs a loan for 500,000 colones to buy another sewing machine.  With this loan, she hopes to improve the quality of her service.  She is very happy because her daughter is already learning the sewing business.

Luz is a member of the 'Mujeres al Éxito de la Trinchera de Pital' (Trinchera de Pital Women For Success) communal bank, one of the 100 member organizations of EDESA in Costa Rica.

loans.use: To buy a sewing machine

loans.name: Francinie

texts.es:
Francinie C. Rodríguez  quiere convertirse en toda una microempresaria por medio de su taller de Costura.
Ella vive en la Trinchera de Alajuela, desde hace tres años ella se dedica a la confección de ropa. Con sus ventas a logrado hacer que su negocio sea reconocido en toda su comunidad, por eso ella quiere un préstamo de ¢500 000 (quinientos mil colones)  para comprar una máquina de coser Overlock y demás materiales que necesita para lograr una mayor producción en su taller y convertirse al fin en una microempresaria.
Ella  es socia de la Empresa Comunal de Mujeres al Éxito de la Trinchera de Pital, una de las 100 organizaciones socias de EDESA en Costa Rica
texts.en:
With her sewing workshop, Francinie C. Rodríguez wants to become a businesswoman.  She lives in Trinchera de Alajuela, where for 3 years she has been making clothing.  As a result of the sales she has made, her business is now recognized in her community.  For this reason, she wants a loan of 500,000 colones to buy an Overlock sewing machine and other supplies that she needs so that she can increase production in her workshop and become a more accomplished businesswoman.  

She is a member of the "Empresa Comunal de Mujeres al Éxito de la Trinchera de Pital," one of the 100 organizations that are members of EDESA in Costa Rica.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a screen and music mixer for his karaoke business

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy oranges and clothes.

loans.name: Alejandra

texts.es: Alejandra  tiene 61 años, vive con sus 2 hijas que son casadas en su casa. DesD. hace 21 años se dedica en la venta D. comida, D. esa manera ha logrado cubrir los gastos D. su familia, actualmente las rentas que recibe son para sus propios gastos. El platillo que venD. son: sandwich D. cerdo, con alguna bebida refrescante o infusión en un pequeño stand móvil, que lo estaciona todos los días en una esquina comercial cerca a un centro  universitario. Es así que los jóvenes estudiantes y personas en general consumen estos alimentos que son D. consumo rápido. Disfruta mucho su trabajo porque le permite ser independiente económicamente, su deseo es continuar adelante ya que este trabajo satisface sus deseos D. ser activa. Es su octavo crédito con MFP, esta muy contenta D.  saber que tiene un apoyo financiero ya que siempre ha demostrado  ser responsable en sus pagos, además  le agrada ser parte D. su banco comunal porque  todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias, agradece  a aquellas personas que serán gestoras del préstamo que solicita ya que le será  muy útil en el progreso D. su negocio. Con el crédito que solicita, lo invertirá en la compra D. carne D. cerdo humado y otros productos como café.
texts.en:
Alejandra is 61 years old and lives with her two married daughters in her own home.  She has been selling food for 21 years.  In this way, she has managed to cover her family's expenses.  Currently, the profits that she makes in her business cover her own expenses.  The dish that she sells is a pork sandwich with a refreshing drink or herbal tea.  She makes her sales from a small, mobile stand that she sets up every day on a commercial street corner near a university.  Young students and the general public buy her food which is quick and easy to eat.  She enjoys her work a lot because it allows her to be financially independent.  Her wish is to continue in her business since this work satisfies her wish to remain active.

This is Alejandra's eighth loan with MFP.  She is very happy to know that she has financial support.  She has always been responsible in making her loan repayments and she likes being a member of her community bank since all the members are responsible people who are very supportive of one another.  Alejandra would like to thank those who will help to fund her loan since it will be very useful to her in making progress in her business.  She will invest her loan money in buying smoked pork and other products such as coffee.

loans.use: To buy smoked pork and coffee

loans.name: Silvia Del Rocio

texts.es:
La Señora. Silvia L. es socia del banco comunal Mujeres Floreciendo, vive por la comunidad de Paccha, esta comunidad se caracteriza por la belleza de su naturaleza encerrando un ambiente de paz, su gente se dedica a la cría de animales y a la agricultura.

Nuestra socia tiene 27 años, es casada y tiene 2 hijos de 9 y 7 años de edad que están estudiando en una escuela de la ciudad. Su esposo labora en un taller de latonería (arreglo de latas de vehículos), no tiene casa propia por lo que vive arrendando.
 
Doña Silvia se dedica a los quehaceres de su hogar y también a la cría de animales como: pollos y cerdos a los cuales los vende en su propia comunidad.
 
Se encuentra en el banco comunal hace 7 años, tiempo el cual ha logrado consolidar muchas amistades, el dinero de su crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de pollos y en su alimento. Su sueño es  tener su casa propia.
texts.en:
Silvia L. is a member of the communal bank Mujeres Floreciendo [Women Blooming]. She lives in the community of Paccha, characterized by nature's beauty encircling an environment of peace. Its people raise animals and work in agriculture.

This member is 27 years old, married, and has two children, nine and seven years old, who study in a city school. Her husband works in an autobody shop fixing cars. They do not have their own home, so they lease.

Silvia tends to her household chores and also raises animals like chickens and pigs, which she sells in her own community.
 
She has been in the communal bank for seven years, in which time she has formed many friendships. She will invest the loan in the purchase of chickens and feed. Her dream is to have her own house.

loans.use: Purchase chickens and animal feed

loans.name: María Teresa

texts.es:
La Señora María B. es socia del banco comunal Mujeres Floreciendo, vive por la comunidad de Patamarca en la ciudad de Cuenca, esta ciudad es reconocida por la belleza natural y cultural, su variedad en la gastronomía cautiva los paladares de propios y extraños.

La Señora. María tiene 41 años, es casada, y tiene 4 hijos de 23, 22, 18 y 16 años de edad, su primera hija trabaja solo para sus gastos, su segundo hijo es casado y vive  independiente, su tercer hijo estudia en la universidad y su ultima hija esta estudiando en un colegio de la ciudad. Su esposo labora en la construcción como albañil, con el trabajo conyugal han logrado construir su casa propia.

Doña María se dedica a la agricultura, siembra verduras y hortalizas a las que vende en su propia comunidad, también cría  animales como: cerdos, cuyes y gallinas.
 
Se encuentra con su primer cerdito y fue invitada al banco comunal por su hermana, el dinero de su crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de pollos. Su meta es tener un criadero de pollos más grande.
texts.en:
María B. is a member of the communal bank Mujeres Floreciendo [Women Blooming]. She lives in the community of Patamarca in the city of Cuenca. This city is reknowned for its natural and cultural beauty. Its gastronomical variety captivates the palates of both locals and strangers.

María is 41 years old, married, and has four children aged 23, 22, 18, and 16. Her eldest daughter works independently to cover her expenses, her eldest son is married and lives independently, her younger son studies at university, and her youngest daughter is studying in a high school in the city. Her husband works in construction as a mason, and together they built their own home.

María works in agriculture, planting vegetables which she sells in her own community. She also raises animals like pigs, guinea pigs and hens.

This is her first loan. She was invited to the communal bank by her sister. She is going to invest in the purchase of chickens. Her goal is to have a larger chicken hatchery.

loans.use: Purchase chickens

loans.name: Miguel

texts.es:
Miguel H.  Corrales es vecino de Perez Zeledon. El se ha dedicado toda su vida a la Agricultura.
En este momento tiene un proyecto para sembrar su finquita de café para asi aprovechar la subida del precios de este grano en el país. Es por eso que el necesita un préstamo de de ¢500 000 (quinientos mil colones)   para la compra de los insumos necesarios para  la preparación del suelo, y la creación del almacigó.
El es socio de la Empresa de Crédito Comunal de Bancruce una de las 100 organizaciones socias de EDESA en Costa Rica
texts.en: Miguel H. Corrales is a neighbor of Perez Zeledon. He has worked all his life in agriculture. Right now, he has a project planting his small farm with coffee to take advantage of the rise in prices of this crop in the country. For this he needs a loan of 500,000 colones to purchase the necessary inputs for the preparation of the soil and the creation of a nursery. He is a member of the Empresa de Crédito Comunal de Bancruce, one of the 100 social organizations of EDESA in Costa Rica.

loans.use: Coffee growing

loans.name: Julia Adriana

texts.es:
La Señorita. Julia Z. es socia del banco comunal Mujeres Floreciendo, vive por la comunidad de Paccha, esta comunidad se caracteriza por la belleza de su naturaleza encerrando un ambiente de paz, su gente se dedica a la cría de animales y a la agricultura.

La Señorita. Julia tiene 22 años de edad, es soltera y vive con sus padres, su papá es de profesión sastre y labora en su casa, su mamá se dedica a los quehaceres domésticos, no tienen casa propia por lo que vive arrendando.
 
La Señorita Julia se dedica a estudiar en la universidad y se encuentra cursando el quinto ciclo de la carrera de Derecho, en sus tiempos libres se dedica a la venta de productos Yanbal actividad que lleva realizando un año.

Se encuentra en su segundo crédito que realiza en el banco comunal y fue invitada por su mamá y su tía, el dinero de su crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de más cosméticos. Su meta es  terminar sus estudios y ser profesional.
texts.en:
Julia Z. is a member of the communal bank Mujeres Floreciendo [Women Blooming]. She lives in the community of Paccha, which is characterized by beautiful nature surrounding an environment of peace. Its people raise animals and work in agriculture.

Julia is 22 years old, single, and lives with her parents. Her father is a tailor and works in their home. Her mother does domestic work. They do not own their own home so they lease.

Julia is studying at university and is in her fifth cycle of law studies. In her free time she sells Yanbal products, which she has done for a year.
 
This is her second loan with the communal bank. She was invited by her mother and aunt. She will invest the loan in purchasing more cosmetics. Her goal is to finish her studies and become a professional.

loans.use: Purchase perfumes, creams and cosmetics

loans.name: Aida Patricia

texts.es:
La Señora Aída Z. es socia del banco comunal Mujeres Floreciendo, vive por la comunidad de Paccha, esta comunidad se caracteriza por la belleza de su naturaleza, su gente se dedica a la cría de animales y a la agricultura.

Doña Aída tiene 24 años, es casada y tiene un hijo de 4 años de edad. Su esposo labora en la rama de la construcción ya que es albañil, con su trabajo han logrado construir su casa propia.
 
La Señora. Aída se dedica a los quehaceres de su hogar y al cuidado de su hijo que aun es pequeño, pero como pasa en casa tambien se dedica a la cría de animales como: pollos y cuyes a los cuales los vende en su propia comunidad.

Se encuentra en su segundo crédito que realiza en el banco comunal y fue motivada po su suegrea para que ingrese al mismo, el dinero de su crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de pollos y en su alimento. Su meta es  crdeecer mucho más en su negocio.
texts.en:
Aída Z. is a member of the "Mujeres Floreciendo" community bank.  She lives in Paccha, a community which is noted for its natural beauty.  Its residents work raising livestock and farming crops.

Aida is 24 years old, married, and has one 4 year-old son.  Her husband works in the construction industry.  He is a builder and, through his work, they have managed to build their own home.

Aida carries out her housework and looks after her son who is still young.  However, she also raises animals such as chickens and guinea pigs which she sells in her own community.

Aida is taking her second loan through her community bank which she was encouraged to join by her mother-in-law.  She will invest her loan money in buying chickens and chicken feed.  Her goal is to grow a lot more in her business.

loans.use: To buy chickens and animal feed

loans.name: Blanca Aracely

texts.es:
La señora Blanca Aracely E. Juárez, vive en unión libre  en el señor Hermilo Santos  Gallardo, tiene dos hijos a su responsabilidad  un hombre  y una mujer: José Herbin de doce años y  Diana Laura de nueve años.

            El préstamo solictado lo invertirá en la compra y venta  de zapatos de la   marca Andrea, como también venta de cosmético de la marca avon, con ello inicio hace cuatro años  y la ha ido muy bien ya que le ha dejado buenos  ingresos.

         Se animo con esta forma de trabajar ya que  el préstamo requiere d un trabaja y la mejor manera para trabajarlo es invertirlo  en uno que le deje  buenas ganancias y así sacar adelante a su familia.

        Con cada venta que ella realiza lo ahorra para que cuándo  le toque ir a levantar mas pedidos tenga de de donde obtener a si ser de manera puntual en sus pagos.
 
       Su sueño es que  algún día logre tener su propia zapatería y así apoyar a sus dos hijos a terminar una carrera del cual pueda sostenerse en la vida.
texts.en:
Blanca Aracely E. Juárez lives with her partner Hermilo Santos Gallardo.  They have two children in their care: one son and one daughter.  José Herbin is 12 years old and Diana Laura is 9 years old.

Blanca Aracely will invest her loan money in buying and selling Andrea-brand shoes.  She will also buy Avon-brand cosmetics which she started selling four years ago.  Her business has done very well since it has made her good profits.

Blanca Aracely started out in this line of business since a loan requires you to work and the best way to work is to invest the loan in a business that makes good profits.  In this way she has managed to get her family ahead in life.

With every sale that she makes, she saves so that when she has to go and make more orders, she has a source of merchandise.  This allows her to be punctual in making her repayments.  Her dream is to some day manage to own her own shoe store so that she can support her two children until they finish their university studies which will allow them to support themselves in life.

loans.use: To buy footwear, cosmetics and plastic products to sell in her region

loans.name: Isela

texts.es:
La señora Isela Sánchez C., vive en la ribera Julián Grajales, Municipio de Copainala Estado de Chiapas México, es casada y tiene cinco hijos a su responsabilidad  quienes son: Faní de veinte años, Roxana  de diesi ocho años, Miguel de  quince en primer semestre de Bachillerato, Henri de diez en quinto de primaria y la más pequeña es Yudiveth de ocho años en tercero de  primaria.

         Durante a estado solicitando el préstamo lo invierte en su mini tienda de abarrotes  donde lleva seis años y nos comenta que le va bien  ya que con ello a estado sacando adelante a sus hijos, aun así cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo que traba  en el campo.

        Por su propia creatividad  se animo a poner  su propio negocio ya que  donde ella vive las tiendas es  tan retirada  y se le hace muy difícil ir por una sola cosa y decidió poner uno.

        De las ganancias  que va obteniendo  vuelve invertir en lo mismo y así su tienda  este cada día mejor surtida con cosas de mejor calidad, y sus clientes estén satisfechos con el producto requerido.

       Su  deseo es seguir trabajando para sacar adelante a sus hijos que están estudiando y logres tener una carrera que se propongan.
texts.en:
Mrs. Isela Sánchez C., lives on the shore of Julián Grajales, in the town of Copainala, and the state of Chiapas México. She is married and has five children in her responsibility. They are: Faní who is twenty years old, Roxana who is eighteen years old, Miguel V who is in his first semester of high school, Henry X who is in fifth grade and they youngest is Yudiveth who is eight years old and in third grade.

Right now Isela is requesting a loan to invest in her little grocery store which she has had for six years. She tells us that it is going well and that she is trying to give her children a good start in life along with the help of her husband who works in the countryside. 

Because of her own creativity she is livening up her business because where she lives the stores are very remote and it makes it difficult to go just for one thing, so she decided to make another store. 

From the earnings that she is making she is reinvesting in the business and so her store is getting better every day, stocked with higher quality items and her clients are satisfied with the products they require.

Her desire is to continue working to give her children good lives and to succeed in this career.

loans.use: To buy merchandise to stock her grocery store.

loans.name: Maria Margarita

texts.es:
La señora Margarita G. Gutiérrez, vive en la Ribera Julián Grajales, Municipio de Copainala Estado de Chiapas México, es casada con el señor Audon Santos Santos, quienes todos su hijos ya están casados y tienen un nieto  a su responsabilidad  de nombre Royer Santos Estrada de diesi seis años de edad.

        El préstamo que  ha solicitado lo invertirá en la compra de mercancía  para surtir su tienda de abarrotes, donde lleva un años  y le va bien ya qué ha tenido buenos ingresos en  hogar.

       Para iniciar esta actividad  la animo su  nuera  ya que es un trabajo bueno en donde les va bien  y así con esta actividad tendría ingresos en su familia y gracias a dios comenta que sí le está funcionando.

       De la ganancia que le queda compra más mercancía que se le termina como son: azúcar,  aceite, galletas, entre otros cosas, y así agradar más su negocio que tanto la ha estado apoyando.
 
Su  deseo  es que su negocio aumente día a día  y de eso lograr a horrar para sostenerse más adelante.
texts.en:
