Margarita G. Gutiérrez lives in Julián Grajales neighborhood, in the town of Copainala, in the State of Chiapas, Mexico.  She is married to Audon Santos Santos and all her children are already married.  Margarita and her husband have one grandchild in their care: 6 year-old Royer Santos Estrada.

Margarita will invest her loan in buying merchandise to stock her grocery store.  She has been in this business for a few years and it is doing well.  She has made good income for her household.

It was Margarita's daughter-in-law who encouraged her to start out in this business since it is good work and she told Margarita that she would make good income for her family through this business.  Margarita says that, thanks to God, her business is doing well.

Margarita uses the profits that she makes in her business to buy more merchandise when it runs out such as sugar, oil, cookies, etc.  In this way, she expands this business that has supported her so well.

Margarita's wish is for her business to grow day by day so that she can save in order to support herself in the future.

loans.use: To buy merchandise to stock her grocery store

loans.name: 20 De Enero Group

texts.es:
La Banca Comunal "20 de Enero" está ingresando al ciclo Nro. 1, son mujeres entusiastas y con deseos de mejorar su vida.   El grupo será parte del centro focal de Senkata, está integrado por 10 mujeres.
Cada una de las integrantes ya tiene negocio propio, ente los cuales se encuentra:  venta de artículos para el hogar (pasta dental, pilas, ganchos para ropa, cremas para la cara, en general las señoras le dicen a este tipo de negocio “venta de cachivaches”), costura de polleras, venta de tunta, tejidos y costura de polleras, tejidos de ropa para bebé, venta de CD´s, venta de verduras, tienda de barrio.

La Banca Comunal “20 de Enero” está dirigida por una mesa directiva compuesta por  una presidenta, una tesorera y una secretaria de actas, quienes tienen el encargo de guiar a sus compañeras durante este ciclo.

La  presidenta, la señora Lidia ha participado  durante seis años y medio en el Centro Focal de Villa Tejada  y en esta oportunidad está ingresando a su primer ciclo de la Banca Comunal "20 de Enero", la señora Lidia comenta que entre varias socias antiguas, entre ella doña Miguelina,  decidieron formar grupo para sacar el crédito.  Entre los servicios que más les gusta está la atención del consultorio de salud y contar con un Seguro.

El negocio que ocupa a la señora presidenta es el tejido de chompas, la venta de “cachivaches” y venta de refresco de mocochinchi (durazno seco) por vaso, éste último es un negocio que tuvo desde muy joven.  
El crédito que está solicitando la señora Lidia servirá para comprar azúcar, quisa  (durazno seco) y lana, negocios que ella espera impulsar este semestre.
texts.en:
The "20 de Enero" (January 20th) community bank is beginning its first loan cycle.  The members of this group are enthusiastic women who have a desire to improve their lives.  The group forms part of the Senkata regional office and has 10 female members.

Each of the group's members has her own business.  These businesses include: selling household products (toothpaste, batteries, clothes hangers, face cream - in general, the ladies call this type of business 'venta de cachivaches' (knick knack sales)), sewing traditional skirts, selling 'tunta' (a dried potato product), weaving and sewing traditional skirts, knitting baby clothes, selling CDs, selling vegetables and running a neighborhood store.

The '20 de Enero' community bank is run by a board of directors which consists of a president, a treasurer and a secretary, who are in charge of guiding their fellow group members through this loan cycle.

The bank's president, Lidia, was a member of the Villa Tejada regional office for six and a half years.  She is currently joining the '20 de Enero' community bank for their first loan cycle.  Lidia tells us that she and several long-standing members, including Miguelina, decided to form their own group to request a loan.  Their favorite services are the health service and the insurance service.

The president's business is knitting sweaters, selling 'knick knacks' and selling 'mocochinchi' (a dried peach drink) by the glass.  This latter business is one that she has had since she was very young.

Lidia is requesting her loan to buy sugar, 'quisa' (dried peach) and wool.  These will help her in the businesses that she wishes to carry out this season.

loans.use: To buy sugar, 'quisa' (dried peach) and wool

loans.name: Maruja

texts.es:
Maruja es socia del Banco Comunal Brisas, tiene 40 años, es conviviente y tiene 6 hijos. Es feriante, se dedica a la comercialización de cereales, que los compra de los mayoristas del Mercado Nery García Zarate y viaja los viernes quincenalmente al departamento de Ica donde lo vende entre los trabajadores de las haciendas y regresa los domingos.
Maruja solicita un préstamo para invertir en compra de mercardería. A ella le gusta las reuniones de su Banco Comunal porque les enseñan y practican los valores, le dan créditos puede ahorrar y su ahorro gana intereses, le gusta las charlas que reciben para mejorar las relación con los hijos, familia, matrimonio, para trabajar, para valorarse. Maruja está ahorrando para construir sus casa.
texts.en:
Maruja is a member of the "Brisas" [Breezes] Communal Bank. She is 40 years old and has a live-in partner and 6 children. She is a market vendor who sells cereal grains. She buys the grains from wholesalers at the Nery García Zarate Market and travels every other Friday to the Department of Ica, where she sells her goods to the workers on the estates, and then returns on Sundays. 

Maruja is requesting a loan to invest in buying merchandise. She enjoys the meetings of her communal bank, because the group learns and practices values. She can take out loans and save money, and her savings earn interest. She likes the talks given to the group about improving parent-child, family and marital relationships, and about work and self-esteem. Maruja is currently saving up to build a house.

loans.use: Buying goods on a wholesale basis

loans.name: Primavera 2011 Group

texts.es:
“Primavera 2011”, es un grupo ubicado en la comunidad de San Lorenzo del estado Oaxaca, esta población esta habitada por indígenas mixtecos de la zona de la costa, al grupo lo integra un numero de 12 mujeres indígenas y nativas de este poblado, nombrando por líder a la señora Cresenciana B. M..
El nombre que le atribuyeron a su grupo es por una característica propia del lugar, debido a la vegetación y la diversidad de árboles, plantas, aves y animales muy propios de la zona, antes de arribar a la población podemos observar un hermoso río que desde las alturas muestra su majestuosa limpieza en sus corrientes, ofreciendo siempre un paisaje que deja marcadas nuestras pupilas, el esta comunidad la mayoría de la gente se dedica al trabajo en el campo y en el caso de las mujeres se enfocan a la elaboración de artesanías de telar de cintura, una actividad que data de tiempos muy remotos y hasta la actualidad, las tradiciones del pueblo indígena aun la podemos vivir en carne propia con sus majestuosos atuendos y ceremonias que deja mucho de que hablar, captando la atención de toda la gente que la visita.
En esta historia hablaremos de una integrante llamada Ninfa García M. de 40 años de edad, ella esta casada con Eleuterio de 42 años quien es campesino de toda la vida, tiene 3 hijos que son: José Luis de 15 años estudiante de 3ro de secundaria, Raúl de 13 años estudia el 1ro de secundaria y Elizabeth de 10 años estudiante de 5to año de primaria.
Ninfa se dedica a la elaboración de artesanías, ella elabora servilletas, manteles y telar de cintura, la elaboración de estas bellas prendas la aprendió desde los 13 años de edad, cabe mencionar que las niñas de esta comunidad deben de aprender a fabricar este tipo de arte al igual que los quehaceres de la casa como el hacer tortillas, cocinar y cuidar a los niños, para Ninfa esta actividad ha sido la mejo alternativa para apoyar a su esposo e hijos en los gastos necesarios de la casa, al igual que ella la mayoría de las mujeres han optado por dedicarse a este oficio mismo que les ha permitido el aseguramiento de recursos para preservar la educación de sus hijos al igual que permite la conservación de este arte tradicional con las generaciones venideras. 
Ninfa se integro a este grupo de crédito con la finalidad  de obtener un financiamiento para invertir en su actividad, ella con esta dinero va comprar hilo de algodón blanco utilizado para la base de la producción de estos textiles, hilo vela de algodón en diferentes colores, madejas para hilar, estambres para el acabado de las servilletas y manteles, con esta adquisición de material ella garantiza mas producción y mas ventas en su actividad, con las ganancias ella le dará educación a sus hijos, liquidara su crédito y seguirá elaborando estas artesanías.
A Ninfa le gustaría distribuir sus productos en otros lugares diferentes del estado de Oaxaca, ella aspira a mejorar sui calidad de vida, mejorar su vivienda y que sus hijos tengan un futuro mejor y sin carencias.
Deposita sus esperanzas en sus tres hijos que cuando ellos sean personas de bien la puedan ayudar a ella y a su esposo, desea con todo su corazón que sus hijos se preparen profesionalmente para que no tengan que vivir en la pobreza. No olvidemos que la mayoría de las poblaciones indígenas no tienen acceso a los servicios básicos de desarrollo, es un sector abandonado por la sociedad y el trabajo en el campo no garantiza una vida cómoda.
Ninfa invita a las personas que se encuentran alrededor del mundo a sumarse a esta causa justa por los que menos tienen, a kiva le da las gracias por abrirle las puertas de la esperanza, a Fundacion Realidad, por su muestra de compromiso con el sector abandonado y por la confianza que les brinda a las mujeres indígenas.


 “Primavera” esta integrado por 12 mujeres mujeres indígenas y   enseguida se dan los nombres de cada una de ellas, así como las actividades que realizan para la obtención de recursos.

Demetria B. M..-Venta de medicamentos 
Dolores M..- artesana
Aurelia M. Galván.-Venta de antojitos 
Enedina Hernández S..- Venta de ropa
Artemia Hernández López.-  Venta de pollo
Antonina M. Vásquez.- Venta de pollo
Ninfa García Mejía.- Artesana
Cresenciana B. M..- Venta de antojitos
Josefina B. M..- Abarrotes
Esperanza B. Martínez.- Venta de ropa
Carmela López C..-Venta de pollo
Guadalupe B. Nicolás.-Artesana
texts.en:
"Primeravera 2011" (Spring 2011) is a group located in the community of San Lorenzo in the state of Oaxaca.  The town is inhabited by Mixtec indians from the coastal area.  The group is made up of 12 native indians from this town and Mrs. Cresenciana B. M. is their leader.

The name given to the group is due to the characteristics of the diversity of the vegetation, trees, plants, birds and animals that are autoctonus to the area.  Before we reach the town we can see a beautiful river that flows majectically in a clean stream.  The landscape always catches our attention.  The people here work mainly in agriculture.  Women usually focus on weaving belts which is a craft that comes from long ago.  The traditions of the local indian folk are still very much alive and we are able to witness first hand the majestic attire and ceremonies that capture the attention of everyone visiting the area. 

In this narrative we will talk about a member named Ninfa García Mejía who is 40 years old, married to Eleuterio who is 42 years old and has been a field worker all his life.  They have three children: José Luis who is 15 and in his third year of secondary school, Raúl who is 13 and in his first year of secondary school and Elizabeth who is 10 years old and in 5th grade.

Ninfa has been making artisan crafts, napkins, tablecloths, and waistbands since she was 13 years old.  The girls in the community always learn this type of art just as they learn how to make tortillas, cook and take care of children.  For Ninfa this activity has been the best alternative she's had to help her husband and children with household expenses.  Just like her, most women do this to provide an education for their children and also maintain the traditional artform that has been handed down for generations. 

Ninfa joined this group to get financing for her business.  She plans to use the loan to buy while cotton thread, which she uses as the basis for her textile products, different colored cotton yarn, and spun woolen thread to finish the tablecloths and napkins.  With this purchase she will be able to guarantee production and more sales.  She will use the income to cover education costs for her children, pay back the loan and continue making her crafts.

Ninfa would like to sell her products in other locations in the state of Oaxaca.  She wants to improve her lifestyle and her home so her children will have better prospects in the future.

She places her hopes on her three children so that when they grow into responsible people they will help her and her husband.  She wants her children to be professionals so they won't have to live in poverty.  We musn't forget that the indigenous populations do not have access to basic services for development.  It is a sector of society that has been abandoned.  Working the fields does not guarantee a comfortable lifestyle.  Ninfa invites people around the world to join the just cause for those who have less.  She thanks Kiva for opening the door to hope and the Fundación Realidad for showing its committment to this abandoned sector, also for the confidence shown in their indigenous women.

"Primavera" is made up of 12 indigenous women.  Below we have listed their names and occupations.

Demetria B. M..- Medicine sales
Dolores M..- Crafts
Aurelia M. Galván.- Snack food sales
Enedina Hernández S..- Clothing sales
Artemia Hernández López.-  Poultry sales
Antonina M. Vásquez.- Poultry sales
Ninfa García Mejía.- Crafts
Cresenciana B. M..- Snack food sales
Josefina B. M..- Groceries
Esperanza B. Martínez.- Clothing sales
Carmela López C..- Poultry sales
Guadalupe B. Nicolás.- Crafts

loans.use: To buy white cotton thread, colored yarn, colored spun woolen thread

loans.name: Ilberta

texts.es:
Ilberta es socia del Banco Comunal Brisas, tiene 36 años, es conviviente y tiene 3 hijos.
Se dedica a la venta de quesos y gallinas. Ilberta, viaja Lima quincenalmente y lo vende casa por casa, compra gallinas por jabas y los trae a Ayacucho y los vende ene el mercado 12 de Abril. Solicita un préstamo para invertir en la compra de gallinas.
Ilberta ingreso a Finca por la invitación de una amiga, le gusta por las facilidades que le dan en los créditos y porque puede ahorrar, sueño es construir su casa y poder educar a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Ilberta is a member of the Brisas communal bank.  She is 36 years old and has a live-in partner and three children.

She sells cheese and hens.  Ilberta travels to Lima every two weeks and sells door-to-door.  She buy hens in crates and brings them to Ayacucho where she sells them at the "12 de Abril" market.

She is requesting a loan to buy hens.  Ilberta became a member of the bank through an invitation from a friend.  She is grateful for the credit terms she gets, allowing her to save and some day build a house and educate her children.

loans.use: To buy hens and cheese

loans.name: Alicia

texts.es:
Alicia es socia del Banco Comunal Brisas, tiene 48 años, es casada y tiene 3 hijos. Tiene una tienda D. abarrotes en general. El préstamo que solicita lo invertirá en la compra D. mercaderías para su negocio como: arroz, azúcar, fideos, harina, leche, aguas gaseosas, harina, etc.
Esta en Finca hace 2 años, ingreso por la invitación D. una amiga, le gusta por lo ordenados que son, por las facilidades en los créditos y por los ahorros.
texts.en:
Alicia is a member of the Brisas communal bank.  She is 48 years old and married, with three children.  She has a general grocery store.  

She is requesting a loan to buy goods for her business such as rice, sugar, pasta, flour, milk, softdrinks, etc.  She has been in the group for two years.  She was invited to join by a friend.  She likes the fact that the group is so organized and gives her good credit terms so she can save.

loans.use: To buy rice, sugar and pasta

loans.name: Francisca

texts.es: Francisca C. G. es una mujer muy emprendedora, desde hace 10 años hace se dedica a la costura en el cual ya tiene mucha experiencia. Los trabajos que realiza los hace sobre pedido y talla; como los son vestidos, disfraces, pantalones, vastillas y mas. La señora en este momento requiere un préstamo para comprar telas, hilos y agujas para ofrecer a sus clientes diversidad de colores.
texts.en:
Francisca C. G. is a very hard-working woman.  She has been a seamstress for 10 years and has gained much expertise.  She takes orders for dresses, costumes, pants and alterations.

Francisca plans to use the loan to buy fabric, thread and needles so she can offer her customers a wide range of colors.

loans.use: To buy material for her business

loans.name: Artesanos Group

texts.es: El Banco Comunal Artesanos inicia su decimo ciclo con 14 socias. Flora es la Presidenta del Bancomunal Artesanos, es casada, tiene 62 años y 5 hijos. Se dedica a la venta D. ganados en la feria D. Toro Wichccana y éste oficio lo aprendió desD. niña D. sus padres. El préstamo que solicita lo invertirá en la compra D. ganados. Su sueño es poder ahorrar para tener más capital, para incrementar su negocio.
texts.en:
The "Artesanos" communal bank is in its tenth year with 14 members.  Flora is the president of the bank.  She is 62 years old and married with five children.  She sells livestock at the Toro Wichccana market.  She learned this livelihood as a child from her parents.

She plans to use the loan to buy more livestock.  Her dream is to save enough to be able to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy livestock

loans.name: Maritza Geoconda

texts.es:
En la ciudadela Los Bosques  de la ciudad de Portoviejo, ciudad de verdes  montañas y paisajes  encantadores, conocida desde hace muchos años como la Ciudad Del Valle  encontramos el lugar donde se reúnen cada quince días las socias del Banco Comunal Emprendedora de los Bosques.

Aquí conocimos a Maritza, ella es madre soltera de un hijo de 5  años de edad que este año empieza a  estudiar en escuela. Ella vive en casa de sus padres. Lleva en el Banco Comunal desde el inicio hace ya seis  ciclos y le gusta por las facilidades que brinda la Fundación Espoir para conseguir los créditos.

Se dedica a la venta de ropa de todo tipo y de artefactos para el hogar como: licuadoras, tostadoras, planchas entre otras cosas y su forma de  venta es puerta a puerta, además también vende en su  casa donde tiene un pequeño local. Trabaja de lunes a sábado ya que el domingo se lo dedica a su pequeño hijo, deja a crédito a sus clientes  y cobra cada quince días. Lo que es ropa la compra en  Guayaquil y los artefactos los compra en Picoaza cada quince días o una vez al mes de acuerdo a lo que necesite.

Este crédito es para comprar, pantalones, blusas, planchas, licuadoras entre otras cosas. Sus sueños son tener un local comercial en el centro de la ciudad.
texts.en:
In the neighborhood of Los Bosques in the city of Portoviejo -- a city of green hills and enchanting landscapes, known for many years as the "City of the Valley" -- we find the place where the members of the "Enterprising Communal Bank of the Forests" meet every two weeks. 

Here we meet Maritza, the single mother of a 5-year-old son who is starting school this year. She lives in her parents' house. She has been part of the communal bank since its initiation, six loan cycles ago, and she likes it because of the favorable terms offered by the Espoir Foundation for obtaining loans. 

Her work is selling clothing of all types as well as household articles such as blenders, toasters and irons, among other items. She sells her merchandise door to door as well as from her home, where she has a small shop. She works Monday through Saturday, since she dedicates Sunday to her young son. She provides goods on credit to her customers and collects payments every two weeks. She buys the clothing she sells in Guayaquil and the household goods in Picoaza, every two weeks or once a month, according to her needs.

This loan is to buy pants, blouses, irons and blenders, among other goods. Her dream is to have a store in the city center.

loans.use: Buying pants, blouses, irons, blenders, etc.

loans.name: Lidia

texts.es: Lidia, de 32 años, vive en su casa que es propia al lado de su esposo German de 32 años que es profesor y de su pequeña hija. En la actualidad esta emprendedora mujer posee una librería, negocio que le genera ganancias debido a que se encuentra ubicada cerca a un colegio. Durante todo este tiempo, pudo ahorrar suficiente capital, así pudo lograr comprar una fotocopiadora y ahora realiza este servicio de fotocopiado de documentos. Se siente muy satisfecha con el negocio que tiene ya que obtiene regulares ganancias de las ventas. Hoy ha invertido en otra librería, en donde un empleado que contrato lo esta ayudando en la atención de los clientes. Manifiesta que no puede salir mucho por no descuidar ambos negocios, y como es una mujer trabajadora tiene planeado mejorar las instalaciones de ambos negocios para ofrecer un mejor servicio a sus clientes. Es el segundo crédito que tiene con MFP y promete pagar sus cuotas puntualmente, pues no quiere quedar mal con las personas que hicieron posible el dinero que le permitirá continuar trabajando en busca del progreso. Lidia tiene planeado invertir el crédito solicitado en la compra de cuadernos, papelería en general además de útiles escolares que necesita para surtir mejor ambos negocios, y ofrecer variedad a sus compradores.
texts.en: Lidia, 32, lives in a house she owns along with her husband German, also 32 and a teacher, and her small daughter. Currently, this entrepreneurial woman owns a bookstore, a business that is profitable because it is near a school. She was able to save enough to purchase a photocopier and now she provides copying services. Lidia feels very satisfied with her business as she can receive steady income from her sales. She has invested in another bookstore where an employee she hired helps her serve customers. She mentions that she cannot go out much because she does not want to neglect her businesses and since she is an entrepreneurial woman she wants to improve upon the facilities to offer a better service to her clients. This is her second loan with MFP. She promises to make her payments on time because she does not want to let down those who are helping her get ahead. Lidia plans to invest the money received in the purchase of notebooks, stationary, as well as school supplies that are needed to increase her merchandise and offer variety to her customers.

loans.use: Purchase stationary and notebooks.

loans.name: Dolores Paulina

texts.es:
En la ciudadela Los Bosques  de la ciudad de Portoviejo, ciudad hermosa de verdes  montañas y paisajes  encantadores, conocida desde hace muchos años como la Ciudad Del Valle  encontramos el lugar donde se reúnen cada quince días las socias del Banco Comunal Emprendedora de los Bosques.

Aquí conocimos a la señora Dolores, ella tiene 57 años de edad y hace varios años su compañero de toda su vida falleció y quedo sola con sus tres hijos que ya en la actualidad son mayores de edad. Su hija menor vive con ella. Hace poco trabajó como empleada publica pero hace un tiempo atrás dejo de laborar en este campo y  se dedicó al comercio.
 
Se dedica a la venta de ropa de todo tipo, su forma de  ventas es puerta a puerta y  también entrega en su casa lugar hasta donde sus clientes se acercan cuando llega mercadería nueva, su hija le ayuda en su negocio. Trabaja todos los días en las tardes, deja  a crédito a sus clientes  y cobra cada quince días. Su mercadería  la va a comprar  cada quince días a  Guayaquil. Dice que lleva varios años que se dedica a esta actividad.

Este crédito es para comprar  ropa más que todo ropa de mujer, pantalones, blusas, camisetas, entre otras prendas. Este es el cuarto ciclo  en el Banco Comunal  y le gusta por los beneficios adicionales que le brinda la institución. Sus sueños son tener una boutique.
texts.en:
In the citadel of Los Bosques in the city of Portoviejo, a beautiful city with green mountains and enchanting landscapes known for many years as the City of the Valley, we find the place where every 2 weeks the members of the Emprendedora de los Bosques Communal Bank meet.

Here we meet Mrs. Dolores, she is 57 years old and a few years ago her lifelong partner passed away and she was left alone with her three children who at present are adults. Her youngest daughter lives with her. A while ago she worked as a public worker but she left the field and began working in sales.

Mrs. Dolores works selling all types of clothing, she does her sales door to door and in her home where her customers go when there is new merchandize. Her daughter also helps her maintain the business. Mrs. Dolores works everyday in the evenings; she sells on credit to her customers and collects every two weeks. Mrs. Dolores buys her merchandize in Guayaquil every fifteen days.

This loan is to buy more clothing, mostly women’s, as well as pants, blouses, shirts, and other items. This is her fourth loan in the Communal Bank and she likes it because of the extra benefits that the institution gives her. Mrs. Dolores’ dream is to have a boutique.

loans.use: To buy pants, blouses, shirts and women’s clothing in general.

loans.name: Alicia

texts.es: Alicia, de 54 años, vive en su casa que es propia al lado de su pareja Osvaldo de 55 años y de sus dos 2 jóvenes hijos; juntos se esfuerzan cada día por salir adelante. Esta emprendedora mujer se dedica a la venta de comestibles y útiles de escritorio en una tienda que habilitó en una pieza de su casa. Esta muy satisfecha pues sus vecinos prefieren comprarle pues su trato es muy amable y ofrece sus productos  a buenos precios, además las ganancias que obtiene son buenas y puede apoyar a su pareja en los gastos del hogar. Lo que no le gusta es que debe permanecer bastante tiempo en su casa para no descuidar el negocio, aunque hay veces que sus familiares la apoyan en la atención hacia los clientes. Para el futuro tiene planeado mejorar las instalaciones de su local, pues quiere ofrecer un mejor servicio a sus compradores. Es el séptimo crédito que tiene con MFP y promete pagar sus cuotas puntualmente, pues no quiere quedar mal con las personas que hicieron posible este aporte que le permitirá continuar trabajando en busca del progreso. Alicia tiene planeado invertir el crédito solicitado en la compra de cantidad de mercadería en productos comestibles, así como útiles pues esta cercana la campaña escolar y quiere cumplir con la mayoría de los pedidos de sus clientes.
texts.en: Alicia is 54 years old; she lives in her own home with her partner, Osvaldo, who is 55 years old and their two young children. Each day they work hard to get ahead in life. This enterprising woman works selling foodstuffs and office supplies in a store that she made out a room in her home. Alicia is very happy since her neighbors prefer to buy from her since she treats her customers with kindness and she offers her products at good prices. What she does not like is that she has to spend a lot of time at home so as to not neglect her business although sometimes her family helps her take care of the customers. For the future she wants to improve her store as she wants to give better service to her customers. This is her seventh loan with MFP (Kiva’s field partner) Alicia promises to pay her loan quotas on time since she doesn’t want to deceive the people who have made possible this loan that will allow her to continue working toward her progress. Alicia has planned to use the loan to buy various grocery products as well as office supplies since school time is approaching and she wants to meet the majority of her customers’ needs.

loans.use: To buy various products and school supplies.

loans.name: Pedro

texts.es: El señor Pedro vive en una comunidad muy distante del Torno se llama la Planchada a 38 km del Torno donde tiene su tierra el trabaja con su esposa y sus 5 hijos en la agricultura se dedican a la siembra de maíz, papa, yuca y maní. Ellos viven en esa comunidad hace bastante tiempo también se dedican a la ganadería  donde tienen 30 cabezas de ganado de ahí tienen leche para vender, a una fabrica de leche, el dinero del crédito lo utilizaran en la compra de semillas para la siembra de papa y maíz y también para el preparado de la tierra, todos los productos que siembran lo comercializan en el mercado de el Torno, con la ayuda de sus hijos, el Sr, pedro es un hombre trabajador  y esta agradecido con la institución por el apoyo brindado.  En la foto el sr Pedro esta acompañado de su Hijo Mayor.
texts.en: Mr. Pedro lives in a community very far away from Torno called Planchada some 38 km from Torno where he has his land and works with his wife and 5 children in agriculture. They work growing corn, potatoes, yucca and peanuts. They have lived in the community for a long time; they also have 30 cattle where they get milk to sell to a factory. The money from the loan will be used to buy seeds for their potato and corn crops and to prepare the soil. All of the products that they grow they sell in the market in Torno with his children’s’ help. Mr. Pedro is a hardworking man and is very thankful to the institution for the support given to him. In the picture, Mr. Pedro is with his eldest son.

loans.use: To buy potato and corn seeds.

loans.name: Marcelina

texts.es: Marcelina, de 60 años, vive en su casa que es propia al lado de su esposo José de 64 años y sus 3 jóvenes hijos; juntos se esfuerzan a diario para salir adelante. Lleva casi 4 años dedicada a la venta de golosinas, gaseosas y productos de primera necesidad en una pieza habilitada de su casa. Empieza su labor a las 7 de la mañana y puede quedarse atendiendo hasta las 9 de la noche, pues dice que mayores son las ganancias mientras más tiempo tenga abierto el negocio; algunas veces cuenta con el apoyo en la atención de sus hijos o de su pareja cuando ella debe salir. Esta muy satisfecha con el negocio pues le permite realizar sus labores del hogar sin problemas, además de ayudar a su esposo en los gastos del hogar. Como es una dama muy emprendedora para el futuro tiene planeado instalar una librería en una parte de su tienda, pues no hay ninguna por la zona donde vive y calcula que tendría mucho éxito. Es el séptimo crédito que tiene con MFP y promete pagar sus cuotas puntualmente, pues no quiere quedar mal con las personas que hicieron posible el dinero que le permitirá continuar adelante con su negocio. Marcelina tiene planeado invertir el crédito solicitado en la compra de alimentos que necesita para surtir bien su negocio, pues quiere ofrecer lo mejor a sus clientes.
texts.en: Marcelina is 60 years old she lives in her own home with her husband, José who is 64 years old and their 3 young children. They work hard each day to get ahead. For almost 4 years, Marcelina has sold candy, beverages and basic household goods in a room in her home. She begins working from 7 a.m. to 9 p.m. and says that most of her earnings are due to how long the business is open. Sometimes she has help from her children or her partner when she has to go out. Marcelina is very happy with the business since it allows her to do housework without problems and it helps her husband meet the household expenses. Since she is a very enterprising woman concerned about the future, she plans to have a bookshop in her store since there isn’t one in the area where she lives and believes that it will be successful. This is her seventh loan with MFP (Kiva’s field partner) and is committed to meet the payments on time since she doesn’t want to deceive the people who helped her get the money that will allow her to continue successfully with her business. Marcelina plans to use the loan to buy foodstuffs that she needs to stock her business since she wants to offer the best to her customers.

loans.use: To buy various products to stock her store.

loans.name: Donatila Olga Ines

texts.es:
En la ciudadela Los Bosques  de la ciudad de Portoviejo conocida desde hace muchos años como la Ciudad Del Valle  encontramos el lugar donde se reúnen cada quince días las socias del Banco Comunal Emprendedora de los Bosques.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Donatila, ella tiene 47 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tiene tres hijos todos mayores de edad,  con ella vive la menor de sus hijos que está soltera, que trabaja y que este año espera seguir sus estudios universitarios. Su esposo es Ing. Sanitario.

Ella es manicurista y cosmetóloga y, además se dedica al comercio en lo que es venta de ropa y de productos Esika (productos de belleza, cosméticos, perfumería y accesorios para damas). Trabaja todos los  días, ella realiza sus ventas al mismo tiempo que realiza sus trabajos faciales a sus clientas el cual lo hace en casa de los clientes ya que aun no tiene un local. Los  productos que vende los deja a crédito y cobra cada semana o cada quince de acuerdo a lo que quieran sus clientes. Lo que es ropa se la traen desde Panamá o también compra en Guayaquil.

Este crédito es para comprar perfumes, cremas, cosméticos, ropa y materiales para realizar sus trabajos.  Esta en el Banco Comunal desde el inicio  y le gusta porque los intereses son más bajos que los de otras instituciones de crédito. Sus sueños tener un local en su casa.
texts.en:
In the citadel of Los Bosques in the city of Portoviejo, a beautiful city with green mountains and enchanting landscapes known for many years as the City of the Valley, we find the place where every 2 weeks the members of the Emprendedora de los Bosques Communal Bank meet.

In this place we met Mrs. Donatila, she is 47 years old, married and from the relationship she has three children who are grownup. The youngest of her children lives with her since she is single, works and hopes to attend university in this year. Mrs. Donatila's husband is a sanitary engineer.

Mrs. Donatila is a manicurist and a cosmetologist she also sells clothing and Esika products (beauty products, makeup, perfumes, and accessories). She works everyday and sells her items when she is doing facials, work that she does at her customers’ home since she does not have her own place. She sells the products on credit and collects the week after or every two weeks depending on what her customers want. The clothing is brought in from Panama or Guayaquil.

This loan is to buy perfumes, creams, makeup, clothing and materials to do her work. Mrs. Donatila has been in the Communal Bank since the beginning and she enjoys it since the interest is lower than other loan institutions. Her dream is to have a place for her work in her home.

loans.use: To buy perfumes, creams, makeup, clothing and materials for her cosmetology.

loans.name: Cristia Isabel

texts.es: SOLICITANTE TIENE 38 AÑOS ES CONVIVIENTE VIVE EN CASA ALQUILADA SE DEDICA A LA VENTA DE COMIDA HACE AÑO Y MEDIO EN LOCAL ALQUILADO ADJUNTA EL CONTRATO DE ALQUILER CONYUGE ES DOCENTE PERO NO EJERCE REALIZA LABORES DE TIPEOS NO S ELE A CONSIDERADO DICHO INGRESO, CUENTAN CON BUENAS REFERENCIAS NO CUENTAN CON EXPERIENCIA CREDITICIA SOLICITAN CREDITO PARA INVERTIRLO EN CAPITAL DE TRABAJO, TIENEN REGULAR ACUMULACION DE BIENES, FIRMAN COMO AVALES SU PADRES QUIENES TAMBIEN SE DEDICAN ALA VENTA DE COMIDA Y PADRE ES VIGILANTE EN AGROKASA HACE 5 AÑOS,  SON CLIENTES DE LA CMAC ICA CON BUEN COMPORTAMIENTO DE PAGO SE LE PROPONE CREDITO POR CONTAR CON VOLUNTAD YCAPACIDAD DE PAGO.
texts.en:
Cristia is 38 years old and lives with her partner in a rented house. She has been selling meals for about 1 ½ years in a rented space. In addition to this rental contract, her husband is a teacher but he doesn't exercise the profession. We haven't considered his income.

Cristia has good references but has no credit experience. She requests a loan to invest in her business. She has a regular accumulation of possessions. Her parents, who also run a restaurant business, have signed guarantees for her. The father has also worked for 5 years as a security guard at Agrokasa. They are clients of CMAC at Ica with a good record of repayment.

It is proposed to grant her loan based on her will and capacity to pay.

loans.use: TO INVEST IN HER RESTAURANT BUSINESS

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase merchandise.

loans.name: Melania

texts.es: La señora Melania esta casada con don Placido con 4 hijos, ella es nacida en VallegranD. hace 35 años que viven en la forestal a 10 km del Torno donD.  tienen su tierra,  trabaja en la agricultura junto a su hijos quienes le ayudan en la siembra maíz, poroto y papa pero también  se dedican a la plantación D. cítrico y ganadería, son una familia muy unida el dinero del crédito lo utilizaran en la compra D. semillas para la siembra D. papa y maíz y también para el preparado D. la tierra, todos los productos que siembran lo comercializan en el mercado D. el Torno, la Sra. Melania es una persona trabajadora y esta agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en: Mrs. Melania is married to don Placido, they have 4 children. She was born in VallegranD. 35 years ago and currently lives in the forestal 10km from Torno where they have their land. She works in agriculture with her children who help her sow corn, poroto (kidney beans), and potatoes they also grow citric fruits and cattle raise. They are a very united family and with the loan they will buy seeds for the potato and corn crops also to prepare the land. All the products that they farm they sell in the Torno market. Mrs. Melania is a hardworking person and is very grateful with the institution for the support given to her.

loans.use: For potato and poroto (kidney beans) crops.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To purchase merchandise for resale.

loans.name: Sergio Richart

texts.es: El señor Sergio Richart H. Ramírez se dedica a la actividad de chofer de taxi ya que anteriormente trabajaba en una empresa de seguridad Prosegur en custodia de valores, ahorró su dinero y se compró dos unidades de transporte la cual se encuentran laborando en la ciudad de Ica . Está solicitando el crédito para realizar cambios a los autos. Se propone otorgarle el crédito por que tiene buena capacidad de pago y presenta buenas referencias personales y laborales.
texts.en: Mr. Sergio Richart H. Ramírez is a taxi driver, before he used to work in a security company, Prosegur, as a security guard. He saved his money and bought two cars which are working in the city of Ica. He is asking for the loan to make some repairs on the cars. It is thought that he should be given the loan because he has good probabilities to repay the loan and has good personal and work references.

loans.use: Work Capital.

loans.name: Raúl

texts.es: El señor Raúl C. es padre de familia de 3 pequeños por cuales sale adelante para ofrecerles mejor calidad de vida y estabilidad económica. Raúl por las mañanas sale a trabajar a la  maquiladora como operador para traer dinero a su casa, también para ayudarse le puso un negocio a su esposa denominado “Estanquillo Lupita”  al que en este momento quiere invertir en mercancía para tenerlo mas variedad en producto y así generar prosperidad económica familiar.
texts.en: Raul C. is a father of 3 little ones and for whom he works to provide a better quality of life and greater financials stability. Raul sets off to work in the mornings to a manufacturing plant to work as an operator to earn an income for the household. IN order to establish another source of income he set up a business for his wife, named "Estanquillo Lupita". He wants to invest in the purchase of some merchandise to add to the variety of products and to add to the family's finances.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Jorge

texts.es: Jorge, de 39 años, vive en su casa que es propia al lado de su esposa  Benedicta de 38 años y sus 2 pequeñas hijas; juntos se esfuerzan cada día por salir adelante. Desde muy joven este empeñoso hombre se dedica a la construcción, primero empezó como obrero, y en la actualidad se desempeña como maestro de obra para una empresa de lunes a sábado durante todo el día. Manifiesta que le gusta mucho su labor pues la empresa para la que trabaja puede llevarlo de viaje a diversas partes del Perú , y se siente satisfecho al culminar una gran obra junto al resto de sus compañeros, además le genera regulares ganancias que le permiten brindarle a su familia una buena calidad de vida. Tiene muchos planes para el futuro como el de instalar una tienda de comestibles en cu casa pues la atendería su esposa y sus hijas. Es el primer crédito que tiene con MFP y promete pagar sus cuotas puntualmente, pues no quiere quedar mal con las personas que hicieron posible el dinero que le permitirá continuar trabajando en busca del progreso. Jorge tiene planeado invertir el crédito solicitado en la compra de materiales de construcción (cemento, ladrillos, arena y fierros) que necesita para terminar de ampliar su vivienda, así espera seguir adelante.
texts.en: Jorge, 39-years-old, lives in his own home with his wife, Benedicta (38-years-old), and their two young daughters. Together they strive everyday to come out ahead. Since a young age Jorge has worked hard in the construction business. He started out as a laborer and he now works as a construction manager for a company from Monday through Saturday, all day. He says that he likes his work because his company sends him to different parts of Perú, and he feels satisfied when he finishes a big project working alongside his colleagues. This job also generates a regular income which allows him to offer his family a good quality of life. He has many plans for the future, such as installing a general store in his house that his wife and daughters would run. This is his first loan with MFP and he promises to make his payments on time because he doesn't want to upset the people who make it possible for him to keep progressing. Jorge plans to invest the loan in the purchase of construction materials (cement, bricks, sand, and metal) that he needs to finish expanding his home. With these renovations he hopes to keep moving ahead.

loans.use: Purchase of construction materials to expand his home

loans.name: Mercedes Obdulia

texts.es:
En la ciudadela Los Bosques  de la ciudad de Portoviejo, ciudad hermosa de verdes  montañas y paisajes  encantadores, conocida desde hace muchos años como la Ciudad Del Valle  encontramos el lugar donde se reúnen cada quince días las socias del Banco Comunal Emprendedora de los Bosques.

La señora Mercedes es socia fundadora del Banco comunal, le gusta por los beneficios adicionales que brinda la institución y por las facilidades para los créditos. Tiene 54 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tiene tres hijos los cuales ya son mayores de edad pero dos aun viven con ella. Su esposo es Abogado. Ella estudio y obtuvo el título de Ing. Comercial.

Se dedica al comercio, vende productos industriales como por ejemplo purificadores de agua, tiene un local en donde funciona su negocio. Hace algún tiempo atrás tenía unas cabinas telefónicas pero tuvo que cerrar por motivos de viaje pero que con este nuevo crédito espera poder volver a abrir, también espera vender teléfonos, accesorios de teléfonos, recargas y tarjetas telefónicas entre otras cosas.

Este crédito es para comprar tarjetas, recargas telefónicas, en si para adecuar sus cabinas. Sus metas son seguir trabajando y mejorando dia a dia.
texts.en:
In the neighborhood of Los Bosques in the beautiful city of Portoviejo--known for its green mountains and charming landscapes, and at one time called The City of the Valley--we find the place where, every 15 days, the members of the Emprendedora de los Bosques communal bank meet. 

Mercedes is a founding member of this communal bank. She likes it for the benefits it provides and because it facilitates loans. She's 54-years-old, married, and has three children who are grown; two of them still live at home. Her husband is a lawyer. She studied and earned a degree in commercial administration/management.

She works as a merchant, selling industrial products such as water purifiers. She has her own shop where she runs her business. A while ago she had some telephone booths but she had to close them for travel. With this loan she hopes to open them again and she also hopes to start selling telephones and telephone accessories, such as phone cards and phone credit. 

This loan is to buy phone cards and phone credit for her phone booths. Her goal is to continue working and improve everyday.

loans.use: Purchase of phone cards and phone accessories for her phone booths

loans.name: Julia

texts.es:
La Senora Julia C., es originaria de la Comarca El Chilincocal, del Departamento de Esteli, de 49 anos de edad, Madre soltera con 3 hijos.
Inicio en este tipo de negocio con su familia, para iniciar su hermano le presto un terrenopara que pudiera sembrar en ella; ya que el emigro hacia el hermano pais de Costa Rica. Tiene mas de 15 anos de experiencia; antes de que su hermano le prestara ese terreno ella sobrevivia haciendo dulce, Elotes Cocidos, Sopa de Mondongo.
Actualmente tambien se dedica a la crianza de Gallinas y al engorde de Cerdos; parte de sus ingresos provienen de Costa Rica, pues uno de sus hijos esta alla viviendo.
Ella actualmente tambien se dedica a la compra / venta de granos basicos, por lo que utilizara este credito para comprar mas inventario sobre todo de Maiz.
Su meta es lograr vender abarrotes y seguir con la compra/venta de granos basicos.
texts.en:
Julia C. is from El Chilincocal region, in Esteli department.  She is 49 years old, a single mother, and has 3 children.

Julia started out in this line of business with her family as her brother emigrated to the neighboring country of Costa Rica and lent her a plot of land so that she could plant on it.  Julia has more than 15 years of experience.  Before her brother lent her the plot of land, she survived making sweet pastries, cooked corn and tripe soup.  She also currently raises hens and fattens pigs.  Part of her income comes from Costa Rica since one of her children is living there.  In addition, Julia currently buys and sells basic grains and she will use this loan to buy more inventory, above all corn.  Her goal is to manage to sell groceries as well and to continue buying and selling basic grains.

loans.use: To sow basic grains

loans.name: Rafael

texts.es: Rafael, de 32 años, vive en su casa propia solo, pues aun continua soltero en busca de un futuro mejor.  Desde muy joven este trabajador hombre se dedica a la construcción, algunas veces trabaja con su hermano en los proyectos de la empresa para la que trabaja, aunque la mayoría de veces realiza trabajos de construcción independientes. Manifiesta que como aún no tiene familia puede laborar por temporadas en diversos trabajos, además paralelamente se desempeña como fabricante de ladrillos (hornero), en una pieza de su vivienda donde tiene su taller y le gusta mucho esta labor pues es algo difícil pero brinda regulares ganancias. Además tiene muchos planes para el futuro como el de instalar un hotel, pues sabe que este negocio genera buenas rentas. Es el primer crédito que tiene con MFP y promete pagar puntualmente sus cuotas, pues no quiere quedar mal con las personas que hicieron posible el dinero que le permitirá continuar trabajando en busca del progreso. Rafael tiene planeado invertir el crédito solicitado en la compra de materiales de construcción(como cemento, arena y fierros) que necesita para terminar de construir el segundo piso de su casa, de esta manera espera salir adelante.
texts.en:
Rafael is 32 years old and lives alone in his own home.  He is still single and searching for a better future.  This hard-working man has been working in the building trade since he was very young.  Sometimes he works on projects with his brother for the company he works for, although most often he does independent building jobs.  He says that as he still doesn't have a family he is able to work for seasons on different jobs.  In parallel with this work, he also manufactures bricks (he bakes them) in a room in his home where he has his workshop.  He really likes this work.  Although it is quite hard work, it provides regular income. 

Rafael has many plans for the future such as setting up a hotel as he knows that this business makes good profits.  This is his first loan with MFP and he pledges to make his repayments on time since he doesn't want to let down the people who made the loan possible as it will allow him to continue working in search of progress.  Rafael plans to invest his loan money in buying building supplies (such as cement, sand and iron) that he needs to finish building the second floor of his house.  In this way, he hopes to get ahead.

loans.use: To buy building supplies to finish off the second floor of his house

loans.name: William

texts.es: cliente tiene 24 años labora como chofer de omnibus y volvos , tanto de transporte de personal en su mayoria de veces pero tambien transporta carga pesada, segun referencias si labora esta firmando con el dueño de la empresa, es soltero sin carga familiar y vive en casa de sus padres, posee acumulacion de bienes que los ha adquirido al contado, no tiene endeudamiento y solicita credito para gastos personales.
texts.en: William is 24-years-old. He works as a driver, usually in personal transportation but he also sometimes transports heavy loads. According to references, if he works he's employed with the owner of the company. He's single and lives in his parents' house. He owns some goods that he paid for in cash. He has no debts and he's requesting this loan for personal expenses.

loans.use: Personal expenses

loans.name: Mauricio

texts.es: El señor Mauricio tiene 18 años de edad vive en la casa de su cuñado con su mama y hermana, viajo a Brasil cuando tenia 15 ahí trabajo como costurero y vio que se gana bien trabajo un año allá y retorno a Bolivia se compro dos maquinas de coser y empezó a confeccionar guantes de cuero que le entregan cortados el los arma y vende en Oruro y otros lugares  le va bien en el negocio, solicito el crédito para poder comprar una maquina de coser y guantes cortados de cuero para aumentar  su productividad y mejorar su estilo de vida, es un joven emprendedor con ganas de superación, esta agradecido con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
Mauricio is 18 years old and lives in his brother-in-law's house together with his mom and sister.

Mauricio traveled to Brazil when he was 15 years old and worked there as a garment worker.  He saw that the business pays well.  He worked in Brazil for one year and then returned to Bolivia where he bought two sewing machines and started making leather gloves.  He is delivered the pre-cut materials which he then stitches and sells in Oruro and other places.  His business is doing well and he is requesting this loan so that he can buy a sewing machine and pre-cut leather gloves so that he can increase his productivity and improve his lifestyle.

Mauricio is an enterprising young man who has a desire to improve himself.  He is grateful to the institution for the support they have offered him.

loans.use: To buy a sewing machine and leather gloves

loans.name: Jesús

texts.es: Jesús D. L. R. es un hombre muy emprendedor, hace tiempo dejo D. trabajar en maquiladora para poner su propio negocio denominado “Distribuidora Garinos” que consiste en surtir a negocio D. abarrotes mercancía como lo son: los blanquillos, detergentes, tortillas D. maíz y harina, harinas, sal a precio D. mayoreo para que el comprador le salga mas económico. Jesús en este momento quiere invertir mas este negocio que es su fuente D. ingreso para mantener los gastos del hogar.
texts.en: Jesús D. L. R. is a very enterprising man.  Some time ago, he stopped working in a cross-border assembly plant in order to set up his own business called 'Distribuidora Garinos'.  He stocks grocery businesses with merchandise such as eggs, detergents, corn and flour tortillas and salt, at wholesale prices so that the buyer can make their purchases more cheaply.  Jesús would currently like to invest more in this business.  It is his source of income and allows him to cover his household expenses.

loans.use: To stock his business

loans.name: Bayardo

texts.es: El señor Bayardo E. trabaja en MATECSA tiene 6 años de laborar es conductor, casado tiene 6 personas a su cargo y ha trabajado 3 créditos de mejoras de vivienda, el ultimo lo necesita para compra de materiales de construcción tales como hierro, bloque , cemento, para hacer su servicio higiénico.
texts.en: Mr. Bayardo E. works at MATECSA. He has been a driver for 6 years. He is married and supports 6 people. He has taken out 3 loans for home improvement. He needs the latest one to buy construction materials such as iron, blocks, and cement to make a bathroom.

loans.use: Home improvement, purchase of cement and iron.

loans.name: Wilson Alexander

texts.es: Wilson tiene 19 años de edad , es soltero, estudiante  de diversificado, además  de  crecer profesionalmente se dedica  a ser  costurero y agente de ventas, es una persona responsable y comenzó su negocio gracias al apoyo y animo de su madre , el esta solicitando un su primer crédito en asociación ASDIR  para incrementar su negocio asi mismo su capital de trabajo, cuenta con una experiencia amplia de 3 años, por su trabajo es muy reconocido y recomendado ya que es un experto en tejidos y elaboración de blusas.
texts.en: Wilson is 19 years old, single, and a high school student.  As well as growing professionally, he also works as a tailor and sales agent.  He is a responsible person who started his business with his mother's support and encouragement.  He is requesting his first loan from ASDIR in order to increase his business and working capital.  He has three years experience and is very well known and recommended for his work since he is an expert weaver and blouse maker.

loans.use: To buy raw materials for making clothes

loans.name: Anahi

texts.es: Anahi G. D. L. Rosa y su esposo son una pareja muy joven que ya cuentan con una hija pequeña por quien salen adelante para ofrecerle una mejor calidad D. vida y mejor patrimonio. Anahi adquirió su vivienda D. interés social pero en L. parte D. enfrente necesita realizar L. construcción D. una barda para brindar mayor protección a su familia.
texts.en: Anahi G. D. L. Rosa and her husband are a very young couple who have a young daughter.  They get ahead in life so that they can offer her a better quality of life and a better patrimony.  Anahi acquired her home through social housing.  However, she needs to build a wall in front of the house to better protect her family.

loans.use: To build a wall in front of her home

loans.name: Gloria Micaela

texts.es: Gloria tiene 32 años de edad, es casada originaria del departamento de Totonicapán, es madre de un hijo , ella es una mujer muy trabajadora, es tejedora ,  en la actividad tiene 5 años de experiencia aproximadamente,  ella solicita su primer préstamo para incrementar su capital de trabajo, mejorar sus tejidos para que su negocio sea mayor,  y así poder brindarle una mejor ayuda a su familia.
texts.en: Gloria is 32 years old, married, and originally from the department of Totonicapan. She is the mother of one boy. She is a very hard working woman. She knits for a living and she has approximately 5 years' experience in the business. She is requesting her first loan and it will be used to supplement her working capital.  She will improve her crafts and improve her business in order to provide better support to her family.

loans.use: To purchase knitting supplies

loans.name: Angel

texts.es: Ángel A. López tiene un negocio de abarrotes y Snake  llamado “Angel” con una antigüedad de 3 años donde ofrece Botanas, dulces, refrescos, latería, abarrotes, tortas nachos y burritos. En este momento el recurre a esta institución para que se le apoye en  dinero para poder surtir su negocio y así seguir ofreciendo mas calidad a su clientes.
texts.en: Angel A. L. has had a convenience store named "Angel" for the past 3 years. He sells snacks, sweets, soft drinks, milk products, general groceries, hamburgers, nachos, and burritos.  He has approached the organization for financial support in order to supply his business and to provide his clients with quality service.

loans.use: To add inventory to his business.

loans.name: Edin Eduardo

texts.es: Edin es un joven de 21 años de edad, originario de Totonicapán , es soltero,  estudiante de diversificado, además de seguir creciendo profesionalmente ejerce el trabajo de albañil y así también se dedica al comercio, el esta solicitando un tercer préstamo en Asociación ASDIR ya que desea seguir invirtiendo su dinero en compra de herramientas, sus creditos anteriores los ha cancelado sin problemas de atraso, es una persona responsable y cumplida el cuenta  con el apoyo de su familia ya que tiene  10 años de experiencia  y desea seguir incrementado su negocio y asi poder cumplir sus metas.
texts.en: Edin is a young man, 21 years of age, originally from Totonicapan. He is single and he is a student taking many subjects. He also endeavors to keep growing professionally as a construction working and as a merchant. He requests his third loan from Asociacion ASDIR (Kiva Field Partner) in order to invest in the purchase of tools. His previous loans were successfully repaid. He is a responsible and committed individual and he has the support of his family. He has 10 years’ experience in the field and he wishes to keep increasing his business and to reach his goals.

loans.use: To purchase tools.

loans.name: Armando Antonio

texts.es: El señor Armando Antonio D. es casado tiene dos hijos y trabaja en MATECSA como mecánico automotriz, es el tercer crédito que solicita los ha utilizado para mejorar su casa y dar mejor condiciones de vida a su familia , este último es para mejorar el techo y paredes de un cuarto por tanto comprara , Zinc, hierro, cemento , bloque.
texts.en: Mr. Armando Antonio D. is married and he has two children. He works at Matesca as an automotive mechanic. It is the third loan he requests and he has used them to improve his house and to provide a better quality of life for his family. This latest loan will be used to improve the roof and walls of a bedroom. He will purchase zinc, steel, cement, and cement blocks.

loans.use: To carry out home improvements.

loans.name: Ana Lucia

texts.es:
La Señora. Ana C. es socia del banco comunal Primero de Enero, vive por el sector que lleva el mismo nombre, que  pertenece a la parroquia del Valle, esta parroquia es reconocida por la belleza de sus paisajes, su gente se dedica al comercio, cría de animales y agricultura.

La Señora. Ana tiene 33 años de edad, es soltera y tiene un hijo de 1 año y 8 meses de edad, la casa en la que habita es propia y vive con su mamá con quien comparte los gastos del hogar.

Doña Ana tiene en su casa un local de cabinas telefónicas en donde también brinda el servicio de Internet, labora de domingo a domingo desde las 10 de la mañana hasta las 10 de la noche.
 
Se encuentra en su segundo crédito que realiza en el banco comunal y el dinero de su crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de una nueva impresora. Su meta es  llegar a tener su propio vehiculo.
texts.en:
Mrs. Ana C. is a member of the communal bank named Primero de Enero (meaning First of January) and she lives in the sector of the same name, making part of the Del Valle district.  This district is renowned for the beauty of its landscapes. The population is made up of merchants, livestock farmers, and agriculturists.

Ana is 33 years old and she is single. She has a 20-month old son and the house where she lives is her own. She lives with her mother and they share the household expenses.

In her house, Ana has public telephone service and she also provides internet access. She works from Sunday to Sunday from 10 in the morning until 10 at night. 

She is on her second loan with her communal bank and the funds from this loan will be used to purchase a new printer. Her goal is to have her own car.

loans.use: To purchase a printer.

loans.name: Pedro Miguel

texts.es: Pedro es  un joven de 23 años de edad, soltero , originario del departamento de Totonicapan, el es comerciante y también ejerce el trabajo de albañil , el esta solicitando en Asociacion ASDIR su primer préstamo para compra de productos de consumo diario para su venta ya que cuenta con 5 años de experiencia y desea que su negocio siga creciendo y asi poder tener una mejor estabilidad económica.
texts.en: Pedro is a young man, 23 years old, single, and originally from the department of Totonicapan.  He is a merchant and a construction worker. He requests a first-time loan from Asociacion ASDIR (Kiva Field Partner) to purchase basic needs products for resale. He has 5 years' experience in the business and he wants to keep his business growing to maintain an improved financial stability.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise.

loans.name: Rosy María

texts.es:
La Señora. Rosy C. es socia del banco comunal Primero de Enero vive por el sector de Totoracocha en la ciudad de Cuenca, esta ciudad es reconocida por la belleza de sus paisajes, su centro histórico el mismo que en diciembre de 1999 fue nombrado como patrimonio cultural de la humanidad.
 
La Señora Rosy tiene 28 años, es casada y tiene 2 hijos de 5 y 1 año de edad, su primer hijo estudia en el jardín de infantes. Su esposo labora en su propia unidad de taxi, no tiene casa propia por lo que vive arrendando.

Doña Rosy se dedica a la venta de cosméticos de la maraca Yanbal, actividad que la realiza hace 5 años sin un horario fijo y trabaja todos los días, se dedica a esta actividad por que sus hijos se encuentran pequeños y tiene que cuidar de ellos
 
En el banco comunal se encuentra hace 9 años, el dinero de su nuevo crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de más cosméticos. Su sueño es tener su casa propia.
texts.en:
Mrs. Rosy Carillo is a member of the communal bank named Primero de Enero (meaning First of January) and she lives in the sector of Totoracocha in the city of Cuenca. This city is known for its beautiful landscapes and as historical site. In December 1999 it was named a world cultural center. 

Rosy is 28 years old, married, and the mother of 2 children, aged 5 and 1. Her eldest child is in kindergarten. Her husband is a taxi driver. They don't have a house of their own so they rent. 

Rosy sells Yanbal brand cosmetics. She has had the business for the past 5 years and she doesn’t have a fixed work schedule, though she works every day. She took up this business because her kids are still young and she needs to take care of them. 

She has been a member of her communal bank for the past 9 years. The funds from her new loan will be invested in the purchase of more cosmetics. Her dream is to have her own house.

loans.use: To purchase cosmetics.

loans.name: Lorenzo Jose

texts.es: Lorenzo tiene 45 años de edad, casado, originario de la ciudad de Totonicapán, docente y así mismo talabartero cuenta con el apoyo de su esposa francisca y así también con el cariño de su hija y de su hijo , el esta tramitando  su cuarto préstamo ya que es una persona cumplida y que se ha encontrado solvente en sus pagos anteriores en Asociación ASDIR, con esta ayuda el  desea comprar los útiles escolares para sus hijos , ya que el desea que los niños tengan una buena educación tanto personal como profesionalmente.
texts.en: Lorenzo is 45 years old, married and originally from the city of Totonicapan. He is a teacher and a belt-maker. He has his wife Francisca's support and love from his daughter and son. He is on his fourth loan and being a very honest person he has successfully repaid all the previous loans to Asociacion ASDIR (Kiva Field Partner). This loan will be used to purchase school supplies for his children, wanting them to have a good education, both personally and professionally speaking.

loans.use: To purchase school supplies.

loans.name: Mónica Eulalia

texts.es:
La Señora. Mónica S. es socia del banco comunal Primero de Enero, vive en la comunidad de Castilla Cruz que  pertenece a la parroquia del Valle, esta parroquia es reconocida por la belleza de sus paisajes, su gente se dedica al comercio, cría de animales y agricultura.

Doña Mónica se dedica al estilismo actividad que ejerce hace 13 años, tiene un local en su propia casa y también labora a domicilio, trabaja de lunes a sábados sin tener un horario fijo, hace 14 años se dedica a la venta de cosméticos  que vende en su propio local.

La Señora. Mónica tiene 35 años, es casada y tiene 2 hijos de 16 y 3 años de edad, su primer hijo estudia en un colegio de la ciudad. Su esposo es artesano y trabaja en la elaboración de (cielos rasos), con el trabajo conyugal han logrado construir su casa propia.
 
Se encuentra en su segundo crédito y el dinero de su crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de productos Yanbal y materia prima para su gabinete. Su meta es  agrandar su negocio y poner unas cabinas telefónicas e Internet por su sector.
texts.en:
Mrs. Monica S. is a member of the communal bank named Primero de Enero (meaning First of January). She lives in the community of Castilla Cruz, belonging to the Del Valle district. This district is known for its beautiful scenery. The population is made up of merchants, livestock farmers, and agriculturists.

Monica has been a stylist for the past 13 years. She has her business set up in her house. She works form Monday to Saturday without a fixed work schedule. For the past 14 years she has also sold cosmetics from her own stand.

Monica is 35 years old, married, and she is the mother of 2 children, aged 16 and 3. Her eldest daughter attends high school in the city. Her husband is an artisan and he installs ceilings.   With their combined work they have managed to build their own house. 

She is on her second loan and the funds from this loan will be used to invest in the purchase of Yanbal brand products and products for her business. Her goal is to increase her business and to set up other public telephone services and internet access in her area.

loans.use: To purchase cosmetics.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To cover school tuition.

loans.name: Juana Terresa

texts.es: Juana tiene 46 años de edad, es casada , originaria del Departamento de Totonicapán, cuenta con tres hijos dos varones y una mujer, asi como también con su esposo cruz , juntos han logrado salir adelante ya que se dedican al comercio y cuentan con 15 años de experiencia , ella esta solicitando el cuarto crédito en asociación ASDIR ya que cuenta con un record crediticio bueno  estando al día en sus créditos  anteriores.
texts.en: Juana is 46 years old, married, and she is originally from the department of Totonicapan. She has three children, two boys and a girl. She and her husband Cruz have managed to succeed with their work as merchants.  They have 15 years' experience in the field. She requests her fourth loan with Asociacion ASDIR (Kiva Field Partner). She has a good credit rating and she has successfully repaid her previous loans.

loans.use: To purchase products for resale.

loans.name: Alfredo

texts.es:
El señor Alfredo G. y la señora Maria Inés Coazozon son padres de familia y tiene dos hijos de edad escolar, a quienes les quieren dar lo mejor. 
A la vivienda le esta haciendo falta los acabados del exterior de la casa, pero no cuenta con el dinero necesario para realizar la mejora. 
Es por eso que están solicitando un préstamo y hacia poder comprar el material que necesitan y pagarle a la persona que realizara la mejora.
Don Alfredo trabaja para un taller de herrera como supervisor con este ingreso pagara el préstamo, ya que Doña Maria Inés se encargara de las gastas familiares con el sueldo que obtiene como empleada de limpieza. 
 La persona que nos atendió fue la señora Maria Inés, esposa del señor Alfredo G. hay que por cuestiones de trabajo no pudo El atendernos ese día.
texts.en:
Mr. Alfredo G. and Mrs. Maria Ines Coazozon are the parents of two school-aged children, to whom they want to provide them with the best. 

There are some repairs that need to take place to the exterior of their home, but they don’t have the necessary funds to carry it out. 

They request a loan in order to purchase the materials they need and to pay for the labor. 

Alfredo is a supervisor in a blacksmith shop. With this income he will repay his loan. Maria Ines takes care of the household expenses with the income she earns providing cleaning services. 

Maria Ines made the request, wife to Alfredo G.. He was not able to attend the interview because he had to be at work that day.

loans.use: To carry out home improvements.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase construction materials to carry out home improvements.

loans.name: Elmer Joel

texts.es:
Elmer Z., es habitante de la Comunidad El Rodeo, del Departamento de Esteli, casado, tiene 28 anos de edad, con 2 hijos, se dedica a la agricultura.
Inicio con su familia, ayudando en las actividades agricolas; pero al mismo tiempo con mucho sacrificio, decidio estudiar algo relacionado a lo que el sabia hacer, y realizo un Tecnico Agropecuario;  pero no pudo seguir mas alla de esa carrera tecnica, debido a las circunstancias economicas, y tuvo que seguir dedicandose a la siembra de Hortalizas.
A travez de los pocos conocimientos que logro obtener, ayudo a muchos de su comunidad realizando Capacitacion en Otorgacion de Creditos.
En la epoca de Invierno, se dedica a la compra/venta de productos agropecuarios, a las casa comerciales y empresasa como AGROALFA.
Realizo este credito para sembrar 1 manzana de Tomate, espera obtener buenas ganancias para ayudar a su familia.
Su meta es comprar mas terrenos, para tener mas variedad de cultivos y poder producir durante todo el ano.
texts.en:
Elmer Z. lives in the community of El Rodeo in the department of Esteli. He is married, 28 years old, and the father of 2. He is an agriculturist. 

He started out by helping his family with agricultural activities. But at the same time and with a great deal of personal sacrifice, he decided to study something related to what he already knew: agricultural technology. But he was not able to keep going with his technical training due to his financial circumstances. He kept his up his agricultural work. 

Through the knowledge he was able to acquire he helped many in his community to apply and secure loans. 

During the winter season he buys and sells agricultural products to businesses and to large companies like Agro Alfa. 

He requested this loan to cultivate tomatoes in a measure of land, with the hopes of earning a good income to support his family. 

His goal is to purchase more land, to have a larger variety of products to cultivate and to produce year-round.

loans.use: For his tomato harvest.

loans.name: Michelle

texts.en:
Michelle E. is from the village of ZNAC, Tampilisan, Zamboanga del Norte. She is 25 years old. Michelle is married and has one school-aged child. 

To make a living, Michelle owns and operates a retail store, selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap and toothpaste in the local community. Michelle has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Michelle joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. Michelle has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. 

Michelle is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the fourth loan taken out by Michelle from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to improve and expand her business. 

About PMPC:
Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Fretzel Liza

texts.en:
Fretzel Liza B., 39, is from the city of Lawa-an Banonong. She is married and has three children, two are school-aged and one is grown. 

To make a living, Fretzel Liza sells RTW -- ready-to-wear used clothing -- in the local community. Fretzel Liza has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP average per month.

In 2008, Fretzel Liza joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 12,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase raw materials for her snack vending business. 

Fretzel Liza is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase materials for house renovation. This will be the fifth loan she has taken out from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's general living condition

loans.use: To purchase materials for house renovation

loans.name: Emprendedoras Mb Group

texts.es: Esta foto fue tomada en la casa D. la Sra. María Isabel G. una integrante D. grupo Emprendedoras D. MB, que está ubicado en la comunidad D. Monte Blanco en el estado D. Veracruz en México. Se ve a la señora Maria Isabel G. junto a las demás integrantes D. grupo D. la foto. Ella se dedica a la venta D. elotes y esquites que inició hace 15 años. Solicita su préstamo para mejorar su negocio. Sus clientes la consideran una persona con valores, perserverante y con ganas D. salir adelante y en la cual se pueD. confiar. Al momento D. solicitar su prestamo se siente motivada y con entusiasmo para seguir trabajando. Tiene 45 años, estudió la primaria, es casada y tiene 2 hijos: una mujer y unvarón. Quiere este crédito para mejorar su negocio y con ello ayudar a su familia. También espera que con el crecimiento D. su negocio obtendrá ganancias para terminar D. construir su casa.Catalina D. P. M, es la presidenta D. grupo tiene 35 años, estudio hasta la secundaria y tiene en total 1 hijo. ella se dedica a la venta D. lenceria por catálogo que inicio hace 4 años. Solicita el prestamo para invertir en ropa  y leceria para vender. El grupo está conformado por 11 integrantes. Observación: La primer señora D. la derecha que sale D. perfil, se llama Catalina D. P. M..
texts.en: This photo was taken at the house of Mrs. Maria Isabel G., a member of the group named Emprendedoras D. MB. It is locate din the community of Monte Blanco in the State of Veracruz in Mexico. Mrs. Maria Isabel G. can be seen together with the rest of the group in the photo.  She has been selling corn on the cob and prepared corn for 15 years. She requests a loan to improve her business. Her clients know her as a person with strong values, perseverant, someone with a great drive to succeed, and someone who is trustworthy. When she applied for her loan she felt motivated and enthusiastic to keep working. She is 45 years old and she has a graD. 6 education. She is married and she has 2 children: a girl and a boy. This loan will be used to improve her business and to support her family. With the growth of her business she also expects to earn enough money to finish building her house. Catalina D. P. M. is the leader of the group. She is 35 years old, she graduated from high school and she has one son. She has been selling lingerie from a catalogue for four years. She requests a loan to invest in the purchase of clothing and lingerie for resale. The group is maD. up of 11 members. Note: The first woman on the right pictured in profile is Catalina D. P. M..

loans.use: Working capital.

loans.name: Kang

texts.en: Mrs. Kang K. lives in the village of Phngeas in Takeo province, where she was born in 1972. She owns a three-hectare plot of land where supports her family by raising and selling rice. She also runs a business on the side raising pigs. In her area, it is now time to plant rice, and she has applied for a loan to buy the supplies she needs for her new crop. Her husband, Mr. Ry On, makes a living breeding ducks, and his income, when combined with his wife's, allows them to support four children, three of whom are still in school.

loans.use: To buy supplies needed to plant a new rice crop.

loans.name: Victor Manuel

texts.es: El Sr. Víctor Manuel es propietario de un taller de Soldadura y tiene la necesidad de comprar una maquina cortadora ya que la que tiene actualmente ya esta muy deteriorada, el señor tiene 19 años con su taller y de ahí ha sacado a su familia adelante y ha logrado dales una buena calidad de vida, con la compra de esa maquina el podrá dar mejor servicio a sus clientes y por lo tanto hacer su trabajo mas rápido y con calidad para así poder tener las ganancias que el requiere.
texts.en: Victor Manuel is the owner of a welding shop and he needs to purchase a cutting tool to replace the one he has now. He has had his shop for 19 years and he has been able to provide for his family with it. He has managed to provide them with a good quality of life. With the purchase of this tool he will be able to provide better service to his clients and to speed up and add quality to his work. He will be able to secure the earnings that he requires.

loans.use: To purchase a cutting tool for his workshop.

loans.name: Nhae

texts.en: Mrs. Nhae P. is married and has two children, one of whom attends a local public school. Her second child is two years old and spends his days at home. The young family  lives in Mea Neak village, which is located in Takeo province. Mrs. Nhae P. makes a living by breeding pigs and working on a farm while her husband, Mr. Pouv Sout, runs the 1.3 hectare plot of land where they grow enough rice to support their family. Mrs. P. has applied for a loan to buy the supplies they need to plant a new crop, including seeds, gasoline and pesticide.

loans.use: To buy seed, gasoline and pesticide for a rice farm

loans.name: Mr. Sam Pov Village Bank Group

texts.en: This fifteen-member loan group is made up of people who live in Traeuy Tonloab village, which is located in Takeo province. Mr. Sam P. has been selected by the group's members to serve as its president. He is a farmer who owns a half-hectare plot of land where he supports his family by growing and selling rice.
