Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté et font le commerce du savon, des condiments et de l’arachide.                                                                                     
Les femmes du groupe Bendiya sont à leur cinquième prêt solidaire qui sera utilisé pour acheter du savon, des condiments et de l’arachide qui sera transformé en pâte par MAMINE T..                                                                          
MAMINE T. s’approvisionne en arachide presque hebdomadairement au marché de Konobougou. Elle effectue ses ventes sur place dans le village et au marché de Konobougou après transformation en pâte d’arachide, au comptant et à crédit, à une clientèle composée de femmes surtout.
Elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice moyen mensuel de  20 000F CFA qui sera utilisé pour payer les échéances du prêt, une partie pour prendre en charge les dépenses relatives à la santé,  à la nourriture,  aux frais scolaires et le reste sera  réinvesti dans les activités.
texts.en:
The women of the group named Bendiya are married and they have an average age of 21. They have 3 children each and they live in large traditional extended families in the village of Wela, located in the prefecture of Konobougou in the Segou region (fourth administrative region in the Republic of Mali). 

They are known through family and they are involved in the sale of soaps, condiments, and peanuts. 

The women of the Bendiya group are on their fifth group loan and it will be used to purchase soap, condiments, and peanuts. The peanuts will be made into peanut butter by Mamine T.. 

Mamine T. purchases her peanuts almost weekly at the market in Konobougou. She makes her sales from her house in the village and at the Konobougou market, once the peanuts are made into peanut butter.  She completes her sales in cash and credit to a clientele made up primarily of women. 

She expects to earn a monthly income of 20 000FCFA which will be used to make the payments for this loan; a portion will be used to cover health related expenses, to purchase food, and to pay school fees; the remaining portion will be reinvested in her business.

loans.use: To purchase peanuts.

loans.name: Ilhomchon

texts.ru: Рашитов Илхомчон проживает в городе Турсунзаде. Ему 36 лет. Женат. Имеет одного ребенка. Образование-среднее. Более 12 лет занимается торговлей. Арендует торговую точку на рынке Дехкон. Он в основном продает мужскую обувь. Кредит берет для увеличения товарооборота. Он намерен закупить сезонный товар для продажи.
texts.en: Ilhomchon R. lives in the city of Tursun-zoda.  He is 36 years old, married and has one child.  He has a secondary education and has been involved in retail sales for over 12 years.  Ilhomchon leases a retail outlet at the Dehkon market.  He primarily sells men's shoes.  He is requesting this loan in order to increase goods turnover.  He intends to buy seasonal merchandise for resale.

loans.use: Increasing goods turnover

loans.name: Benkadi Group

texts.fr:
Les femmes du groupe Benkadi, toutes mariées, ont en moyenne 33 ans, 3 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies dans le village de Dioni, préfecture de Konobougou ; Région de Ségou (quatrième région  administrative de la république du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté et font le commerce de tissus, de céréales et d’arachide.                                                                                     
Les femmes du groupe Benkadi sont à leur premier prêt solidaire qui sera utilisé pour acheter de tissus, de céréales et de l’arachide.                                                                    SIRANDOU T. compte acheter des tissus au niveau du marché de Konobougou pour en faire des draps, qu’elle vend à ses clients du village, au comptant et à crédit, à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes.
Elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 10 000F CFA qui sera utilisé pour payer les échéances du prêt, une partie pour prendre en charge les dépenses liées à la santé,  à la nourriture, aux frais scolaires de ses enfants et le reste sera  réinvesti dans les activités.
texts.en:
The women of the group named Benkadi are all married and they have an average age of 33. They each have 3 children and they all live in traditional extended families in the village of Dioni, located in the Konobougou prefecture of the Segou region (fourth administrative region in the Republic of Mali). 

They are known through family and they sell fabrics, cereal grains, and peanuts. 

The women of the Benkadi group are on their first group loan and it will be used to purchase fabrics, cereal grains and peanuts. Sirandou T. plans on purchasing new fabrics at the Konobougou market to make sheets. She sells to clients in her village in cash and credit. Her clientele is made up of women and men. 

She expects to earn a monthly income of 10 000 FCFA which will be used to make the loan  payments; a portion will be used to cover health care related expenses, to purchase food and pay  for school fees; and the remaining portion will be used to reinvest in her business.

loans.use: To purchase fabrics.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more cloth.

loans.name: Benkola Group

texts.fr:
Les femmes du groupe Benkola sont toutes mariées, ont en moyenne 38 ans, 8 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies dans la ville de Barouéli, préfecture de Barouéli; Région de Ségou (quatrième région  administrative de la république du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et d’amitié. Elles font le commerce de produits cosmétiques, de tissus, de tubercules, des parfums, de tasses et de savons.                                                                                     
Les femmes du groupe Benkola sont à leur sixième prêt solidaire. 
ASSAN D. s’approvisionne en produits cosmétiques avec les grossistes qui partent au Burkina Faso. Elle revend au comptant et à crédit, au marché de Barouéli à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes.
Elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 60 000F CFA qui sera utilisé pour payer les échéances du prêt, prendre en charge les dépenses relatives à la santé, à la nourriture, aux frais scolaires des enfants et le reste sera  réinvesti dans les activités.
texts.en:
The women of the Benkola group are all married and on average they are 38 years old. They each have 8 children and they live in traditional extended families in the city of Baroueli, located in the Baroueli prefecture in the region of Segou (fourth administrative region in the Republic of Mali). 

They are known through family, as neighbors and through friendships. They are involved in the sale of cosmetics, fabrics, tubers, perfumes, kitchen wares, and soaps. 

The women of the Benkola group are on their sixth group loan. 

Assan D. purchases cosmetics from the wholesalers from Burkina Faso. She resells her products in cash and credit at a market in Baroueli to a clientele made up of women and men. 

She expects to earn a monthly income of 60 000 FCFA which will be used to make the payments for  this loan, to pay for health care related expenses, to purchase food, and to pay for school  fees. The remaining portion will be used to reinvest in her business.

loans.use: To purchase cosmetics.

loans.name: Alihon

texts.ru: Розиков Алихон житель Вахдатского района. Ему 24 года. Холост. Образование среднее. Он предоставляет услугу. У него имеется дилерский центр и интернет кафе. Он в основном занимается пополнением баланса мобильных телефонов и торговлей сим-карт. Уже год как занимается этим видом деятельности. Кредит просит для покупки компьютера и сим-карт.
texts.en: Alihon R. lives in the Vahdat district.  He is 24 years old, single.  He has a secondary education and provides a service.  Alihon has a dealer center and an internet cafe.  He is mainly involved in refilling mobile phone balances and selling SIM cards.  He has been in this business for one year.  He is requesting this loan for the purchase of a computer and SIM cards.

loans.use: Purchase of a computer and SIM cards

loans.name: Susanna

texts.en:
Susanna N. is from the village of Gharibjanyan in the Shirak region of Armenia.  She is married with three children.  Susanna’s three sons are twelve, twenty four and twenty five years old.  She has a college degree in agriculture.  

She considers herself a sincere hard working person.  Susanna has been an agricultural entrepreneur for the past twenty one years.  She dreams for all of her sons to receive and complete a university education.  She is looking for a loan to purchase feed, seeds and fertilizer to expand her livestock and vegetable growing business.  With this investment Susanna is expecting the family income to increase by twenty percent.  Susanna deems microfinance the best financial opportunity to grow her business.  She enjoys the quiet life of her village and looks forward to the future.

loans.use: To purchase feed, seeds and fertilizers.

loans.name: Ruth

texts.es:
Ruth forma parte del banco comunal “Los Alcaldes”  perteneciente a la ciudad de Valdivia. Ella tiene una rotisería y frutería en su casa, desde hace 6 años, en donde atiende ella y un sobrino. 
Con este préstamo comprará mercadería.
Vive con su esposo, quien trabaja de manera dependiente y con su hijo de 20 años, que este año comienza a estudiar en la enseñanza superior.
Su sueño es pagar los estudios de su hijo.
Ruth está muy contenta con el sistema de pago de los préstamos de Fondo Esperanza, los cuales son de forma semanal y en pequeñas cantidades, ya que le es más fácil cumplir con sus cuotas. Además agradece que no se le exigiera presentar antecedentes comerciales para entregarle el crédito.
Valdivia es una ciudad del sur de Chile, ubicada en la región de Los Ríos. Se destaca por tener uno de los pocos ríos navegables de Chile, el Calle Calle. Valdivia presenta, dentro de sus principales actividades económicas, la industria de la construcción naval, maderera, papelera, celulosa (Celco), cervecera y molinera. El turismo desempeña un papel importante, como también los servicios educacionales universitarios, encabezados por la Universidad Austral de Chile.
texts.en:
Ruth is a member of the "Los Alcaldes" community bank which is located in the city of Valdivia.  For the past 6 years, she has been running both a delicatessen selling roasted chickens and a fruit store from her home.  She serves in her businesses together with a nephew.

Ruth will use this loan to buy merchandise.  She lives with her husband, who works as a private employee, and her 20 year-old son who will start his higher education this year.  Ruth's dream is to be able to pay for her son's studies.

Ruth is very happy with Fondo Esperanza's loan repayment system.  Repayments are made weekly and in small quantities which makes it easier to meet them.  She is also grateful that borrowers do not have to present a commercial record in order to obtain a loan.

The city of Valvidia is located in the south of Chile, in Los Ríos region  It is known for being the home of one of the few navigable rivers in Chile, the Calle Calle.  Some of Valvidia's main economic activities are the shipbuilding industry, the lumber industry, the paper industry, the cellulose industry (Celco), the beer industry and the milling industry.  Tourism also plays an important part in the region's economy as does the university industry which is headed by the 'Universidad Austral de Chile'.

loans.use: To buy merchandise

loans.name: Karine

texts.en:
Karine S. lives in the village of Gharibjanyan in the Shirak region of Armenia.  She is the proud mother of three children (two sons twenty three and twenty four and a twenty year old daughter).  

With her husband, Karine has been working on the family farm for over twenty two years.  She is fortunate to have a university degree in agriculture which helps her run the farm.  Karine is looking for a loan to purchase seed and fertilizer.  She will invest the loan in her livestock and vegetable growing business.  According to her business plan she expects the family income to increase by twenty five percent.  

Karine was born in Gharibjyan and hopes to continuing living there surrounded by her close friends and relatives.  Karine dreams to see her children happily married with children living near her.

loans.use: To purchase seed and fertilizer.

loans.name: Badeya Group

texts.fr:
Les six membres du groupe BADEYA (1célibataire, 2 mariés et 3 veuves) avec une moyenne d’âge de 46  ans, en moyenne  3 enfants, vivent la plupart dans des  familles monogames à MEDINE un des quartiers de la ville de Sikasso 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles sont à leur huitième collaboration avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle, les prêts passé ont été remboursé dans de bonne condition. Ce groupe de femmes fait le commerce  des fruits et légumes tels les oranges à travers de DJENEBOU D.. 
DJENEBOU D., la présidente du groupe, compte acheter avec son  prêt 25 sacs d’oranges  .
Elle s’approvisionne au grand marché de MEDINE à SIKASSO.
Les oranges  sont revendus au  marché de MEDINE à Sikasso et en famille à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes au comptant. 
 Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 95.000FCFA utilisée  pour les dépenses quotidiennes de la famille .
texts.en:
The six members of the Badeya group (1 is single, 2 are married, 3 are widows) have an average age of 46 years. They each have 3 children and the majority of them live in monogamous families in Medine, a quarter in the city of Sikasso (third administrative region of Mali). 

They are on their eighth loan with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso (Kiva Field Partner). Their goal is to satisfy their clients' needs. Their previous loans were successfully repaid. This group of women is involved in the sale of fruits and vegetables, including oranges, through Djenebou D.. 

Djenebou D. is the leader of the group. With her loan, she plans on purchasing 25 sacks of oranges. She makes her purchases at the large market in Medine, Sikasso. 

The oranges are resold at the market in Medine in Sikasso, to family and to a clientele made of men and women. She completes her sales in cash.

She expects to earn a monthly income of 95.000 FCFA which will be used to cover her family’s daily expenses.

loans.use: To purchase oranges.

loans.name: El Mirador Group

texts.es:
Mirsa forma parte del banco comunal “El Mirador” conformado por 20 emprendedoras, pertenecientes a la ciudad de Calbuco.
Mirsa, quien en la foto se encuentra en la 3º fila a la derecha y viste polerón blanco, vende pescados, mariscos y verduras en su casa. Sus ventas son por mayor y sus clientes frecuentes son vendedores de ferias y restaurantes. También vende al detalle en su casa. Mirsa tiene este negocio hace 2 años. 
Ella viaja 3 veces a la semana a Puerto Montt (ciudad ubicada a 1 hora de Calbuco) a comprar su mercadería. Los días que sale se levanta a las 4 de la mañana.
Mirsa trabaja sola en este negocio, pero cuando tiene muchos pedidos contrata hasta 2 personas para que le ayuden.
Con este préstamo comprará pescados y mariscos. 
Vive con su esposo, quien trabaja fuera de la ciudad, con su hija menor, quien estudia ingeniería informática y con su nieto, hijo de esta hija.
El sueño de Mirsa es tener un local establecido de pescados y mariscos.
Ella está muy agradecida de los préstamos que recibe por medio de Fondo Esperanza, ya que han sido un gran aporte para su negocio. Además disfruta mucho del compañerismo dentro de su grupo.
Calbuco, es una comuna ubicada al sur de Chile, en la región de Los Lagos. Su  origen etimológico es del mapudungun (lengua mapuche) y significa "aguas azules". Es un archipiélago conformado por 12  islas. Su economía está basada fundamentalmente en la extracción de los productos del mar. En la actualidad existen numerosas fábricas de conservas, centros de cultivos de salmones, ostras, choros etc.
texts.en:
Mirsa is a member of the "El Mirador" community bank.  The bank has 20 female members who all live in the town of Calbuco.  In the photo, Mirsa is in the third row, on the right, wearing a white top.  She sells fish, seafood and vegetables from her home.  She makes her sales wholesale and her frequent customers are market traders and restaurants.  She also makes retail sales from her home.

Mirsa has had her business for 2 years.  Three times a week she travels to Puerto Montt (a town located one hour from Calbuco) to buy her merchandise.  On these days she gets up at 4.00am.  Mirsa works alone in her business but when she has a lot of orders she hires up to 2 other people to help her.  She will use her loan to buy fish and seafood.

Mirsa lives with her husband, who works outside the city; her youngest daughter, who is studying computer engineering; and her grandson (that daughter's son).  Mirsa's dream is to own an established fish and seafood store.  She is very grateful for the loans that she receives from Fondo Esperanza since they have been a great help in her business.  She also enjoys the friendship that she has found in her group.

Calbuco municipality is located in the south of Chile, in Los Lagos region.  The name 'Calbuco' comes from Mapudungun (Mapuche language) and it means 'blue waters'.  It is an archipelago made up of 12 islands.  The local economy is mainly based around extracting products from the sea.  There are currently a number of canning factories and salmon, oyster and mussel farms.

loans.use: To buy fish and seafood

loans.name: Kadiatu

texts.en:
This is 51-year-old Kadiatu K.. She is married and has four additional dependents who live with her because she takes care of them. Kadiatu owns a plastic wares business, which she inherited from her late aunt. She began the business because she wanted to make a profit. 

Kadiatu operates her business six days a week and ten hours a day. She would like a loan in the amount of Le 5,000,000 in order to expand her business. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy more plastic items

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more bags of charcoal

loans.name: Francis

texts.en:
Francis G. has worked as a farmer for five years and currently produces coffee and bananas for sale.

He has requested this loan of 50,000 Ksh in order to purchase poultry. He hopes within in five years to have expanded his business and to own over 3,000 chickens. With the potential increase in income from the loan, he hopes to better feed his family and improve their standard of living.

Francis is 63 years old and has five children, ranging from the ages of 17 to 30 years old.

loans.use: to purchase poultry

loans.name: Champion Group

texts.fr:
Les cinq membres du groupe CHAMPION sont toutes mariés avec une moyenne d’âge de 37 ans, et ont en moyenne 4 enfants. Elles vivent la plupart dans des familles monogames à SANOUBOUGOU I un des quartiers de la ville de Sikasso 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles sont à leur troisième collaboration avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle, les prêts passé ont été remboursé dans de bonne condition. Ce groupe de femmes fait le commerce de condiments  à travers KADIATOU T.. 
KADIATOU T.  compte acheter avec son  prêt, 5 paniers de tomates , 4 paquets de cube maggi. Elle s’approvisionne au grand marché de SIKASSO.
Les condiments sont revendus au  marché de SANOUBOUGOU I à Sikasso et en famille à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes au comptant. 
 Elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 70.000FCFA utilisée pour les dépenses quotidiennes de la famille.
texts.en:
The five members of the group name Champion are all married and they have an average age of 37.  They are 4 children each and the majority lives in monogamous families in Sanoubougou I, one of the quarters in the city of Sikasso (third administrative region of Mali). 

They are on their third group loan with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso (Kiva Field Partner) and their goal is to satisfy client demand. Their past loans have all successfully been repaid. This group of women sells condiments through Kadiatou T.. 

Kadiatou T. plans on investing her loan in the purchase of 5 baskets of tomatoes and 4 packages of Maggi cubes. She makes her purchases in the large market in Sikasso. 

The condiments are resold in the market in Sanoubougou I in Sikasso, to family and to a clientele made of men and women. She completes her sales in cash. 

She expects to earn a monthly income of 70.000 FCFA which will be used to cover her family’s daily expenses.

loans.use: To purchase condiments.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more bags of rice, milk, sugar, tomatoes, oil, seasoning, etc.

loans.name: Denkisse Group

texts.fr:
Les neuf membres du groupe DENKISSE (8 mariés et 1 veuve) avec une moyenne d’âge de 26 ans ont en moyenne 2 enfants. Elles vivent la plupart dans des familles monogames à SANOUBOUGOU I un des quartiers de la ville de Sikasso 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles sont à leur deuxième collaboration avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle, le prêt passé est payé dans de bonne condition. Ce groupe de femmes fait le commerce de de tasses à travers MARIAM S. .
MARIAM S.  compte acheter avec son  prêt  5 douzaines de tasses  .
Elle s’approvisionne au grand marché de Sikasso et à Bamako .
Les tasses sont revendus au  marché de SANOUBOUGOU à Sikasso et en famille à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes au comptant. 
 Elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 45.000FCFA utilisée pour les dépenses quotidiennes de la famille.
texts.en:
The nine members of the group named Denkisse (8 are married and 1 is a widow) have an average age of 26 and they each have 2 children. The majority of them live in monogamous families in Sanoubougou I, one of the quarters in the city of Sikasso (third administrative region in Mali). 

They are on their second loan with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso (Kiva Field Partner). Their goal is to satisfy client demand. The previous loans were all successfully repaid. This group of women is involved in the sale of kitchenware through Mariam S.. 

Mariam S. plans on investing her loan on the purchase of 5 dozen cups. 

She makes her purchases at the large market in Sikasso and Bamako. 

The cups are resold in the market in Sanoubougou and Sikasso to family and to a clientele made of men and women. She completes her sales in cash. 

She expects to earn a monthly income of 45.000 FCFA which will be used for her family's daily expenses.

loans.use: To purchase cups.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret G. has been working as a farmer for 16 years. She currently produces milk, eggs, bananas, and sweet potatoes for sale.

She has requested this loan of 60,000 Ksh in order to purchase more poultry. In five years, she hopes to expanded her business to up to 5,000 chickens as well as 5 dairy cows. Her main challenge in running her business is the cost of chicken feed.

Margaret is married with three children, ranging from 14 to 21 years old, all of whom attend school. With the potential increase in income from this loan, she hopes to pay for her childrens' higher education and to raise her family's standard of living.

loans.use: to purchase poultry

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more gallons of palm oil

loans.name: Finesse Group

texts.fr:
Les quatre membres du groupe FINESSE (3 célibataires et 1marié) avec une moyenne d’âge de 30 ans, ont en moyenne 3 enfants. Elles vivent la plupart dans des familles monogames à SANOUBOUGOU I un des quartiers de la ville de Sikasso 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles sont à leur troisième collaboration avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle, les prêts passé ont été remboursé dans de bonne condition. Ce groupe de femmes fait le commerce de tissus   avec SITAN T.. 
SITAN T.  compte acheter avec son  prêt,  25   rouleaux de tissus.
Elle s’approvisionne  à partir  des marchés de DAKAR et LOME .
Les pagnes  wax sont revendus au  marché de SANOUBOUGOU I à Sikasso et en famille à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes au comptant. 
 Elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 45.000 FCFA utilisée pour les dépenses quotidiennes de la famille.
texts.en:
The four members of the group named Finesse (3 are single and 1 is married) have an average age of 30 years. They have 3 children each and the majority of them live in monogamous families in Sanoubougou I, one of the quarters in the city of Sikasso (third administrative region of Mali). 

They are on their third loan with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso (Kiva Field Partner) and their goal is to satisfy client demand. Their previous loans were all successfully repaid. This group of women sells fabrics through Sitan T.. 

Sitan T. plans on investing her loan in the purchase of 25 rolls of fabric. 

She purchases her inventory in the market in Dakar and Lome. The wax cloths are resold at the market in Sanoubougou I and in Sikasso and to family, a clientele made up of men and women.  She completes her sales in cash. 

She expects to earn a monthly income of 45.000 FCFA and it will be used to cover her family's daily expenses.

loans.use: To purchase fabrics.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more bags of used clothes, milk, and car spare parts

loans.name: Raphael

texts.en:
Raphael W. is married and has eight children. He has been working as a farmer for 20 years, producing goods such as bananas, avocados and milk for sale. The main challenges he faces in running his business are the cost of purchasing pesticides and the lack of rain.

He has requested this loan of 50,000 KES in order to drill for water, which will be used to irrigate his farm. 

In five years, he hopes to have expanded his business through the purchase of more dairy cows. 

With the potential increase in income from the loan, he hopes to further expand his farming business.

loans.use: To drill for irrigation water

loans.name: Gnogofamou Group

texts.fr:
Les cinq membres du groupe GNOGOFAMOU sont toutes mariés avec une moyenne d’âge de 26 ans et ont en moyenne 3 enfants. Elles vivent dans des familles monogames à SANOUBOUGOU I un des quartiers de la ville de Sikasso 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles sont à leur deuxième collaboration avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle, le prêt précédent a été remboursé dans de bonne condition. Ce groupe de femmes fait le commerce de tissus  à travers de DIETENE D., qui compte acheter avec son  prêt 20 pièces de pagnes wax. Elle s’approvisionne au grand marché de Sikasso et à Bamako . Les pagnes  wax sont revendus au  marché de MEDINE à Sikasso et en famille à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes au comptant. 
 Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 20.000FCFA utilisée  pour les dépenses quotidiennes de la famille.
texts.en:
The five members of the group named Gnogofamou are all married and are 26 years old on average. They each have 3 children and they live in monogamous families in Sanoubougou I, a quarter in the city of Sikasso (third administrative region in Mali). 

They are on their second loan with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso (Kiva Field Partner) and their goal is to satisfy client demand. Their previous loans were all successfully repaid. This group of women sells fabrics through Dietene D.. She plans on investing her loan on the purchase of 20 pieces of wax cloth. She purchases her inventory in the large market in Sikasso and Bamako. The wax cloths are resold in the market in Medine and Sikasso and to family, a clientele made up of men and women. She completes her sales in cash. 

She expects to earn a monthly income of 20.000FCFA and it will be used to provide for her family's daily expenses.

loans.use: To purchase fabrics.

loans.name: Moses

texts.en: Moses is a 32-year-old, married man blessed with a three-year-old child.  He is a hard-working businessman who does dairy farming.  He is also employed in a milk-processing company.  He has been farming in Kiambu for three years.  With support from Faulu Kenya, he has improved his business and his financial status has risen.  He has requested 80,000 Kes to buy a dairy cow.

loans.use: To buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase a bundle of cosmetics for sale

loans.name: Benedicter

texts.en:
Benedicter M. is married and has three children, who range in age from 28 to 26. 

She has been working as a farmer for 45 years, producing goods such as bananas, eggs and milk for sale. The main challenges she faces in running her business are diseases and the lack of a large market.

She has requested this loan of 60,000 KES in order to purchase poultry. With the potential increase in income from her loan, she hopes to improve her family's standard of living.

In five years, she hopes to have expanded her business through the purchase of more chickens.

loans.use: To purchase poultry

loans.name: Michael

texts.en:
Michael T. has six children, ranging from the ages of 13 to 25 years old. 

He has been working as a farmer for six years and produces goods such as coffee and bananas for sale. The main challenge he faces in running his business is fluctuations in weather, such as drought.

He has requested this loan of 60,000 KES in order to construct a bore-hole to drill for water, which may then be used to irrigate his farm. 

With the potential increase in income from this loan, he hopes to modernize his farming methods as well as improve his family's standard of living.

loans.use: To drill for irrigation water

loans.name: Sophia

texts.en:
Sophia is a single mother of one.  She runs a retail shop so as to earn her daily bread.  She has been running the business for over ten years.  She also does dairy farming for extra income.  

Sophia appreciates Faulu Kenya because of their financial support.  This has made her able to improve her business.  She needs a loan of 60,000 Kes to purchase more sugar, rice, and cooking fat and to buy a cow.

loans.use: sugar, rice, cooking fat for her store and to buy a cow

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more cartons of fish

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more gallons of palm oil and caustic products used in the production of soap

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To enlarge his farm

loans.name: Zubeda

texts.en:
Zubeda is a married woman with two children, both of whom attend school. She owns a house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees.

She operates a poultry business, selling in a little shop to her neighbours and passersby. In addition she also operates a boutique which contributes to her other source of income. Zubeda faces a major challenge of outbreaks of poultry diseases. She hopes to supply poultry to her customers wholesale in the future.

With the Kshs 60,000 she wants to pay school fees. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to educate her children.

loans.use: To pay school fees

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more gallons of palm oil

loans.name: Veronica

texts.en: Veronica is a married lady with a five-year-old child.  She runs a grocery shop for a living.  She started the business ten years ago.  She has witnessed her business growing through the help of Faulu Kenya.  She is a hard-working business-lady who hopes to run a big business in the future.  She has requested a loan of 50,000 Kes to buy carrots.

loans.use: To buy carrots

loans.name: Jane Warigia

texts.en:
Jane Warigia M. is 29 years old and married to John M.. They are blessed with three children. She has been running a mini wholesale shop in Shaurimoyo for a period of 12 years and earns a profit of KES 10,500 per month. Shaurimoyo is a densely populated estate just few kilometers from Nairobi city centre, and she has many customers.

Jane was introduced  to KADET Ltd. by an existing client of KADET, and she is applying for her second loan of KES 70,000 from KADET. She intends to use the loan to add more stock such as maize flour for KES 20,000, cooking fat worth KES 10,000, wheat flour worth KES 20,000, and rice worth KES 20,000. 

She will save the anticipated profit  to pay school fees for her children.

In the future Jane plans to grow her business and eventually open a complete wholesale shop.

loans.use: To add stock to the mini wholesale shop

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more bags of rice, milk, sugar, and toothpaste

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more cosmetics

loans.name: Asha

texts.en:
Asha is a married woman with six children; all of them graduated from school. She owns a house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For over twelve years, she has operated a retail shop business, selling in a shop to her neighbours and passersby. Asha faces a major challenge of price fluctuation in her business. She hopes to expand and establish a wholesale shop in the future.

With the Kshs 50,000 she wants to purchase bales of wheat flour, maize flour and sugar. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to get financial services.

loans.use: To purchase bales of wheat flour, maize flour and sugar

loans.name: Doris

texts.en: Doris B. is a very hard-working woman. Her clothing store venue, which was provided by the local government, is spacious and neatly organized. Doria has already received and repaid one loan of Le 3,000,000, which helped her greatly to increase her stock. Since the first loan, her living conditions have improved and she is able to provide more for her family. She is now looking forward to a second loan so that she can expand her business by buying more quality textiles which are currently selling faster in the market.

loans.use: To buy more African dresses

loans.name: Naomi

texts.en:
Naomi is a married lady with two children.  For twenty years, she has been operating a food stall so as to earn a living.  She also does dairy farming for extra income.  

Naomi is a God-fearing lady who believes in hard work.  Hence she puts a lot of effort in her business.  She is a member of Githunguri Neema group in Faulu Kenya.  In the group, she is able to save her money on weekly basis.  The members of the group also guarantee each other's loan.  She has requested a loan of 50,000 Kes to buy carrots, potatoes and farm inputs.

loans.use: To buy carrots, potatoes and farm inputs

loans.name: Emmanuel

texts.en: Emmanuel K. is a hard-working businessman. He runs his business nearly 24 hours a day. He now has employed one sales assistant, who works the hours of 8:30a.m to 7:30 p.m. Emmanuel is looking forward to another loan which he will use to improve the life of his family and also to educate his niece. Emanuel also plans on re-investing some of his profits back into his business.

loans.use: To buy more food items

loans.name: Bintiomari

texts.en:
Bintiomari is a married woman with three children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food.

She has operated a charcoal-selling business, selling from home to her neighbors and passersby. Bintiomari faces a major challenge of seasonality. During the rainy season, it becomes hard to get charcoal to supply to her customers. She hopes to supply charcoal at wholesale in the future.

With the Kshs 20,000, she wants to purchase 20 sacks of charcoal for sale. She decided to join Yehu to get financial assistance.

loans.use: To  purchase 20 sacks of charcoal for sale.

loans.name: Soltonbek

texts.en:
Soltonbek S. is 55 and married. He and his wife have six children. Their youngest son lives with them and helps in the household.   

He and his wife earn their living through livestock breeding, which they started in 1995. They began this activity with the sum of 20,000 KGS and managed to maintain the farm with sheep, horses and milk cows. Using the revenue from reselling fattened livestock,  Soltonbek was able to pay for the education of his elder daughters.
 
Soltonbek works hard to make this business successful and now plans to develop it with the help of a loan of 50,000 KGS. With the revenue from this investment, Soltonbek wants to pay for the education of his younger sons. In the future, his family plans to enlarge their number of cattle. 

Bai-Tushum and Partners is one of the leading microfinance institutions in Kyrgyzstan. As a reliable financial partner, Bai-Tushum contributes to the economic development of the Kyrgyz Republic through the delivery of microfinance services in rural and urban areas that lead to increased employment and meet the interests of its clients and investors. Bai-Tushum and Partners uses Kiva funding to target the especially vulnerable population.

loans.use: To purchase cattle

loans.name: Santiago

texts.es: Santiago vive en casa de sus padres en la localidad de Achacachi capital de la provincia Omasuyos, es soltero  no tiene hijos, el señor es Cerrajero  y tiene una tienda donde comercializa CDs. Con la aprobación del crédito podrá comprar el material de construcción que necesita para construir una habitación más en la casa de sus padres. Es el primer crédito en IMPRO  también con KIVA.
texts.en: Santiago lives in his parents' home in the town of Achacachi, capital of Omasuyos province.  He is single and doesn't have any children.  He is a locksmith by trade and has a store where he sells CDs.  With this loan he will be able to buy the building supplies that he needs in order to build an extra room in his parents' house.  This is his first loan from both IMPRO and KIVA.

loans.use: To build a room in his parents' house

loans.name: Nicodemus Kioko

texts.en:
Nicodemus Kioko M. is 41 years old and married to Margaret. They have two children who are in school. 

He has been selling furniture for 17 years in Shaurimoyo estate, which is highly populated and thus provides many customers. He earns a monthly profit of KES 18,500.

He was introduced to KADET Ltd. by an old acquaintance and he is applying for his second loan of KES 80,000. He plans to use the entire amount to buy timber for making chairs, worth KES 60,000; and velvet materials, worth KES 20,000. 

With the profit earned, he plans to add more stock.

He hopes to open a big furniture shop in the future and to give the best education to his children.

loans.use: To buy materials for making chairs

loans.name: Freddy Leonel

texts.es: Freddy Leonel tiene 38 años, su actividad es brindar el servicio de construcción desde hace más de 10 años. El inicio este medio de vida debido a la necesidad que se encontraba fue que decide establecer  su propio negocio, el siempre se ha caracterizado por ser una persona muy responsable. La mayoría de sus clientes llegan a buscar los servicios que el ofrece, ya que siempre se esmera por que sus clientes se encuentren satisfechos. El motivo del financiamiento es para la compra de computadora ya que es necesario para obtener un mejor control de su actividad.
texts.en: Freddy Leonel is 38 years old.  For more than 10 years, his business has been providing building services.  He started out in this field through necessity.  He decided to set up his own business.  Freddy Leonel has always been a very responsible person.  Most of his customers come to him to request his services since he always takes care to ensure that his customers are satisfied.  He is requesting this loan to buy a computer since he needs one in order to have better control of his business.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Jannet

texts.es:
Jannet vive en casa de sus padres en la zona de Pasankeri, de la ciudad de La Paz. Ella trabaja en una limpieza y también tiene un segundo trabajo en la pequeña pensión de su hermana. Está casada y tiene un hijo.
El crédito lo utilizará para terminar la obra fina de un par de habitaciones de la casa donde vive.
Es la primera vez que solicita un crédito de IMPRO y también de Kiva.
texts.en:
Jannet lives in her parents' home in Pasankeri district, in the city of La Paz.  She works as a cleaner and also has a second job in her sister's small restaurant.  She is married and has one son.

Jannet will use her loan to cover the cost of carrying out some finishing work on a couple of rooms in her parents' home.  This is the first time that she has requested a loan from IMPRO or Kiva.

loans.use: To cover the cost of doing some finishing work on two rooms

loans.name: Paul

texts.en: Paul is 30 years old, married, and blessed with a four-year-old child.  He does dairy farming for a living.  He was previously doing crop farming.  He is able to do his farming well because the climate for Kiambu is favorable for farming.  He aspires to be a prominent farmer in the future.  He has requested 50,000 kes to buy a cow.

loans.use: To buy a cow

loans.name: Rosalia

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal”YANAPAKUY”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Rosalía; ella tiene 46 años de edad, separada y tiene 1 hijo; la socia se dedica a la venta de ropa para damas y niños la socia confecciona esta ropa para luego venderlo a sus clientes que le hacen pedido ,ella trabaja desde su casa ya hace un par de años atrás ya que la socia tiene otra ocupación ella es docente del nivel inicial ella trabaja en un jardín particular, ahora la socia puede trabajar más tiempo confeccionando ropa ya que está de vacaciones en su trabajo, la socia es una persona bien alegre y con muchas ganas de salir adelante.

La socia solicita el préstamo para la compra de materiales para su negocio como telas, hilos, agujas entre otros más. 

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Here is a member of the communal bank named "Yanapakuy". It is located in the district of Cusco and it belongs to the province of Cusco and the department of Cusco. 

Her name is Rosalia. She is 46 years old, separated, and the mother of one son. She sells ladies' and children's clothing that she makes to sell to her clients who have placed orders. She works from home and it has already been two years since she started her business. She also has another job, working as a private kindergarten teacher. She is able to dedicate more time to making clothing because she is on holidays at her other job. She is a very happy person with a great wish to get ahead.

She requests a loan to purchase materials for her business including fabrics, threads, needles, and other merchandise. 

She is happy to receive a loan and she is committed to making the payments for her loan.

loans.use: To purchase fabrics, threads, needles etc.

loans.name: Emilia

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “CENTRAL PATAQUEHUAR”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Quiquijana, perteneciente a la provincia de Quispicanchis y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Emilia; ella tiene 53 años de edad y es divorciada y tiene 5 hijo; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de cereales, la socia vende quinua, kiwicha, maíz entre otros cereales, ella vende en forma ambulatoria, la socia por medio de este negocio saca adelante a sus hijos, la socia quiere ampliar y mejorar el negocio de venta de cereales. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar cereales al por mayor. 

 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Here is a member of communal bank named "Central Pataquehuar". It is located in the district of Quiquijana, belonging to the province of Quispicanchis and in the department of Cusco. 

Her name is Emilia: She is 53 years old, divorced, and the mother of 5 children. She alternates her daily activities with the sale of cereal grains. She sells quinoa seeds, kiwicha grains, corn and other cereal grains. She makes her sales itinerantly. It is through this business that she is able to support her children. She wishes to expand and improve her cereal business. She requests a loan to purchase cereal grains in wholesale. 

She is happy to receive a loan and she is committed to making the payments of her loan.

loans.use: To purchase cereal grains in wholesale.

loans.name: Lidia

texts.es:
Lidia vive en casa de sus padres en la zona de 6 de agosto, de la ciudad de El Alto, tiene un hijo, la señora es comerciante realiza mantas las cuales las comercializa por las diferentes ferias de  la ciudad de El Alto, con los ingresos que obtienen se mantienen.
El crédito será utilizado para la compra de una máquina de coser para realizar su labor de forma más rápida y efectiva. La señora se encuentra satisfecha con los créditos que le otorgamos.

Por su antecedente histórico califica para obtener un nuevo crédito, se considera una buena cliente.
texts.en:
Lidia lives in her parents' home in '6 de Agosto' district, in the city of El Alto.  She has one son.  Lidia is a saleswoman.  She makes blankets and sells them in the markets of El Alto.  She uses the profits that she makes to support herself and her son.

Lidia will use this loan to buy a sewing machine so that she can carry out her work more quickly and efficiently.  She is satisfied with the loans that we have given her.  Her record qualifies her to obtain a new loan and she is considered a good client.

loans.use: To buy a sewing machine for her business making blankets

loans.name: Carmen Rosa

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “CENTRAL PATAQUEHUAR”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Quiquijana, perteneciente a la provincia de Quispicanchis y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Carmen Rosa; ella tiene 30 años de edad y es casada y tiene 3 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de carne, ella vende en el mercado de Quiquijana, ella vende desde las 7:00 a.m hasta las 5:00 p.m, por medio de este negocio la socia saca adelante a sus hijos, la socia quiere ampliar el negocio de carne. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar carne al por mayor.

 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Here is a member of communal bank named "Central Pataquehuar". It is located in the district of Quiquijana, belonging to the province of Quispicanchis and in the department of Cusco.

Her name is Carmen Rosa. She is 30 years old, married, and the mother of 3 children. She alternates her daily activities with her butcher shop business. She sells in the market in Quiquijana. She sells from 7am to 5pm and it is through this business that she is able to support her children. She wishes to expand her butcher shop. She requests a loan to purchase meat in wholesale. 

She is happy to receive a loan and she is committed to making the payments of her loan.

loans.use: To purchase meat in wholesale.

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal”YANAPAKUY”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Rosa; ella tiene 42 años de edad, conviviente y tiene 5 hijos; La socia tiene su negocio de carpintería, la socia trabaja conjuntamente con su pareja siendo la socia quien administra el negocio y de vez en cuando ella le ayuda a su pareja a realizar algunos acabados, la socia vende  muebles, armarios, camas, roperos entre otros mas de esta forma la socia saca a su familia adelante y se esmera a seguir con el negocio.

La socia solicita el préstamo para la compra de materiales para su carpintería como madera entre otros más.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Here is a member of the communal bank named "Yanapakuy". It is located in the district of Cusco, in the province of Cusco, and the department of Cusco. 

Her name is Rosa. She is 42 years old, married common-law, and the mother of 5 children. She has a carpentry shop. She works together with her partner and she is the administrator of the business, although every once in a while she helps her partner do some of the finishes. She sells furniture, armoires, beds, dressers and other items. It is through this business that she is able to provide for her family. She works hard to maintain her business. 

She requests a loan to purchase carpentry materials, including wood and other products.

She is happy to receive a loan and she is committed to making the payments of her loan.

loans.use: To purchase carpentry materials.

loans.name: Juana Alicia

texts.es:
La señora Juana Alicia D. es una señora actualmente casada con una edad  de 56 años honrada, responsable y emprendedora que trabaja día a día en su pulpería que mantiene desde hace 4 años. Su hijo y su nuera le apoyan en su negocio.
Su deseo como una mujer emprendedora es obtener un crédito que le permita incrementar los productos que ofrece en su Pulpería y así crecer como microempresa.
texts.en:
Juana Alicia D. is married.  She is 56 years old, honest, responsible, and hard-working.  She works day to day in her store, which she has maintained for four years.  Her son and daughter-in-law help her in her business.

As an enterprising woman, her wish is to get a loan, which will allow her to increase the products that she sells in her store.  That way she will grow as a small businesswoman.

loans.use: Basic grains

loans.name: Rimbert

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “CENTRAL PATAQUEHUAR”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Quiquijana, perteneciente a la provincia de Quispicanchis y departamento de Cusco.

El socio es el Sr. Rimbert; el tiene 32 años de edad y es conviviente y tiene 2 hijos; El socio alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de ganados, el los hace engordar y luego lo vende en forma ambulatoria, el socio quiere ampliar el negocio de venta de ganados .El  socio solicita el préstamo para comprar ganados.

El socio está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Here is a member of communal bank named "Central Pataquehuar". It is located in the district of Quiquijana, belonging to the province of Quispicanchis and in the department of Cusco.

His name is Rimbert. He is 32 years old, married common-law, and the father of 2 children. He alternates his daily activities with his livestock business. He raises his livestock and later sells them itinerantly. He wishes to expand his livestock business. He requests a loan to purchase heads of cattle. 

He is happy to receive a loan and he is committed to making the payments of that loan.

loans.use: To purchase livestock.

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en: Fatuma N. lives in the Kawempe neighborhood in the city of Kampala, Uganda.  She is married and has 2 children, both of whom are in school. Fatuma has a business selling clothes.  She has been in this business for 2 years, and she works 7 days out of every week. Fatuma sells her products at retail at the market.  Fatuma has requested a loan of 500,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more bales of clothes. The main business challenges for Fatuma include seasonality and ever-increasing prices of second-hand clothes.  Her goals and aspirations for her business are to buy a plot and build rental rooms and also to start selling at wholesale only.   Fatuma lives in a home that she rents. She has access to electricity but doesn't have access to piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include food, rent, school fees and medication.

loans.use: To buy more bales of second hand clothes

loans.name: Eliud

texts.en: Eliud is a member of Faulu Kenya under the Kagwe Faith group.  He joined the group as a businessman who does bicycle repairs.  He was previously earning a living from farming.  He has managed to grow his business through the group.  This is because the group members share business ideas and guarantee each other's loans.  In his business, he has employed one person.  He has requested 40,000 kes to buy bicycle spare parts.

loans.use: To buy bicycle spare parts

loans.name: Jamila

texts.en:
Jamila is a married woman with four children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees. 

For over ten years, she has operated a restaurant business. Her customers are neighbors and passersby. Jamila faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. She hopes to expand, and to open another restaurant in the future.

With the Kshs 80,000 she wants to purchase furniture and fittings to expand her restaurant. She decided to join Yehu because of its low interest rates.

loans.use: To purchase furniture and fittings to expand her restaurant.

loans.name: Andrea

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “CENTRAL PATAQUEHUAR”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Quiquijana, perteneciente a la provincia de Quispicanchis y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Andrea; ella tiene 32 años de edad y es casada y tiene 4 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de frutas, ella vende distintas variedad de frutas como manzana, naranjas, uvas, plátanos entre otras frutas, al socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m, la socia quiere ampliar y mejorar el negocio de venta de frutas. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar frutas al por mayor.

 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Here is a member of communal bank named "Central Pataquehuar". It is located in the district of Quiquijana, belonging to the province of Quispicanchis and in the department of Cusco.

Her name is Andrea. She is 32 years old, married, and the mother of 4 children. She alternates her daily activities with her produce business. She sells a variety of fruits such as apples, grapes, bananas, and other fruits. She works from 8am to 5pm. She wishes to expand and improve her produce business. She requests a loan to purchase fruit in wholesale. 

She is happy to receive a loan and she is committed to making the payments of that loan.

loans.use: To purchase fruits in wholesale.

loans.name: Aurelia Bibiana

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal”YANAPAKUY”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Aurelia Bibiana; ella tiene 50 años de edad, conviviente y tiene 4 hijos; La socia tiene su negocio de tienda de abarrotes ella vende productos de primera necesidad como arroz, azúcar, leche entre otros productos más, la socia lleva años en este negocio del cual se siente feliz ya que mediante este la socia saca a su familia adelante y espera seguir así, la socia es una persona bien optimista y con muchas ganas de seguir trabajando. 

La socia solicita el préstamo para la compra de más mercadería para su tienda de abarrotes.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Here is a member of the communal bank named "Yanapakuy". It is located in the district of Cusco, in the province of Cusco, and the department of Cusco. 

Her name is Aurelia Bibiana. She is 50 years old, married common-law, and the mother of 4 children. She has a convenience store from where she sells basic needs products such as rice, sugar, milk and other products. She has years in the business and she feels very happy with it because she is able to support her family through it, and she hopes to keep up. She is a very optimistic person who wants very much to keep working. 

She requests a loan to purchase more products for her convenience store. 

She is happy to receive a loan and she is committed to making the payments of that loan.

loans.use: To purchase grocery store merchandise for resale.

loans.name: Mi Barquito Group

texts.es:
El grupo Mi Barquito lo conforman María Luisa L. M., Rosa Emilia L., María Auxiliadora Rivas, Engracia M. Reyes y Vilma C. Bonilla cinco mujeres trabajadoras y esforzadas. La coordinadora del grupo es la señora L. M. de 36 años propietaria de una pequeña pulpería desde hace 4 años el cual desea convertir en una miscelánea.
Ella inicio vendiendo sandalias y zapatos para sacar a delante a sus tres hijos de 6, 9 y 12 años los cuales iniciaran pronto a clases.
Rosa L. de 32 años vende cosméticos y zapatos desde hace tres años, María Rivas vende productos Avon con el fin de tener un ingreso extra además de su trabajo, Engracia M. comercializa cosméticos y ropa y Vilma C. realiza nacatamales comida típica a base de cerdo, hielos y helados.
texts.en:
The “Mi Barquito” (My Little Boat) group is comprised of María Luisa L. M., Rosa Emilia L., María Auxiliadora Rivas, Engracia M. Reyes, and Vilma C. Bonilla.  They are five dedicated and hard-working women.

Mrs. L. M., age 36, is the coordinator of the group.  She has had a small grocery store for four years, and she wishes to convert it to a general store.  She started out selling sandals and shoes in order to get her three children ahead.  Her children are 6, 9, and 12 years old, and they start classes soon.

Rosa L., age 32, has been selling cosmetics and shoes for three years.  María Rivas sells Avon products in order to have an extra income in addition to her work.  Engracia M. sells cosmetics and clothes.  Vilma C. makes “nacatamales”, a typical dish made from pork.  She also makes ices and ice cream.

loans.use: Basic grains

loans.name: Irma

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “CENTRAL PATAQUEHUAR”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Quiquijana, perteneciente a la provincia de Quispicanchis y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Irma; ella tiene 34 años de edad y es soltera y tiene 4 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de verduras y también se dedica al servicio de Wawa Wasi (es como una cuna jardín donde se cuida bebes y niños),la socia tiene pequeños terrenos de cultivo donde siembra maíz, papa y verduras y luego los vende en los diferentes ferias que se realiza en el distrito de Quiquijana, la socia quiere ampliar el negocio de venta de verduras. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar semillas y fertilizantes para las tierras de cultivo.

 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Here is a member of communal bank named "Central Pataquehuar". It is located in the district of Quiquijana, belonging to the province of Quispicanchis and in the department of Cusco.

Her name is Irma. She is 34 years old, single, and the mother of 4 children. She alternates her daily activities with the sale of produce and she also has a Wawa Wasi business (like a daycare where she takes care of babies and children). She has small plots of land where she cultivates corn, potatoes, and vegetables that she later sells at the various fairs that take place in the district of Quiquijana. She wants to expand her produce business. She requests a loan to purchase seeds and fertilizers for her fields. 

She is happy to receive a loan and she is committed to making the payments of that loan.

loans.use: To purchase seeds and fertilizers.

loans.name: Harriet

texts.en:
Harriet N. lives in the Kawaala neighborhood in the city of Kampala, Uganda.  She is single and has 6 children, all of whom are in school.  Harriet has a business of a restaurant.  She has been in this business for 5 years, and she works 7 days out of every week. Harriet sells her products at the market, by means of retail.  Harriet  has requested  fora loan of 500,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more bunches of bananas, sweet and Irish potatoes, and beef. She also generates additional income through rental rooms. 
The main business challenges for Harriet include seasonality and defaulters. Her goals and aspirations for her business are to own a fully stocked restaurant, and to build her own house.  Harriet lives in a home that she owns.  She has access to electricity and doesn't have access to piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include food, rent and school fees.

loans.use: To buy more bunches of bananas, sweet and Irish potatoes, and beef

loans.name: Josefina

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal”YANAPAKUY”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Josefina; ella tiene 25 años de edad, conviviente y tiene 1 hijo; La socia tiene su negocio de restaurante ella brinda los servicios de almuerzo y cena la socia está a cargo de la administración de este negocio y a veces ella también cocina esta es una actividad que le gusta mucho realizar y de paso ella está más tiempo con su hijo sin tener un horario de oficina, la socia es una persona bien optimista y con muchas ganas de seguir adelante.

La socia solicita el préstamo para la compra de más insumos para su negocio como aceite, arroz, azúcar, menestras entre otros más.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota
texts.en:
Here is a member of the communal bank named "Yanapakuy". It is located in the district of Cusco, in the province of Cusco, and the department of Cusco.

Her name is Josefina. She is 25 years old, married common-law, and the mother of one son. She has a restaurant and she serves lunch and dinner. She takes care of the administration of the business and sometimes she also does the cooking, something she really enjoys to do. She is also able to spend time with her son because she doesn’t have an office schedule. She is a very optimistic person, with a great desire to get ahead.

She is happy to receive a loan and she is committed to making the payments of that loan.

loans.use: To purchase ingredients for her restaurant.

loans.name: Julio

texts.es:
Julio vive en casa de sus Padres cuyo domicilio esta ubicado en la ciudad de El Alto, zona Huayna Potosi. El tiene una tienda comercial a la vez vende celulares en la ciudad de El Alto, su esposa tiene la mima actividad comercial. Es su principal fuente de ingreso para su manutención. El tiene dos hijos. 
 
El préstamo lo destinara para la compra de calaminas, clavos y vigas para reparar los techos de la casa, lo cual le permitirá mejorar su habitat.
 
Es primer crédito con Impro.
texts.en:
Julio lives in his parents’ house, which is located in the city of El Alto in the Huayna Potosi zone.  He has a commercial store, and he also sells cell phones in the city of El Alto.  His wife has the same commercial activity.  It is the main source of income that provides financial support.  He has two children.

The loan is to buy corrugated roofing, nails, and beams to repair the roof of the house.  This will allow him to improve his dwelling.

This is his first loan with Impro.

loans.use: To buy materials to repair the roof of his parents' house

loans.name: Peter

texts.en: Peter is a married man with three children.  He earns his living from mixed farming.  He is able to educate his children with the income he gets from his business.  He hopes to improve his business in the future and become financially independent.   With the loan of 40, 000 Kes, he will buy a dairy cow and farm inputs.

loans.use: To buy a dairy cow and farm inputs

loans.name: Saturnino

texts.es:
Saturnino vive en la casa propia cuyo domicilio esta ubicado en la localidad de Caluyo. El señor se trabaja como ayudante del equipo de perforación de una empresa constructora. Es su principal fuente de ingreso para su manutención. El tiene tres hijos y es casado.
 
El préstamo lo destinara para la compra de una vaca lechera para comenzar el negocio de la venta de leche a la planta industrializadora PIL.
 
Es primer crédito con Impro y el análisis socio-económico lo califica como sujeto de crédito.
texts.en:
Saturnino lives in his own home in the town of Caluyo.  He works as an assistant in a drilling team for a construction company.  This is his main source of income with which he supports himself.

Saturnino will use his loan to buy a dairy cow, so that he can start a business selling milk to PIL (a milk processing plant).

This is Saturnino's first loan with Impro and the socio-economic analysis we have performed qualifies him to receive a loan.

loans.use: To buy a dairy cow so that he can start a milk sales business

loans.name: Mejumaa

texts.en:
Mejumaa is a married woman with three children, all of whom attend school. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For over ten years, she has operated a tailoring business from home. Her customers are neighbors, especially ladies. Mejumaa faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. During the holiday season, the demand for clothes is high, while during the months of January to July, the demand is lower. She hopes to establish a dressmaking school in the future.

With the Kshs 30,000 she wants to purchase cloth materials and a sewing machine for her tailoring business. She decided to join Yehu because of its good customer relations.

loans.use: To purchase cloth materials and a sewing machine for her tailoring business.

loans.name: Roger Alberto

texts.es: El señor Roger R. es obrero trabaja en la Alcaldía de Managua como operario de limpieza de la comunidad, tiene dos hijos en edad escolar, solicita este financiamiento para compra de útiles escolares y pago de matrícula de sus hijos
texts.en: Roger R. works for the City of Managua as a cleaning operative.  He has two school-age children.  Roger is requesting this loan so that he can buy school supplies for his children and pay their school fees.

loans.use: To pay school fees

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy bread in bulk which she will then sell

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en: Beatrice  was born in 1974.  She is a mother of four children.  The youngest is two years old while the eldest is nineteen years . Two of her children are in school, and the other two are not in school because she currently can’t afford to pay all their school fees. Beatrice sells charcoal, and she is requesting a loan in order to buy more sacks of charcoal. She hopes to put her children in school with the profits she hopes to make.

loans.use: Buying more charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Claudine

texts.en:
Claudine owns a business that sells hardware. She is 35 years old, married and has three children. Her husband and she work together. Claudine  has been selling hardware for four years.  

Her loan will be used to buy to buy more metal items,such as wires and plumbing supplies. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to build a house and rent that house out to generate  more revenue. She dreams of having either fifteen or twenty million Rwandan francs  as her capital in the future.

loans.use: To buy more wires and plumbing supplies to sell

loans.name: Constance

texts.en:
Constance is 50 years old, married, and has six children between thirteen and twenty-five years old. Her six children go school.  Constance sells grocery products, which she has done for six years. Her husband is now a retired elderly man. 

Constance will use the loan to add more products to her inventory like beans, potatoes, cooking oil, rice, sugar, and flour.  With the new profits from her expanded business, Constance plans to increase the quantity of sales and expand her business. In the future, she would like to see her children complete their studies with the help of her business.

loans.use: To add more merchandise, especially beans, potatoes, cooking oil, etc.

loans.name: Guerrero Group

texts.es:
El grupo Guerrero lo conforman cuatro mujeres trabajadoras, emprendedoras y esforzadas, una de ellas es Estela S., coordinadora del grupo.  Esta señora  de 31 años es propietaria de una mini pulpería la cual inicio con la venta de recarga hace tres años y poco a poco fue surtiendo su negocio con productos como chiverías, gaseosas y granos básico. 

Ella expreso que se siente apoyada por su familia ya que tanto su esposo como su pequeña hija de 7 años le ayuda en sus tiempos libres.

Las otras integrantes del grupo son Lucila G. de 47 años quien vende leña, Catalina S. vende tomates de manera ambulante y desea tener un tramo y Arlen H. comercializa tomates desde hace dos años.
texts.en:
The 'Guerrero' (Warrior) group is made up of four hard-working, enterprising women.  One of them is Estela S. who is the group's coordinator.  This 31 year-old lady is the owner of a small grocery store.  She started out in her business three years ago, selling pre-paid cell phone cards and then gradually began to stock her business with products such as snacks, soda and basic grains.

Estela tells us that she feels supported by her family since both her husband and her 7 year-old daughter help out in their spare time.

The other members of this group are 47 year-old Lucila G., who sells firewood; Catalina S., who sells tomatoes as an itinerant street vendor and would like to own a spot from which to make her sales; and Arlen H. who has been selling tomatoes for two years.

loans.use: To buy basic grains

loans.name: Francis

texts.en: Francis lives in Kiambu where he does farming.  He has been a farmer for nine years.  Through farming, he is able to provide for his family.  He is also educating his two children who are in school. He dreams of being a prosperous businessman in the future.  With the loan of 40,000 Kes, he will buy a dairy cow.

loans.use: To buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Vestine

texts.en:
Vestine is 45 years old, a widow with four children who are seventeen and twenty-four for the youngest and oldest respectively. Currently, four of her children attend school.

Vestine sells fish, which she has done for ten years. Vestine will use this new loan to purchase more fish to sell.  With the new profits from her expanded business, Vestine is expecting to build a house. She wishes to have a big sum of money in the future for the growth of her business.

loans.use: To buy enough volume of fish to sell

loans.name: Sebastian Antonio

texts.es: Sebastián tiene 52 años su negocio es brindar el servicio de música y anuncios en la calle, es un hombre muy trabajador y que busca la forma de generar ingresos para su hogar. Inicio este medio de vida hace 6 años, la experiencia obtenida con su negocio ha sido muy reconfortante, su hijo le ayuda en lo que puede de su negocio ya que a su hijo también le gusta mucho este negocio. el motivo de su financiamiento es para la compra de parlantes, cables, discos y Dvd que son necesarios.
texts.en: Sebastián is 52 years old.  His business is providing music and street announcement services.  He is a very hard-working man who is seeking ways to make income for his household.  He started in this business 6 years ago and the experience he has gained has made him very happy.  His son helps him in the business as much as he can since he also really enjoys this line of business.  Sebastián is requesting this loan to buy speakers, cables, records and DVDs that he needs.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Edgar

texts.es:
Edgar vive en la casa propia cuyo domicilio esta ubicado en la localidad de Pucarani. El señor se dedica a la crianza de ganado ubicada en el mismo domicilio. Es su principal fuente de ingreso para su manutención. El tiene tres hijos.
 
El préstamo lo destinara para la compra de una vaca lechera para mejorar sus ingresos por concepto de venta de leche a la Planta Industrializadora de leche PIL.
 
Es primer crédito con Impro y será canalizado a través de Kiva..
texts.en:
Edgar lives in his own house, located in the vicinity of Pucarani. He is dedicated to raising cows at the place of his residence. This is the principal source of income for the maintenance of Edgar and his 3 children.

The loan will be used to buy a milk cow to improve his income. Edgar sells milk to the Industrial Milk Plant, PIL. This is his first loan with Impro and it is being channeled through Kiva.

loans.use: TO BUY A MILK COW TO IMPROVE HIS INCOME FROM MILK SALES

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en: Rebecca is 58 years old, a widow, with two children. Currently, both her children are married. Rebecca sells fruit, which she has done for seventeen years. Rebecca will use the loan to purchase more fruit and vegetables such as tomatoes and onions.  With the new profits from her expanded business, Rebecca plans to buy goats and hens for rearing but to be sold in the future to get more income.

loans.use: To buy more vegetables, mainly tomatoes and onions, to sell.

loans.name: Dominique Xavier

texts.en:
Dominique Xavier is 28 years old, married and has as yet no children. Dominique Xavier owns a hardware shop, which he has done for eight years. His wife has no specific occupation because she is still a bride. 

Dominique Xavier will use the loan to add more metal items to sell. With the new profits from his expanded business, Dominique Xavier plans to re-invest in his hardware business. He would like to have a capital of two million in the future for further growth of his business.

loans.use: To buy more metal items to sell

loans.name: Hilaria

texts.es:
Hilaria vive en casa de sus padres en la zona Sopocachi, de la ciudad de La Paz, es soltera y tiene dos hijo menores de edad, la señora es profesora de primaria en una unidad educativa de esta ciudad,  con los ingresos que obtiene se mantienen.
El crédito será utilizado para la construcción de una cocina, requisito para la instalación de gas en su domicilio. 
Es la primera vez que presenta una solicitud de créditos.

Por su estudio socio económico califica para obtener un nuevo crédito.
texts.en:
Hilaria lives in her parents' home in the Sopocachi region of La Paz.  She is single and has two young children.  Hilaria is a primary school teacher in a city educational unit.  The family is supported by her teaching income.
This loan will be used to construct a kitchen, which is required for the installation of a gas line in her home.
This is the first time Hilaria has requested a loan.

Because of her socio-economic study, she qualifies for obtaining a new loan.

loans.use: For the construction of a kitchen in her home so that she can have a direct gas line installed and no longer have to buy gas cylinders.

loans.name: Mwanasada

texts.en:
Mwanasada is a widow with four children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

She operates a fruit selling business, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. Mwanasada faces a major challenge of competition in her business. She hopes to increase sales to generate more revenue in the future.

With the Kshs 15,000 she wants to purchase fruits and flavourings for making natural soft drinks for sale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to improve her livelihood.

loans.use: To purchase fruits and flavourings for making natural soft drinks for sale

loans.name: Theodosie

texts.en:
Theodosie is 30 years old, married and has two children who are three and five. Both her children attend school. Theodosie sells grocery items such as sugar, maize flour, and rice, which she has done for nine years. Her husband is a soldier.  

Theodosie will use the loan to add more merchandise such as sugar, maize flour, and rice.  With the new profits from her expanded business, Theodosie plans to build a house and rent that house out to generate more revenue in the future.

loans.use: To buy more items to sell such as sugar, maize flour, rice, etc.

loans.name: Jeanne D Arc

texts.en: Jeanne d'Arc owns a business that sells charcoal. She is 34 years old, married, and has three children with one other dependent and her children and her dependent are enrolled in school. Her husband works as a mechanic. Jeanne d'Arc has been selling charcoal for one year.  Her new loan will be used to buy more charcoal to sell. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to reinvest in the charcoal business. She dreams of having a capital of five millions in years to come.

loans.use: To buy more sacks of charcoal to sell

loans.name: Soy Tu Dueña Group

texts.es:
El grupo Soy tu Dueña está conformado por tres féminas trabajadoras y esforzadas una de ellas es Rosa Argentina L. Pérez quien vende gaseosa en el cafetín frente a la terminal de la 158, Camilo Ortega. L. es madre y padre de dos hijos de 10 y 7 años por los cuales labora arduamente.
Las otras integrantes del grupo son Ernestina del Socorro Hernández de 53 años vende carne por las mañanas y pan por las tardes, y Marisol S. tiene una pequeña venta de granos básicos.
texts.en:
The 'Soy tu Dueña' group is made up of three hard-working women.  One of them is Rosa Argentina L. Pérez who sells soda from a small café opposite the route 158 public transport terminus, in Camilo Ortega neighborhood.  L. is both mother and father to her two children aged 10 and 7, for whom she works very hard.

The other members of this group are 53 year-old Ernestina del Socorro Hernández who sells meat in the mornings and bread in the afternoons and Marisol S. who has a small business selling basic grains.

loans.use: To buy bread, soft drinks, soda, etc.

loans.name: Fredrick

texts.en: Fredrick is a member of Mamu group under Faulu Kenya.  He has been farming for five years.  He mainly does dairy farming.  He was previously growing tea.  He is a very hard-working businessman who hopes to expand his business in the future.  He has previously serviced two loans from Faulu Kenya.  He has requested another loan of 20,000 Kes.  He will use the loan to buy a dairy cow.

loans.use: To buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Odette

texts.en: Odette owns a business that offers secretarial services. She is 42 years old, married, and has no children. Her husband works in private ownership. Odette has been working in this business for ten years.  Her loan will be used to buy photocopiers and scholastic materials to sell. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to further expand her business and have a nice location for her business in the future.

loans.use: To add more photocopiers and scholastic materials to sell

loans.name: Emilia

texts.es: La señora Emilia tiene 48 años, es casada y tiene 2 hijos, mayores de edad. Ella se dedica a la venta de mercadería en general. Por lo que es una madre muy responsable y quería que sus hijos obtuvieran la oportunidad de estudiar. Por lo que desde la edad de 26 años Emilia inicio este negocio, ella con el poco capital que obtenía por medio de su esposo logro ahorrar algo de dinero. Ella tenía que buscar el medio de sobrevivir con sus hijos y su familia. Y así Emilia no se rindió y ahora tiene este negocio. En la actualidad solicita este financiamiento que será invertido en la compra de mercancías para aprovechar el incremento de las ventas en los meses venideros. Su sueño es crecer en su negocio de tal forma que con el tiempo le permita llegar a establecer una pulpería en su casa de habitación.
texts.en:
