Señora Emilia is 48 years old. She is married and has two adult children. She sells general merchandise. Because she is a very responsible mother who wanted her children to have the opportunity to go to school, she began this business at the age of 26, using the little capital that she obtained from her husband, and she managed to save some money. She had to look for a means of surviving with her children and her family. And thus Emilia didn't give up and now she has this business. 

Now she is applying for financing that will be invested in the purchase of merchandise to take advantage of the increase in sales in the coming months. Her dream is to increase her business in such a way that in time she will be able to establish a grocery store in her home.

loans.use: Working capital to stock merchandise.

loans.name: Mayra Esperanza

texts.es: La señora Mayra G. M. es casada tiene un hijo el cual está en edad escolar , ella trabaja en IMFARSA como conserje, realizando la limpieza de la institución, sus créditos han sido para ir mejorando su casa ya que la tenía un poco deteriorada, por esta razón me siento agradecida por la atención brindada por CEPRODEL en mi desarrollo familiar.
texts.en: Mrs. Mayra G. M. is married, and has one school-age son. She works as a janitor at IMFARSA, cleaning the building. Her loans have been used to improve her home, as it is a bit rundown. She is thankful for the assistance provided by CEPRODEL in helping her family.

loans.use: Home improvements, purchase construction materials.

loans.name: Adjoa

texts.en:
Adjoa A. sells food supplies like 'gari' (quick-cooking cassava grits) at Breman near Elmina. Adjoa has not received any formal education. She is married and has three children. Her husband is a farmer. 

Adjoa has been selling food supplies like 'gari' for four years. She assists her husband in supporting the household. Her loan will be added to her initial capital to buy more food supplies for sale. She plans to reinvest her new profit.

loans.use: buy more food supplies for sale

loans.name: Solange

texts.en:
Solange owns a business that sells clothes for kids. She is 47 years old, a widow, and has three children and one other dependent. Her three children are between sixteen and twenty-five years old. Both her children and the dependent go to school. 

Solange has been selling clothes of kids for fourteen years.  The loan she has requested will be used to add more clothes to sell. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to reinvest in her business for the growth of the business. She would like to get more loans in the future.

loans.use: To add more clothes to sell to her inventory

loans.name: Rosaly

texts.es:
La Sra. Rosaly C. H. vive en casa familiar en la que comparte los gastos de servicios. La clienta es madre soltera de la cual percibe una mensualidad por parte del padre de su hijo. Se dedica a la venta de ropa hace un año aproximadamente y no cuenta con un local propio. Realiza dicha labor dado que necesita mas tiempo para el cuidado de su menor hijo.
Requiere del préstamo para invertir mas en su negocio y así brindar una mejor calidad de vida a su familia.
Cuenta con buenas referencias personales y cuenta con capacidad de pago.
texts.en:
Mrs. Rosaly C. H. lives in her family home, where she shares the expenses. She is a single mother, and receives a monthly contribution from her son's father. She has been working in clothing sales for about one year, but does not have her own locale. She does this work because she needs more time to care for her son. 
She needs this loan to invest more in her business, and achieve a better quality of life for her family.
She has good personal references, and the ability to repay.

loans.use: Business capital

loans.name: Faida

texts.en:
Faida is 28 years old, married, and has two children who are five and seven years old. Both of her children attend school. Faida sells charcoal, which she has been doing for a period of seven years. Her husband works as a house builder. 

Faida will use the new loan to purchase more charcoal to sell.  With the new profits from her expanded business, Faida plans to set up a shop and continue to reinvest in the business of charcoal. In the future, she would wish to see all her children go further in their studies, assuming she will be able to pay school fees for them.

loans.use: To buy more charcoal to sell

loans.name: Egidia

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “CENTRAL PATAQUEHUAR”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Quiquijana, perteneciente a la provincia de Quispicanchis y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Egidia; ella tiene 49 años de edad y es casada y tiene 4 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de productos secos y venta de animales, la socia se dedica a los dos pequeños negocios, la socia vende los productos secos y animales en el mercado de Quiquijana, la socia trabaja desde las 6:00 a.m hasta las 5:00 p.m, la socia quiere ampliar el negocio de venta de productos secos y venta de animales. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar animales y productos secos.

 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Here is a member of communal bank named "Central Pataquehuar". It is located in the district of Quiquijana, belonging to the province of Quispicanchis and in the department of Cusco.

Her name is Egidia. She is 49 years old, married, and the mother of 4 children. She alternates her daily activities with her business selling dried goods and livestock sales. She manages both businesses. She sells dried goods and her livestock at the market in Quiquijana. She works from 6am to 5pm. She wishes to expand her business selling dried goods and livestock sales. She requests a loan to purchase livestock and dried goods. 

She is happy to receive a loan and she is committed to making the payments of that loan.

loans.use: To purchase livestock and dried goods.

loans.name: Innocente

texts.en: Innocente is 34 years old, married, and has four children. Currently, three of her children attend school.  Innocente sells meat, which she has done for 12 years. Her husband is a driver.  Innocente will use the loan to buy more meat to sell.  With the new profits from her expanded business, Innocente plans to buy more houses to rent out because currently she has more than one house she rent out to tenants. She dreams of having poultry in the future.

loans.use: To buy more meat to sell

loans.name: Ama

texts.en:
Ama A. is married and has three children. She sells food supplies like 'gari' (quick-cooking cassava grits) and maize for sale at Elmina. Her husband is a farmer. Ama uses her income to assist her husband with the general upkeep of the home.

 Ama will use the loan to purchase more sacks of 'gari' and maize for resale. With the new profits from her expanded business, Ama plans to re-invest into the food selling business.

loans.use: purchase more sacks of 'gari' and maize for resale

loans.name: Victor Raul

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “CENTRAL PATAQUEHUAR”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Quiquijana, perteneciente a la provincia de Quispicanchis y departamento de Cusco.

El socio es el Sr. Víctor Raul; el tiene 56 años de edad y es conviviente y tiene 1 hijo; El socio alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de crianza de animales menores como pollos, cuyes y chanchos, el socio vende en forma ambulatoria, por medio de este negocio el socio saca adelante a sus hijos, el socio quiere ampliar el negocio de venta de animales. El  socio solicita el préstamo para comprar animales.

El socio está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Here is a member of communal bank named "Central Pataquehuar". It is located in the district of Quiquijana, belonging to the province of Quispicanchis and in the department of Cusco.

His name is Victor Raul. He is 56 years old, married common-law, and the father of one son. He alternates his daily activities with his business raising small livestock such as chicken, guinea pigs, and pigs. He makes his sales itinerantly and it is through this business that he is able to support his children. He wishes to expand his livestock business. He requests a loan to purchase livestock. 

He is happy to have this loan and he is committed to making the payments.

loans.use: To purchase livestock.

loans.name: Efua

texts.en:
Efua B. cooks food for sale: she fries plantains and cooks beans. The combination of fried ripe plantains and beans is what we popularly call 'red-red'. It is very delicious and loved by every Ghanaian. 

Efua has four children. She has been in this business for 5 years. She is responsible for the well-being of her household. Her loan will be used to buy more plantains, fish, beans and other ingredients for the preparation of food for sale. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to build a canteen. In this picture, Efua is taking some of the fried plantains out of the oil.

loans.use: buy more plantains, fish, beans and other ingredients

loans.name: Andres

texts.es:
el sr. Andrés C. U. cuenta con un negocio de venta de abarrotería y productos lácteos, su negocio opera bajo el nombre de ”PULPERIA LAS COLINAS” tiene 5 años de dedicarse a este tipo de actividad, durante todo este tiempo a sido una fuente de generación de ingresos para su hogar, también se dedica a la caficultura lo que le a permitido contribuir y apoyar mas a su familia con los gastos familiares, El Sr. C. es muy conocido en la zona por ser una persona de buenas costumbres.
el credito lo utilizara para la compra de granos básicos, abarroteria y productos lácteos como ser queso , mantequilla y quesillo, de esta manera satisfacer la demanda de sus clientes. 
Se siente muy feliz ya que su negocio a crecido.
texts.en:
Mr. Andres C. U. has a grocery store and milk sales business. The name of his business is "Pulperia Las Colinas". He has 5 years in the business and through all this time it has been a source of income for his household. He also has a coffee plantation and it has allowed him to provide for his family’s expenses. Mr. C. is very well known in his community, for being someone with good habits. 

His loan will be used to purchase basic grains, grocery merchandise and milk products, such as cheese, butter, and curds, in order to satisfy client demands. 

He is very happy because his business has grown.

loans.use: To purchase general store merchandise for resale.

loans.name: Maria Raquel

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal”YANAPAKUY”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. María Raquel; ella tiene 35 años de edad, casada y tiene 1 hijo; La socia tiene su negocio de venta de jugos ella vende de forma ambulatoria la socia realiza diferentes tipos de jugos como de papaya, plátano con leche, fresas con leche entre otros más la socia está feliz ya que este es un negocio extra que tiene ya que la socia también trabaja en un restaurante en el distrito de Cachimayo ella trabaja los fines de semana y los días hábiles esta con su negocio de jugueria aunque este horario puede variar, la socia está feliz con sus dos trabajos ya que mediante estos ella saca a su familia adelante.

La socia solicita el préstamo para la compra de más insumos para su negocio como papayas, plátanos, naranjas, fresas, entre otros más.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Here is a member of communal bank named "Central Pataquehuar". It is located in the district of Quiquijana, belonging to the province of Quispicanchis and in the department of Cusco.

Her name is Maria Raquel. She is 35 years old, married, and the mother of one son. She sells fresh fruit drinks itinerantly. She sells various types of drinks such as papaya, banana with milk, strawberries with milk, and others. She is very happy with this extra business. She also has a restaurant business in the district of Cachimayo which she runs on the weekends. On weekdays she carries out the sale of juices although her schedule can change. She is happy to have both jobs because it is through them that she is able to support her family. 

She requests a loan to purchase more ingredients for her business including papayas, bananas, oranges, strawberries, and other products.

She is happy with the loan and she is committed to making the payments.

loans.use: To purchase ingredients to make fresh fruit drinks.

loans.name: Ama

texts.en:
Ama A. sells food supplies like maize and plantains and she also makes 'gari' (quick-cooking cassava grits) for sale at Breman near Elmina.  She is married and has four children.  Her husband deals in electronics. She assists her husband with the payment of the family's expenses. Her loan will be used to buy more food supplies and also cassava to make 'gari' for sale. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to re-invest back into the food selling business.

To prepare 'gari', she gets fresh raw cassava from the market. She washes and peels the cassava, and then sends it to the mill to be milled into dough.
She puts the dough in a sack and places heavy stones or wood on it. The stones are placed to drain the starch out of the dough. She leaves the dough for a day or two depending on the weight of the stones.

After this process, she stir-fries the 'gari' in a pan on a fire. The 'gari' is then left to cool and bagged in small bags for sale. 

'Gari' is a starchy food  that is mostly enjoyed by students and large families in Ghana. Students eat 'gari' a lot because it is a quick and easy food to prepare. They soak 'gari' mix with condensed milk and water and sometimes add peanuts. Some students also prepare 'gari' in the form of dough and eat it with pepper sauce and sardines.

Families also eat 'gari' for lunch or supper, usually served with soup or pepper sauce. The soups that mostly accompany 'gari' are okra soup, groundnut (peanut) soup, palm nut soup, and vegetable soup. Various sauces can be eaten with 'gari' such as pepper sauce, curry sauce, and tomato sauce. The variety of the sauce served with 'gari' depends on the family’s preferences. Any kind of meat or fish can be eaten with these soups and sauces.

Ama is demonstrating how she squeezes the water out of the cassava dough in the sacks.

loans.use: buy more food supplies and cassava to make 'gari' for sale

loans.name: Ercilia Irene

texts.es:
La Sra. Ercilia Irene Cáceres C. tiene 27 años de edad, se dedica al servicio de fotocopiadoras, anillados, venta de artículos de oficina; cuenta con experiencia en el rubro hace dos años. 
Vive en casa familiar con sus padres y hernmanos. Recibe el apoyo para el crecimiento de su negocio por parte de sus padres ya que ellos se dedican a la agricultura. 
Cuenta con buenas referencias y con capacidad de pago.
Se le otorga el crédito dado que es una persona muy trabajadora con deseos de superación.
texts.en:
Ercilia Irene C. C. is 27 years old and works in photocopying services, binding, and office supply sales. She has 2 years' experience in this area.
She lives in her family home with her parents and siblings. Her parents, who work in agriculture, support the growth of her business.
She has good references, and the ability to repay.
She has received this loan because she is a very hardworking person who wants to get ahead.

loans.use: Business capital

loans.name: Jessica Del Socorro

texts.es: Jessica del Socorro ella se dedica a brindar el servicio de cosméticos y un  mini cyber ubicado en su casa de habitación. Anteriormente ya había solicitado créditos con el fin de invertir en su negocio, siempre está pensando en mejorar la condición de su actividad, ya que es por medio de su negocio que mantiene a su familia. Ella ha buscado la forma de mejorar cada día para proporciónale a su familia lo necesario con estos dos negocios. Este crédito es para la compra de cosméticos, papeles y artículos necesarios para su negocio.
texts.en: Jessica del Socorro works in cosmetics, and has a small cyber cafe located in her home. She has previously requested loans to invest in her business, she is always concerned with improving her business, as she maintains her family through this business. She looks for ways to improve every day, so she can provide her family with what they need through these 2 businesses. This loan will be used to purchase cosmetics, papers, and other items necessary for her business.

loans.use: Business capital

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more bags of used clothes

loans.name: Mario Antolino

texts.es:
el sr. Mario Antolino Z. M. se dedica a la venta madera de pino, cedro, caoba, laurel y a la venta de materiales para la construcción  El Sr. Mario Antolino tiene varios años de dedicarse a este tipo de actividad,  siendo la venta de madera la de mayor fuente de ingresos que el tiene y para las temporadas de siembra de granos básicos, también aprovecha a sembrar para dejar una parte para el consumo y el resto la vende.
Con los ingresos que su negocio le deja cubre las necesidades de su familia.
Por los momentos no cuenta con el capital de trabajo suficiente para realizar algunas reparaciones de su vehículo.
el credito lo utilizara para la compra de repuestos para vehiculo y madera.
en su pick up transporta la madera y los materiales de construccion que el vende.
texts.en:
Mr. Mario Antolino Z. M. sells various types of wood, including pine, cedar, mahogany, and laurel, and he also sells other construction materials.  Mario Antolino has many years in the business, that is to say the sale of wood. It is his primary source of income and during the specific seasons he harvests basic grains. He takes some of his product for their own consumption and he sells the rest. 

The income form his business is enough to provide for his family's needs. 

Currently he doesn't have enough working capital to carry out some maintenance repairs to his car. 

The loan will be used to purchase spare parts for his car and to purchase wood. 

He transports his wood and construction materials destined for sale with his pickup truck.

loans.use: To buy spare parts to repair his pickup truck and to buy wood.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Ama

texts.en: Ama A. sells food supplies like 'gari' (made out of cassava) and maize for sale at Breman near Elmina. Ama has received no formal education. She is married and has one child. Her husband is a farmer. Ama has been selling food supplies like 'gari' and maize for 5 years. She assists her husband with the payment of the family's expenses. Her loan will be used to buy more food supplies for sale. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to save towards the education of her child.

loans.use: buy more food supplies for sale

loans.name: Pinotecpan Group

texts.es:
El Grupo “Pinotecpan” se ubica en un conocido barrio de la población de Pinotepa Nacional Oaxaca, las integrantes del grupo decidieron por este nombre, que de acuerdo a la etimología de Pinotepa es el nombre por el cual se conoció en la época de la colonia, pinotecpan significa; “Lugar donde tiene sus palacios los señores pinomes” pinomes, se dice que fue una raza de salvajes que habitaron antes de las conquistas por parte de los imperios de mesoamerica y según datos, ésta provenía del norte del país y tenia algunas cualidades de los indios siux jocanos, también conocidos como indios cheroqui, los pinomes fueron sometidos por los mexicas a quienes le pagaban tributo y fueron ellos quines le pusieron este nombre a la población, para después ser sometidos por la cultura zapoteca y al final por los mixtecas quienes se quedaron con el dominio de este pueblo hasta la llegada de los españoles a esta zona, quienes trajeron esclavos africanos y las demás costumbres. Cabe mencionar que Pinotepa fue una de las zonas mas ricas de la época prehispánica y colonial, existen datos y vestigios de que en Pinotepa se obtenían los mejores telares, la producción del cacao, sal, algodón, guajolotes, grana cochinilla y el añil, así como diferentes plumajes de aves que habitaron en la zona, todavía podemos observar en sus alrededores que los pueblos indígenas producen telares de cintura teñidos con caracol marino púrpura, uno de los logros obtenidos en la actualidad es la producción de calzados de diseños exclusivos por parte de la marca converse, sabemos que es en la población de Pinotepa de don Luis, a unos 30 minutos de Pinotepa nacional. 
¡Pero bueno!...después de esta reseña histórica nos enfocaremos a hablar de este grupo de crédito, integrado por 10 mujeres de esta población, su líder se llama: Ana Liz Nicolás A., pero en especifico hablaremos de Lucia Matilde O. Nicolás, ella es una joven de 26 años de edad, es soltera y actualmente vive con sus padres, se dedica a la venta de productos naturistas tales como suplementos alimenticios entre otros. 
Lucia desde hace mas de 2 años que inicio con esta actividad, primero consumiendo estos productos, después recomendándolos y distribuyéndolo a la gente, en su testimonio ella nos dice que por un problema de salud inicio el consumo de estos productos mas tarde al ver mejoría en su problema decidió por empezar a venderlos y recomendarlos a la gente, al principio dice que era difícil pero mas tarde se fue haciendo de su clientela hasta colocar su negocio en el lugar que esta actualmente, ella nos comparte que le va muy bien en su negocio y que cada día ha ido mejorando.
Lucia se integro  a un grupo de crédito con el fin de obtener un préstamo de dinero para comprar algunos productos que le hacían falta, ella con este crédito pudo comprar malteadas, fibra, vitaminas, bebidas energizantes, aloe, tratamientos para la gastritis y otros problemas de salud.
Lucia, aspira una casa propia, su esperanza es que su negocio siga creciendo que las ventas no decaigan, porque ella lo que quiere es tener un establecimiento que sea propio para ya no pagar mas rentas, ella nos dice que también le gustaría casarse y tener sus hijos pero no sin antes garantizar la comodidad y el bienestar de ella en primer plano. 
Agradece enormemente a Fundacion realidad por la oportunidad que le brinda al financiar su crédito y que más adelante le sigan ofreciendo su apoyo, porque de no ser por ellos mucha gente solo truncaría sus sueños y proyectos. 

 “Pinotecpan” es un grupo conformado por un total de 10 mujeres, que enseguida se dan a conocer los nombres de las integrantes, así como su actividad personal de cada uno.

Guadalupe M. Martínez.-Venta de productos por catalogo
Ana Liz Nicolás A..- Venta de accesorios para dama
Silvia Hernández López.-Venta de antojitos 
Elia Martínez L..- Venta de antojitos
María Teresa Marroquín Rodríguez.-  Cocina Económica
Erica Nora R. Martínez.- Venta de zapatos
Lucia Matilde O. Nicolás.- Venta de productos naturista
Antonia M. S..- Elaboración de ropa artesanal
Claudia Francisca Marroquín Rodríguez.- Taller de costura
Minerva S. R..- Venta de Antojitos
texts.en:
The Pinotecpan group is located in a well-known neighborhood, in Pinotepa Nacional Oaxaca. The members of the group decided on this name, because of the etymology of Pinotepa; this was the name the town was known by in the colonial era, and it means, "Place where the Pinome lords have their palaces." Pinomes are said to be a savage race that lived here before the conquests of Mesoamerica, and according to research, they came from the northern part of the country and had some qualities from the Sioux indians, also known as the Cherokee. The Pinomes were subjugated by the Mexica/Aztecs, to whom they paid tribute, and who gave them this name. They were thereafter conquered by the Zapoteca culture and finally by the Mixteca, who controlled this area until the Spanish arrived, bringing African slaves and other customs.
It should be noted that Pinotepa was one of the richest areas during the pre-Hispanic and colonial eras; information exists that in Pinotepa, they had the best weaving, production of cocoa, salt, cotton, turkeys, cochineal, and indigo, as well as various bird feathers from those living in the area. We can still observe in the surrounding area that the indigenous towns produce woven belts made with purple snail dye. Currently some of the goods made here are exclusively designed Converse footwear, made in Pinotepa de don Luis, 30 minutes from Pinotepa Nacional.

After this historical overview, we will shift focus to the group, made up of 10 women from this neighborhood. Their leader is Ana Liz N. A., but this request focuses specifically on Lucia Matilde O. N., a young woman, 26 years old, single and living with her parents. She works selling natural products, including food supplements. Lucia started this business two years ago, first using these products, then recommending and distributing them. In her testimony she indicates that she started using these products because of a health problem, and after seeing her health improve, she decided to start selling them and recommending them to people. Initially it was difficult, but she began gaining more customers, until reaching the current level. She says that the business is doing well, and improving every day.
Lucia joined a credit group in order to obtain money to buy some products she needed. With this loan she was able to purchase, shakes, vitamins, energy drinks, aloe, treatments for gastritis and other health problems. 
Lucia dreams of a house of her own. She hopes that her business will continue growing, that her sales don't fall, because she would like to have her own location, where she would no longer have to pay rent. She says that she would also like to get married and have children, but not before first ensuring her comfort and well-being.
She is very grateful to Fundacion for the opportunity to obtain this loan, and hopes to continue to receive their support in the future, because without them, many people would have to give up their dreams and projects.

"Pinotecpan" is a group of 10 women, their names and businesses are as follows:

Guadalupe M. Martínez.-Catalog sales
Ana Liz Nicolás A..- Sale of women's accessories
Silvia Hernández López.- Snack sales
Elia Martínez L..- Snack sales
María Teresa Marroquín Rodríguez.-  Small restaurant
Erica Nora R. Martínez.- Shoe sales
Lucia Matilde O. Nicolás.- Sales of natural products
Antonia M. S..- Handmade clothes
Claudia Francisca Marroquín Rodríguez.- Tailor shop
Minerva S. R..- Snack sales

loans.use: This loan is for the purchase of natural products, including food supplements, shakes, vitamins, minerals, calcium, aloe, tea, cookies and fiber.

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en: Agnes A. sells provisions, drinks and fish at Elmina.  Agnes has received senior high education. She is married and has 6 dependents. Her husband is a farmer. Agnes has been selling provisions, drinks and fish for 10 years. She assists her husband in paying her children's school fees and other expenses of the home. Her loan will be used to buy more food supplies for sale. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to re-invest back into the food selling business.

loans.use: Her loan will be used to buy more food supplies for sale.
